original: ji ltar yongs su dpyod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su dpyod par byed ce na /
translated: How does one investigate?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: dmigs par bya ba'i spyod yul de dag la yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i spyod yul de dag la yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When one correctly conceives those objects that are the domain of perception,

original: yongs su dpyod par byed do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yongs su dpyod par byed do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: one investigates them.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang bzhi po 'di dag la go rims bzhin du lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang bzhi po 'di dag la go rims bzhin du lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi zhes bshad do //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti explains that these four are the four types of insight in order.

original: gsum pa bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhag mthong gi ming gi rnam grangs bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhag mthong gi ming gi rnam grangs bstan pa yin te /
translated: The third verse shows the synonyms of insight.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga'o //🔽de la bzod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga'o // de la bzod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It has five types.

original: khong du chud par bzod pa'o //🔽'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khong du chud par bzod pa'o // 'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Patience is the ability to tolerate understanding.

original: mos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mos par gyur pa'o //
translated: Desire is the desire to understand.

original: shes rab ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is discernment.

original: lta ba ni yongs su tshol ba'o //🔽rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni yongs su tshol ba'o // rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: View is thorough investigation.

original: so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Reflection is the investigation of the meaning of what one has heard.

original: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag kyang don ni gcig la ming ni tha dad par gyur pa yin te /🔽de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las shes rab dang ye shes dang mthong ba dang rig pa dang blo dang rtog pa la sogs pa ni ming gi bye brag yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag kyang don ni gcig la ming ni tha dad par gyur pa yin te / de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las shes rab dang ye shes dang mthong ba dang rig pa dang blo dang rtog pa la sogs pa ni ming gi bye brag yin te /
translated: These five aspects have the same meaning but different names.🔽Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says, “Prajñā, wisdom, seeing, knowledge, mind, thought, and so on are different names for the essence of the discernment of dharmas and mental activities.

original: chos mtshan nyid dang sems las byung ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: chos mtshan nyid dang sems las byung ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The Vyakhyāyudhopama Śāstra also teaches this.

original: gzhi de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste zhes @101a * //
analyzed: gzhi de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste zhes @101a * //
translated: The basis is called insight.

original: bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is a summary.

original: kha cig na re rtsa ba dang gzugs brnyan pa brtan nas mdo'i tshig 'di bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rtsa ba dang gzugs brnyan pa brtan nas mdo'i tshig 'di bstan pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the root and the reflection are stable, and that this passage from the sutra teaches this.

original: de la ji ltar lags par bsams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsa ba nyid kyi chos rab tu ston te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar lags par bsams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsa ba nyid kyi chos rab tu ston te /
translated: In the passage beginning with “How is it that one contemplates the Dharma as it has been contemplated?” it teaches the root itself.

original: nang du ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsa ba la brten nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bstan te /
analyzed: nang du ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsa ba la brten nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bstan te /
translated: The passage beginning Internally, what is called meditative concentration teaches that the image arises in dependence on the root.

original: gzugs brnyan la brten nas so sor rtog par byed pas so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la brten nas so sor rtog par byed pas so //
translated: Because one discriminates in dependence on the image, it is called the image of meditative concentration.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhag mthong gi gzugs brnyan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba'i don rtsa ba las 'byung ba'i yul khong du chud par bstan te /🔽de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhag mthong gi gzugs brnyan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba'i don rtsa ba las 'byung ba'i yul khong du chud par bstan te / de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The passage beginning Thus, by the power of the image of insight teaches that one should understand the object that arises from the root as having the meaning of by the power of the image of insight.

original: rnal 'byor pa des gzugs brnyan brtag pa'i phyir yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin de la yang dag par rtog pa na yon tan dang skyon nges par rtog par byed pa gang yin pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des gzugs brnyan brtag pa'i phyir yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin de la yang dag par rtog pa na yon tan dang skyon nges par rtog par byed pa gang yin pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says, In order to investigate the image, when the yogin correctly understands the nature of the object of understanding, he investigates the determination of its good qualities and faults.

original: mdo'i tshig gzhan bshad pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig gzhan bshad pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: The meaning of the other sūtra passage is as explained above.

original: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par g-yeng ba las brtsams nas /
analyzed: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par g-yeng ba las brtsams nas /
translated: Some say: It is taught from the perspective of concentration and distraction.🔽🔽

original: mdo'i tshig 'di bstan pa yin pas rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di bstan pa yin pas rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Some say: This passage of the sutra teaches the two types of insight beginning with concentration and distraction.

original: lhag mthong gi sbyor ba bstan pa dang / de ltar zhes bya ba man chad kyis rtsa ba'i lhag mthong yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi sbyor ba bstan pa dang / de ltar zhes bya ba man chad kyis rtsa ba'i lhag mthong yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the teaching on the preparation for insight and the second is the teaching on the root of insight.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also twofold:

original: lhag mthong gi gnas bstan pa dang / ji ltar zhes bya ba man chad kyis sbyor ba yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi gnas bstan pa dang / ji ltar zhes bya ba man chad kyis sbyor ba yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the basis of insight and the teaching on the preparation for insight.

original: 'di ltar lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob pas gnas byas pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag mthong skye ba yang gdon mi za bar thos pa dang bsams pa'i sems rnam par g-yeng bas sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob pas gnas byas pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag mthong skye ba yang gdon mi za bar thos pa dang bsams pa'i sems rnam par g-yeng bas sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since one obtains physical and mental pliancy, one is based on that and since insight arises in dependence on concentration, one engages in listening and reflection with a distracted mind.

original: 'dis ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i sbyor ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i sbyor ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the preparation of listening and reflection.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis kyi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur kyang yang thos pa dang / bsams pa'i sems rnam par g-yeng ba 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis kyi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur kyang yang thos pa dang / bsams pa'i sems rnam par g-yeng ba 'byung bas so //
translated: Because the characteristics of the two aspects of calm abiding and insight are different. Even though one has attained concentration, the distracted mind of listening and reflection still occurs.

original: nang du ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sems bsdus nas rnam par mi g-yeng bas nang zhes bya ba'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la bya ba ni ma yin pas de'i phyir nang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nang du ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sems bsdus nas rnam par mi g-yeng bas nang zhes bya ba'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la bya ba ni ma yin pas de'i phyir nang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase internal meditative stabilization means that, by concentrating the mind and not being distracted, one abides in the correct meditative stabilization called internal. This is not the case for the other two. Therefore, the phrase internal is stated.

original: gzhan ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: The other two are as explained above.

original: sbyor ba dang rtsa @101b ba'i gnas skabs de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /🔽dang po ni gzugs brnyan kho na las brtsams nas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang rtsa @101b ba'i gnas skabs de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de / dang po ni gzugs brnyan kho na las brtsams nas so //
translated: In this context of preparation and root, there are also two kinds of explanations.

original: gnyis pa ni rtsa ba dang gzugs brnyan gnyi ga la brten nas te don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rtsa ba dang gzugs brnyan gnyi ga la brten nas te don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The first begins with the mere reflection and the second is based on both the root and the reflection. The meaning is as explained above.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu zhing zhus pa snga ma'i lan du gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu zhing zhus pa snga ma'i lan du gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva is skilled in insight. This is the second part, which concludes the chapter and answers the earlier question.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya then said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams dmigs pa'i sems yul du gyur pa na nang du yid la bgyid pa'i sems ji srid du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de'i bar du yid la bgyid pa de la ming ci zhes bgyi
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams dmigs pa'i sems yul du gyur pa na nang du yid la bgyid pa'i sems ji srid du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de'i bar du yid la bgyid pa de la ming ci zhes bgyi
translated: “Lord, if bodhisattvas, when their minds are focused on an object, are attending to the mind, for as long as they have not attained physical and mental pliancy, what is that attention called?

original: lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang rjes su 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang rjes su 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on is the fourth part, which teaches the gateway to the attention that engages serenity and insight.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhi gnas dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa dang lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa dang lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the attention that is conducive to serenity and the explanation of the attention that is conducive to insight.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The first is twofold: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the request at the beginning.

original: gong du bstan pa ltar dmigs pa'i sems kyis nang gi sems rgyun chags su yid la byed pa na yid la byed pa des ji srid du shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de srid du de'i ming ci zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa ltar dmigs pa'i sems kyis nang gi sems rgyun chags su yid la byed pa na yid la byed pa des ji srid du shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de srid du de'i ming ci zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As explained above, when the mind that has an object of meditation keeps the internal mind in continuous focus, for as long as one does not attain suppleness, that is called attention.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu zhi gnas kyi yid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhi gnas kyi yid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “Son of noble family, this is not attention related to serenity.

original: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lan yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lan yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
translated: It should be said that it is attention concomitant with the aspiration that is in accordance with śamatha.

original: zhi gnas dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It is attention in accordance with śamatha,

original: yang dag pa'i zhi gnas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i zhi gnas ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not correct śamatha,

original: shin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it lacks suppleness.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji srid du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba ma thob pa de'i bar du ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos rnams nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du yid la bgyid na yid la
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji srid du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba ma thob pa de'i bar du ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos rnams nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du yid la bgyid na yid la
translated: Bhagavān, if bodhisattvas, for as long as they have not attained physical and mental suppleness, attend to the images that are the objects of concentration of the phenomena that they have properly contemplated,

original: bgyid pa de la ming ci zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni @102a * //
analyzed: bgyid pa de la ming ci zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni @102a * //
translated: what is the name of that attention?

original: gnyis pa lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pa lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa bstan to //
translated: The second is the attention that is in conformity with insight.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the first, the request.🔽The attention that is the mental image of the object of concentration, which is the Dharma that was previously taught and well contemplated, is the attention that is the avoidance of the signs of the mind.

original: sngar bstan pa ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos rnams nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog pa'i mos pas sems kyi mtshan ma yongs su spangs pa yid la byed pa de dag ji srid du shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos rnams nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog pa'i mos pas sems kyi mtshan ma yongs su spangs pa yid la byed pa de dag ji srid du shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob
translated: As long as one has not attained pliancy,

original: pa de'i bar du ming ci zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa de'i bar du ming ci zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: what is the name of that attention?

original: rigs kyi bu lhag mthong gi yid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu lhag mthong gi yid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Son of noble family, that is not the attention of insight.

original: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second correct answer of the Tathāgata.

original: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
translated: It is attention that is in conformity with insight, but it is not correct insight,

original: shin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs la yod pa kho na nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir ro // mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs la yod pa kho na nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: because it lacks serenity.🔽When this passage from the sutra is applied, it should be understood that serenity and insight exist only in the state of concentration.

original: gzhan yang mdo'i tshig 'dis ni gang du nang gi sems rgyun chags su yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid la de'i sbyor ba yin no zhes bstan pa yang yang dag pa'i don nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo'i tshig 'dis ni gang du nang gi sems rgyun chags su yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid la de'i sbyor ba yin no zhes bstan pa yang yang dag pa'i don nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this passage from the sutra shows that the correct meaning is that the practice of serenity and insight is in the attention that is continuous and internal, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Bhagavān:🔽“Bhagavān, should the path of śamatha and the path of vipaśyanā be called different or should they be called non-different?”

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi lam dang lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi'am tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis gcig pa dang tha dad pa rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo🔽zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi lam dang lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi'am tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis gcig pa dang tha dad pa rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here onward is the fifth chapter, which teaches the section on differentiating whether the paths of śamatha and vipaśyanā are the same or different.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam pa gnyis ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bgrod par bya ba'i gnas dang 'phags pa rnams kyi lam gyi chos rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam pa gnyis ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bgrod par bya ba'i gnas dang 'phags pa rnams kyi lam gyi chos rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir lam zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the first request. The two aspects of śamatha and vipaśyanā are called “paths” because they are the places to which yogins and yoginīs go and because they are the dharmas of the path of the āryas.

original: lam gnyis po de dag gcig pa zhig lags sam tha dad pa zhig lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam gnyis po de dag gcig pa zhig lags sam tha dad pa zhig lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the question is whether these two paths are the same or different.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:🔽Son of noble family, it should be said that they are neither the same nor different.

original: rigs kyi bu tha dad pa @102b yang ma yin tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan yang dag par gsungs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tha dad pa @102b yang ma yin tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan yang dag par gsungs pa bstan to //
translated: This and so on shows the second, the Tathāgata’s correct answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two:

original: zhus pa bzhin du mdor bstan pa dang / dris pa dang lan dag gis rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //🔽ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du mdor bstan pa dang / dris pa dang lan dag gis rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o // ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the brief teaching as asked and the detailed explanation by distinguishing the questions and answers. This is the first.🔽Why are they not different? Because it takes the mind that is the object of insight as its object.

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not not different?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dris pa dang lan dag gis rnam par phye nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dris pa dang lan dag gis rnam par phye nas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the second explanation, which is a response to a question.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of this sutra passage.

original: kha cig na re tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs gnyis la brtan nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs gnyis la brtan nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: Some say that it is taught in relation to two kinds of form: nondifferent and different.

original: de la re zhig dper na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga cig car 'jug pa'i tshe thos pa dang bsams pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i yul la mtshungs par dmigs shing lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems la gzugs kyi yul nyid du dmigs par byed de🔽/ gzugs nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig dper na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga cig car 'jug pa'i tshe thos pa dang bsams pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i yul la mtshungs par dmigs shing lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems la gzugs kyi yul nyid du dmigs par byed de / gzugs nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, for example, when serenity and insight operate simultaneously, the mind that views the object-field of the aspect of the sign of the objective support of learning and reflection is focused on the object-field of form.🔽Because it is similar to form, it is called nondifferent.🔽Nondifferent is said in relation to a reflection.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan las brtsams nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan las brtsams nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Different is said in relation to the object-field of form.

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag dmigs par mtshungs par gyur pa na gzugs brnyan sprul pa gang yin pa de dag so so nas mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag dmigs par mtshungs par gyur pa na gzugs brnyan sprul pa gang yin pa de dag so so nas mi 'dra ste /
translated: Thus, when śamatha and vipaśyanā are the same in their object, the images and emanations are not the same.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzugs brnyan la bye brag yod pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //🔽kha cig na re tha dad pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhi gnas kyi lhag mthong gi dmigs pa thos pa dang bsams pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi yul la dmigs par mi byed mod kyi 'on kyang thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab rnam
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzugs brnyan la bye brag yod pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhe'o // kha cig na re tha dad pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhi gnas kyi lhag mthong gi dmigs pa thos pa dang bsams pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi yul la dmigs par mi byed mod kyi 'on kyang thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab rnam
translated: Because there is a difference between images with and without discursive thought, they are said to be not the same.

original: pa gnyis po de dag gi dmigs pa'i yul la yod pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems la dmigs par byed pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa gnyis po de dag gi dmigs pa'i yul la yod pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems la dmigs par byed pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say, “Not the same” means that, in this way, śamatha and vipaśyanā do not focus on the objects of the representations of the causes of listening and reflection. However, they are not different because they focus on the mind that has the aspect of the view that exists in the objects of the two kinds of objects of observation of the wisdom of listening and reflection.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no zhes zer te /
translated: The meaning of “not the same” and “not different” is as explained above.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis las bshad pa ni phyi ma bzang ste /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis las bshad pa ni phyi ma bzang ste /
translated: Of the two explanations, the latter is better,

original: mdo'i tshig snga ma dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //🔽byang chub @103a * //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig snga ma dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro // byang chub @103a * //
translated: because it accords with the earlier words of the sutra.

original: sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnams kyi gzugs brnyan gang lags pa de dag sems 'di dang tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnams kyi gzugs brnyan gang lags pa de dag sems 'di dang tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Lord, are the images of the objects of insight and concentration different from this mind or not different?”

original: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni drug pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par rig pa tsam du 'byed pa'i sgo'am yang na sems dang yul gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo zhes bya ba
analyzed: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni drug pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par rig pa tsam du 'byed pa'i sgo'am yang na sems dang yul gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo zhes bya ba
translated: From here onward is the sixth chapter, the section that distinguishes calm abiding and insight as mere awareness, or alternatively, the section that distinguishes whether mind and objects are the same or different.

original: ston to // 'di yang rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: ston to // 'di yang rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into six parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa dang brtag pa dang rnam par bshad pa dang lan gsol ba dang spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa dang brtag pa dang rnam par bshad pa dang lan gsol ba dang spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: the request, the answer, the inquiry, the explanation, the reply, and the general indication.

original: 'di ni dang po 'phags pa byams pas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po 'phags pa byams pas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the first, the request of the noble Maitreya.

original: zhu ba gsol ba 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de //
translated: This request also has three explanations.

original: kha cig na re 'dir ni lhag mthong smos nas ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dir ni lhag mthong smos nas ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa zhus pa yin te /
translated: Some say that here, having mentioned insight, he requests the object of samadhi,

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan rnams bstan nas lhag mthong ma bshad pa lta bu dang / mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan rnams bstan nas lhag mthong ma bshad pa lta bu dang / mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: just as in the treatise Compendium of the Mahayana, after the images of the objects of samadhi are taught, insight is not explained, and just as in this very sutra, later on, it says, “They appear as images of samadhi.”

original: kha cig na re 'dir ting nge 'dzin smos nas lhag mthong gi dmigs pa zhus pa yin te gzhan dag nas zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i skyon bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dir ting nge 'dzin smos nas lhag mthong gi dmigs pa zhus pa yin te gzhan dag nas zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i skyon bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: Some say: Here he asks about the object of insight after mentioning concentration, because other sutras teach the faults of the yoga of the ten bases of totality and so on.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa la sogs pa las ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag mthong 'byung ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tshig bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa la sogs pa las ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag mthong 'byung ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tshig bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the treatise Summary of the Great Vehicle says, concentration is called the object of insight because insight arises in dependence on concentration.

original: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dmigs pa'i gzugs brnyan cig car zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dmigs pa'i gzugs brnyan cig car zhus pa yin te /
translated: Some say: He asks about the image that is the object of concentration and wisdom simultaneously.

original: mdo 'di las lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa'i yul zhu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa'i yul zhu ba'i phyir te /
translated: This sutra asks about the object of insight and concentration.

original: zhus pa 'di'i don ni 'di skad du lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul sngon po la sogs pa de dag sems pa 'di dang gcig pa zhig lags sam /
analyzed: zhus pa 'di'i don ni 'di skad du lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul sngon po la sogs pa de dag sems pa 'di dang gcig pa zhig lags sam /
translated: The meaning of this question is: Are those blue, etc., objects of observation of insight and concentration the same as this mind?

original: tha dad pa zhig lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhig lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or are they different?

original: dgongs pa zag mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang mdo 'di dang mthun par ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zag mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang mdo 'di dang mthun par ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sūtra Unraveling the Intention also says in a way that accords with this sūtra that the object of observation of concentration is a reflection.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med @103b kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med @103b kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
translated: Ācārya Svābhāvikśīla’s Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: de la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Here, “concentration” is the nature of the mind being one-pointed on the object of observation.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is a phenomenon that is a mental factor.

original: 'dis dmigs pa'i yul la spyod yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis dmigs pa'i yul la spyod yul zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the “object of observation” because it is the object of observation.

original: rang gi yul gang yin pa de ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul gang yin pa de ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is its object is called “form.”

original: de dang 'dra bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: That which appears to be like that is called a reflection.

original: gzugs brnyan de yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang sbyar na rnam par bsngos pa dang rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan la bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang sbyar na rnam par bsngos pa dang rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan la bya bar bshad do //
translated: That reflection is explained in the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna as referring to the reflection of a corpse that has been discolored, bloated, and so on.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni /
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna, there is one explanation that is different.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bcu las snga ma brgyad ni gzugs yin te /
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bcu las snga ma brgyad ni gzugs yin te /
translated: From among the ten bases of totality, the first eight are form.

original: 'di lta ste sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ngo //
translated: They are blue, yellow, red, white, earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: gzugs rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis rnam pa brgyad las 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni reg bya'i skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis rnam pa brgyad las 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni reg bya'i skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: Those eight types of form are included in the base of tactility according to the scriptures of the Sarvāstivāda.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus par bshad de /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus par bshad de /
translated: The four aspects such as blue are explained to be included in the base of form.🔽

original: de'i gzhung gis chos kyi skye mched ni gzugs las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kho na bsdus par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhung gis chos kyi skye mched ni gzugs las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kho na bsdus par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four types of form such as blue and so on are said to be included in the form base because the treatise master's text includes nonindicative form in the form base.

original: mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni gzugs kyang ma yin sems kyang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni gzugs kyang ma yin sems kyang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes ston te /
translated: The Sautrantikas' treatise, the Principles of Exegesis, teaches that nonindicative form is neither form nor mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus par 'dod pa yang phal cher theg pa chen po dag dang yang mthun te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus par 'dod pa yang phal cher theg pa chen po dag dang yang mthun te /
translated: The form that is the object field gocara of the meditative absorptions is asserted to be included in the phenomena base, which is also mostly in accord with the Mahayana.🔽Therefore the treatise entitled Abhidharmakosa states:

original: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las mdo sde pa dag na re mdo dag las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las mdo sde pa dag na re mdo dag las /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that the sutra that declares:

original: gzugs rnam pha gsum mo zhes gang gsungs pa de yang /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pha gsum mo zhes gang gsungs pa de yang /
translated: There are three types of form

original: rnal 'byor pa dag na re bsam gtan bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de ni mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bstan du med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag na re bsam gtan bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de ni mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bstan du med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Yogācāras say: The form that is the object field of concentration generated by the power of concentration is called unmanifest because it is not the object field of the eye faculty.

original: gnas la mi sgrib pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas la mi sgrib pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called unimpeded because it is not obstructed by the physical basis.

original: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya zhe na /🔽de'i ming bshad pa yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bshad pa @104a * //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya zhe na / de'i ming bshad pa yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bshad pa @104a * //
translated: If that is so, why is it called form?

original: dang mthun no //
analyzed: dang mthun no //
translated: The explanation of its name is similar to the explanation of nonindicative form.🔽Also, sūtra declares that uncontaminated form exists.

original: gzhan yang mdo las zag pa med pa'i gzugs zhes gsungs pa yang rnal 'byor pa dag na re ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus bskyed pa'i gzugs las zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa zhes bshad do zhes
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo las zag pa med pa'i gzugs zhes gsungs pa yang rnal 'byor pa dag na re ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus bskyed pa'i gzugs las zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa zhes bshad do zhes
translated: Yogācāras say: Form generated by the power of concentration is called uncontaminated form when it is based on uncontaminated concentration.

original: 'byung ngo // 'dir theg pa chan po'i zad par gyi skye mched rnam pa bcu'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa dang sbyar na rnam par thar pa la sogs pa las dmigs pa'i yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa de dag ni chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ngo // 'dir theg pa chan po'i zad par gyi skye mched rnam pa bcu'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa dang sbyar na rnam par thar pa la sogs pa las dmigs pa'i yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa de dag ni chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa dag yin no //
translated: Here, if one applies the cultivation of the yoga of the ten aspects of the universal pervasion of the Great Vehicle, the forms that are the objective supports of the liberations, etc. are included in the sense-field of mental objects.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir lhag mthong kho na'i dmigs pa'i spyod yul bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir lhag mthong kho na'i dmigs pa'i spyod yul bstan zhe na /
translated: Here, why is the domain of the objective support of insight alone taught?

original: smras pa / sngar gong du zhi gnas ni sems la dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sngar gong du zhi gnas ni sems la dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: It is said: previously, above, it was explained that calm abiding is only the objective support of the mind.

original: lhag mthong ni yul rnams la dmigs pa'o zhes bshad pa'i shugs kyis zhu ba gsol ba yin pas de'i phyir zhi gnas ma brjod do //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni yul rnams la dmigs pa'o zhes bshad pa'i shugs kyis zhu ba gsol ba yin pas de'i phyir zhi gnas ma brjod do //
translated: Insight is the objective support of objects. Since this question is asked by the force of that explanation, therefore, calm abiding is not mentioned.

original: de ni 'di skad du dmigs pa'i yul dang lhag mthong gcig pa zhig lags sam /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du dmigs pa'i yul dang lhag mthong gcig pa zhig lags sam /
translated: This is as follows: is the objective support of the domain of insight the same as insight, or is it different?

original: tha dad pa zhig lags zhes bya ba'i rigs na ci'i phyir sems dang gcig pa zhig lags sam tha dad pa zhig lags zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhig lags zhes bya ba'i rigs na ci'i phyir sems dang gcig pa zhig lags sam tha dad pa zhig lags zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Since it is appropriate to ask this, why is it said: is it the same as the mind, or is it different?

original: smras pa / sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sems zhes kyang brjod do /
analyzed: smras pa / sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sems zhes kyang brjod do /
translated: It is also called mind because it is associated with mind.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes brjod pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes brjod pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction between the two, because it is similar to the statement that there is only representation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:🔽Son of good family, it should be said that they are not different.

original: rigs kyi bu tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the second brief answer of the Tathagata.

original: yul sems las gud na med pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: yul sems las gud na med pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: He said that they are not different because the object is not separate from the mind.

original: yang dag par ni gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa yang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par ni gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa yang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: But in reality, they are neither the same nor different. He said that they are not different in order to destroy the grasping of difference.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa byang chub sems dpas slar brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa byang chub sems dpas slar brtags pa ste /
translated: Why is that? This is the third investigation by the bodhisattva.

original: dmigs par bya ba de dmigs par byed pa'i sems las gud na yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba de dmigs par byed pa'i sems las gud na yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Does not the object of perception exist apart from the mind that perceives it?

original: gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The fourth explanation of the Tathagata is that the reflection is merely a representation, etc.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: gzhung smos @104b nas yang dag par bshad pa dang / pha rol gyi the tshom bsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhung smos @104b nas yang dag par bshad pa dang / pha rol gyi the tshom bsal ba'o //
translated: the explanation of the text and the removal of the doubts of others.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa las gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa las gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that reflection is a transformation of consciousness.

original: rigs kyi bu ngas rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam las snang bar bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa pha rol kyi the tshom bsal ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ngas rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam las snang bar bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa pha rol kyi the tshom bsal ba ste /
translated: Son of noble family, I have explained that the object of consciousness appears from mere representation. This is the second, the removal of the doubts of others.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis theg ba chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las rnam par rig pa tsam las logs shig na dmigs pa'i yul yod pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi rnam par rig pas rab tu phye'o zhes bshad pa de ni dmigs pa'i
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis theg ba chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las rnam par rig pa tsam las logs shig na dmigs pa'i yul yod pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi rnam par rig pas rab tu phye'o zhes bshad pa de ni dmigs pa'i
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by *Svātantrika says, “The object of observation that exists separately from mere awareness is distinguished by internal awareness.”

original: spyod yul rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don to zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: spyod yul rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don to zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of that is the object that is the domain of observation.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what it is saying.

original: rnam par shes pas dmigs pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig pa tsam las snang ba'i gzugs brnyan yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas dmigs pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig pa tsam las snang ba'i gzugs brnyan yin gyi /
translated: The domain of observation of consciousness is an appearance that is a reflection of mere awareness.

original: logs shig na bdag nyid du gyur pa ni med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: logs shig na bdag nyid du gyur pa ni med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is not something that exists separately as an entity.

original: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam las snang ste gud na yul gyi don du gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam las snang ste gud na yul gyi don du gyur pa ni med do //
translated: Also, in the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by master Vasubandhu, it says, “The object of observation of consciousness appears from mere awareness; it does not exist separately as an object.”

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa smos pa ni ngas rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ni nges par rnam par rig pa tsam la snang gi gud na bdag nyid du gyur pa ni med do zhes bshad pa yang rab tu bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽gzhan yang 'dir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa gsar rnying rnam pa gnyis dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pa'i rigs pa dag kyang brjod par bya'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa smos pa ni ngas rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ni nges par rnam par rig pa tsam la snang gi gud na bdag nyid du gyur pa ni med do zhes bshad pa yang rab tu bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo // gzhan yang 'dir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa gsar rnying rnam pa gnyis dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pa'i rigs pa dag kyang brjod par bya'o /
translated: Moreover, the statement “consciousness” is also a teaching that the domain of consciousness definitely appears as mere representation, and that there is no self-entity apart from that.

original: // / bam po sum cu bdun pa /
analyzed: // / bam po sum cu bdun pa /
translated: Moreover, here we should also mention the reasoning that teaches mere representation in the two versions of the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, the old and the new, in the Proof of Mere Representation, the Commentary on the Buddha’s Ground, and the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de'i spyod yul gzugs brnyan sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba ni gang gsol ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de'i spyod yul gzugs brnyan sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba ni gang gsol ba ste /
translated: The question “Blessed One, if the object of that mind is a reflection and is not different from that mind, how is it that mind itself sees mind itself?” is the request.

original: de ni 'di skad du sems ni dmigs par bgyid pa'i don lags /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems ni dmigs par bgyid pa'i don lags /
translated: This is what it says: “Mind is the object of observation.

original: yul ni brten par bgyid pa'i don lags na /
analyzed: yul ni brten par bgyid pa'i don lags na /
translated: The object is the basis.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag sems dang tha dad pa ma lags par bka' stsal pa lta na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag sems dang tha dad pa ma lags par bka' stsal pa lta na /
translated: But the Bhagavān has said that those objects that are reflections are not different from the mind.

original: ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could the mind itself see the mind itself?

original: 'o na ni 'jig @105a * //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jig @105a * //
translated: But then it would contradict the worldly statement:

original: rten pa dag mig ni rang nyid mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rten pa dag mig ni rang nyid mi mthong ngo //
translated: ‘The eye does not see itself.

original: mdzub mo ni rang nyid mi 'dzug go //
analyzed: mdzub mo ni rang nyid mi 'dzug go //
translated: The finger does not touch itself.🔽The knife does not cut itself.

original: mtshon gyis ni rang nyid la mi gcod do zhes brjod pa dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon gyis ni rang nyid la mi gcod do zhes brjod pa dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would contradict the statement, “The sword does not cut itself.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Ācārya Svābhāvika says in his commentary:

original: ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa'i nus pa dang bdag nyid dang mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa'i nus pa dang bdag nyid dang mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “How could the mind itself see the mind itself?” This shows that the capacity of the agent is not contradictory with itself.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni gal te rnam par shes pa gzhan zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi dngos po byed pa zhig yod na yang rnam par rig pa tsam gyi don 'grub par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni gal te rnam par shes pa gzhan zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi dngos po byed pa zhig yod na yang rnam par rig pa tsam gyi don 'grub par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If there were another consciousness that is the object of consciousness, then the meaning of vijñaptimātra would not be established.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la dmigs pa yul gyi dngos po byed na yang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la dmigs pa yul gyi dngos po byed na yang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the object that is the cause of the appearance of itself, then it would not be established.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na de lta bu'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na de lta bu'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because in the world there is no such aspect.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la chos cung zad gang gis kyang chos cung zad gang yang mthong bar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la chos cung zad gang gis kyang chos cung zad gang yang mthong bar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: “Son of noble family, although no phenomenon whatsoever sees any phenomenon whatsoever,🔽nevertheless, when the mind arises in that way, those reflections appear in that way.”

original: 'on kyang sems de de ltar skyes pa'i tshe gzugs brnyan de dag de ltar rab tu snang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni drug pa de bzhin gshegs pas spyir bstan pa ston to //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems de de ltar skyes pa'i tshe gzugs brnyan de dag de ltar rab tu snang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni drug pa de bzhin gshegs pas spyir bstan pa ston to //
translated: This teaches the sixth, the general indication by the Tathāgata.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul sems las gud na med par bstan pa dang / zhus pa dang len dag gis rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi dmigs pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul sems las gud na med par bstan pa dang / zhus pa dang len dag gis rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi dmigs pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the object of concentration as not being outside of the mind, and the analysis of the object of a distracted mind by way of questions and answers.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye bas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye bas 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is divided into three parts:

original: don dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: don dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: the meaning, the example, and the application of the meaning.

original: 'di ni dang po don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po don bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first explanation of the meaning.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary of Master Svābhāvika,

original: chos cung zad gang gis kyang chos cung zad gang yang mthong bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dis ni brgal bas snga ma'i lan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos cung zad gang gis kyang chos cung zad gang yang mthong bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dis ni brgal bas snga ma'i lan bstan pa ste /
translated: it says, “No dharma whatsoever sees any dharma whatsoever,” which explains the response to the objection.

original: byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without activity.

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Since all dharmas are without activity, they do not come into existence.

original: chos cung zad gang yang med pas byed pa med par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: chos cung zad gang yang med pas byed pa med par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The statement “Since there is not any dharma whatsoever, it is taught to be without activity”

original: chos cung zad gang yang mthong bar mi 'gyur ba de nyid kyis byed pa med par bstan pas so //🔽theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni chos gang gis kyang chos gang yang 'dzin par byed pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos cung zad gang yang mthong bar mi 'gyur ba de nyid kyis byed pa med par bstan pas so // theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni chos gang gis kyang chos gang yang 'dzin par byed pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of that, it is shown that there is no activity.🔽In the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, it is said, “No dharma whatsoever apprehends any dharma.”

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa @105b lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni chos gang gis kyang chos gzhan 'dzin par byed pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa @105b lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni chos gang gis kyang chos gzhan 'dzin par byed pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle translated at the time of Lang, it is said, “No dharma whatsoever apprehends any other dharma.”

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni chos gang yang rtog par mi byed ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni chos gang yang rtog par mi byed ces 'byung ste /
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought, it is said, “Do not conceive of any dharma.”

original: de dag gi tshig tha dad kyang don ni mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshig tha dad kyang don ni mi mthun pa med do //
translated: Although the words are different, there is no contradiction in their meaning.

original: gzhan yang chos gang gis kyang chos gang yang 'dzin par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi sems las gyur pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid med cing yang dag pa'i nus pa gang yang med pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos gang gis kyang chos gang yang 'dzin par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi sems las gyur pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid med cing yang dag pa'i nus pa gang yang med pas so //
translated: Moreover, no dharma whatsoever apprehends any dharma whatsoever. This is because there is no self-nature of mind that is a transformation of the dependent nature, and there is no real power whatsoever.

original: sems de las logs shig na yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sems de las logs shig na yod do zhe na /
translated: If it exists separately from that mind,🔽since there is no real power, how can there be an apprehended object and an apprehending subject?

original: gzhan dag na re yang dag pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin na ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod par 'gyur zhes rgol bas de'i phyir tshig 'di gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yang dag pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin na ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod par 'gyur zhes rgol bas de'i phyir tshig 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Since others object in this way, this verse is stated.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang sems lta bur skyes pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang sems lta bur skyes pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when the dependent nature arises like a mind,

original: de lta bu'i gzugs brnyan dag rab tu snang bas de'i phyir sems des yul du 'dzin par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs brnyan dag rab tu snang bas de'i phyir sems des yul du 'dzin par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: since such reflections appear, therefore that mind is said to apprehend an object.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las 'on kyang sems de de ltar skyes pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams shin tu mthu che ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa gcig la gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis skyes pa phan
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las 'on kyang sems de de ltar skyes pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams shin tu mthu che ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa gcig la gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis skyes pa phan
translated: “However, when the mind arises in that way” means that because phenomena that are dependently arisen are very powerful, two images arise from one aspect of nature.

original: tshun ltos na de nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: tshun ltos na de nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: In terms of their mutual dependence, they are not identical,

original: de nyid dang bral ba yang ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams rkyen gyi mthu las de'i ngo bo nyid chos nyid kyis de ltar skye'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid dang bral ba yang ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams rkyen gyi mthu las de'i ngo bo nyid chos nyid kyis de ltar skye'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: but they are also not separate. Therefore, mental phenomena arise in that way by the power of conditions through the nature of reality.

original: sems de dag yul la dmigs pa'i rigs pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems de dag yul la dmigs pa'i rigs pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The reasoning for how those minds observe objects should be understood in accordance with the teaching in the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las phyi rol gyi gzugs yang dag par med kyang nang gi rnam par shes pa'i yul pha rol gyi sems yang dag par yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las phyi rol gyi gzugs yang dag par med kyang nang gi rnam par shes pa'i yul pha rol gyi sems yang dag par yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, although external form does not exist in reality, is not the object of internal consciousness, the mind of another, real?

original: ci na rang gi dmigs pa ma yin zhes smras /
analyzed: ci na rang gi dmigs pa ma yin zhes smras /
translated: Why do you say that it is not its object?

original: su zhig gzhan gyi sems rang gi rnam par shes pa'i yul la ma zhen zhes zer te /
analyzed: su zhig gzhan gyi sems rang gi rnam par shes pa'i yul la ma zhen zhes zer te /
translated: Who says that the mind of another is not the object of one’s consciousness?🔽It is simply not taught that it is its proximate object.

original: de'i nye ba'i dmigs pa yin par ma bstan pa tsam du zad de 'di ltar rnam par shes pa skyes pa na yang dag par byed pa med pas /
analyzed: de'i nye ba'i dmigs pa yin par ma bstan pa tsam du zad de 'di ltar rnam par shes pa skyes pa na yang dag par byed pa med pas /
translated: When consciousness arises, it does not have a real object,

original: ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po mngon sum du 'dzin pa dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'od kyis phyi rol gyi yul mngon sum du gsal bar byed pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po mngon sum du 'dzin pa dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'od kyis phyi rol gyi yul mngon sum du gsal bar byed pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: unlike the hand and so on, which directly grasp external things, or like the light of the sun, which illuminates external objects.

original: me long la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul lta bur snang bas gzhan gyi sems shes pa @106a * //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul lta bur snang bas gzhan gyi sems shes pa @106a * //
translated: Like a mirror, the mind of another appears as if it were an external object.

original: zhes bya'i / mngon sum du khong du chud pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya'i / mngon sum du khong du chud pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not directly realized.🔽Since the object of direct perception is a transformation of the self, the sutras say:

original: mngon sum gyi dmigs pa ni bdag gi bdag nyid las gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir mdo dag las chos cung zad gang gis kyang chos gzhan 'dzin par byed pa med kyang /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dmigs pa ni bdag gi bdag nyid las gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir mdo dag las chos cung zad gang gis kyang chos gzhan 'dzin par byed pa med kyang /
translated: No phenomenon whatsoever apprehends another phenomenon,

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i tshe de'i mtshan nyid 'dra bar snang bas dngos po de 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i tshe de'i mtshan nyid 'dra bar snang bas dngos po de 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: but when consciousness arises, it appears as if it were the characteristic of that object, and thus it is said to apprehend that object.

original: gzhan gyi sems la dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Just as the mind of another is observed, so too are form and so on.

original: dris pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dris pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis of the questions and answers should be understood according to the treatise itself.

original: rigs kyi bu dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs kyis rkyen byas pas gzugs brnyan mthong yang bdag gis gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du yang sems
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs kyis rkyen byas pas gzugs brnyan mthong yang bdag gis gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du yang sems
translated: Son of noble family, for example, in a perfectly clean mirror, the conditions of form cause a reflection to be seen, but one thinks, “I see a reflection,” and one thinks, “The object of the reflection appears separately from the form.”

original: so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpes bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the second explanation by analogy.

original: me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan nyid kyang de khong du chud par dka' bas de'i phyir 'dir sngar so so'i gzhung gi bshad pa brjod nas /
analyzed: me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan nyid kyang de khong du chud par dka' bas de'i phyir 'dir sngar so so'i gzhung gi bshad pa brjod nas /
translated: The characteristics of a mirror reflection are also difficult to comprehend. Therefore, after previously explaining the individual texts,

original: de'i 'og tu mdo'i tshig 'di nyid yang dag par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mdo'i tshig 'di nyid yang dag par bshad par bya'o //
translated: subsequently, the words of the sūtra should be correctly explained.

original: de la re zhig so so'i gzhung gi bshad pa dang sbyar na gzugs brnyan dang / gzugs nyid na 'brel pa dang / 'brel pa med pa dang btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa la brten nas mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: de la re zhig so so'i gzhung gi bshad pa dang sbyar na gzugs brnyan dang / gzugs nyid na 'brel pa dang / 'brel pa med pa dang btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa la brten nas mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: If we apply these to the explanations of individual texts, in brief, there are five types of explanation:

original: dang po ni 'brel pa med cing rdzas su yod pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni 'brel pa med cing rdzas su yod pa ste /
translated: 1. The first is that it is a reflection and it exists substantially without a relationship.

original: ji ltar gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dag dpe 'di nyid la brten nas srid pa bar ma rnam par mi gzhag pa lta bu dang / mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang / yang dag pa'i rigs dang rjes su mthun pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bye brag tu smra ba dag srid pa bar ma rnam par mi gzhag pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dag dpe 'di nyid la brten nas srid pa bar ma rnam par mi gzhag pa lta bu dang / mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang / yang dag pa'i rigs dang rjes su mthun pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bye brag tu smra ba dag srid pa bar ma rnam par mi gzhag pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the Sthavira school does not posit an intermediate existence on the basis of this example and the treatise on the Abhidharmakośa and the commentary that accords with correct reasoning and the Mahāvibhāṣā do not posit an intermediate existence.

original: me long gi gzugs brnyan la ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i don yod pas gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dag gis kyang de dang mthun par bshad de //
analyzed: me long gi gzugs brnyan la ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i don yod pas gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dag gis kyang de dang mthun par bshad de //
translated: The Sthavira school explains that since the meaning of a reflection in a mirror has an obstruction, it is similar to that.

original: gnyis pa ni 'brel pa med cing rjes su yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'brel pa med cing rjes su yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The second is not related to the object and does not exist as a subsequent entity.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa'i mthu las de ltar mthong bas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi nus pa'i bye brag ni shin tu dpag par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa'i mthu las de ltar mthong bas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi nus pa'i bye brag ni shin tu dpag par dka' ba ste /
translated: Thus, the specific power of the intrinsic reality of things is extremely difficult to fathom, since they are seen in that way due to the power of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis srid pa bar ma rnam par gzhag pa @106b mdzod kyi bstan bcos las rgya cher bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis srid pa bar ma rnam par gzhag pa @106b mdzod kyi bstan bcos las rgya cher bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the extensive presentation of the intermediate existence in the treatise on the levels.

original: gsum pa ni 'brel pa dang bcas shing rdzas su yod pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'brel pa dang bcas shing rdzas su yod pa ste /
translated: The third is related to the object and exists substantially.

original: ji ltar slob dpon 'dus bzang gis srid pa bar ma rnam par gzhag pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi gzhung rnam par 'jig pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon 'dus bzang gis srid pa bar ma rnam par gzhag pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi gzhung rnam par 'jig pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the presentation of the intermediate existence in the treatise of the master Saṅghabhadra, which is explained in the master Vasubandhu’s text called the Refutation.

original: zhib tu bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in detail according to the teaching in the treatise called the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: bzhi pa ni 'brel pa dang bcas shing rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'brel pa dang bcas shing rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The fourth is related to the object but does not exist substantially.

original: so so'i gzhung las tshig 'di yod kyang tshad mar bzung du rung ba'i gtan tshigs nyid ma mthong bas gtugs par bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i gzhung las tshig 'di yod kyang tshad mar bzung du rung ba'i gtan tshigs nyid ma mthong bas gtugs par bya'o //
translated: Although these words are found in their treatises, we do not see any valid reason for accepting them, so we must investigate further.

original: lnga pa ni 'brel pa dang 'brel pa med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ste /🔽btsun pa bar ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni 'brel pa dang 'brel pa med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ste / btsun pa bar ma lta bu'o //
translated: The fifth is the theory of the Venerable Barua, who says that the object of the eye faculty is not related to the eye faculty, and that it does not substantially exist.🔽This is the theory of the Venerable Barua.

original: 'di ni mdo sde pa'i slob dpon gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde pa'i slob dpon gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the third master of the Sautrantikas.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde'i slob dpon ni gsum yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde'i slob dpon ni gsum yod de /
translated: Thus, there are three masters of the Sautrantikas.

original: ku ma ra ta dang / shi ri ra ta dang / btsun pa ra ta'o //
analyzed: ku ma ra ta dang / shi ri ra ta dang / btsun pa ra ta'o //
translated: They are Kumara, Shiri, and the Venerable Barua.

original: mig gi dbang pos yul gzugs la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos yul gzugs la dmigs pa ni /
translated: When the eye faculty observes the object form,

original: rang gi gdong nyid mthong yang gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig mthong ngo snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi gdong nyid mthong yang gzugs brnyan gzhan zhig mthong ngo snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: although it sees its own face, it thinks that it sees another reflection.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las /
translated: In the treatise that accords with correct reasoning,

original: de dag gis brtags pa rgya cher rnam par 'jig pas /
analyzed: de dag gis brtags pa rgya cher rnam par 'jig pas /
translated: their extensive investigations are destroyed.

original: der brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one investigates that, one will understand.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana, there are two explanations.

original: dang po ni mdo nyid kyi nang nas sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i le'u las bstan pa dang sbyar na me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan yod de //
analyzed: dang po ni mdo nyid kyi nang nas sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i le'u las bstan pa dang sbyar na me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan yod de //
translated: The first is that if applied to the teaching in the chapter on mind, thought and consciousness in the sutra itself, the reflection exists in the mirror.

original: de'i phyir mdo 'di nyid las gzhan yang dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa las gal te gzugs shig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //🔽gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'di nyid las gzhan yang dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa las gal te gzugs shig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo // gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
translated: Therefore, this sutra itself says, “For example, if the condition of the appearance of a form is present in a perfectly pure mirror, a reflection will appear.

original: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
