analyzed: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the condition of the appearance of two or more reflections is present,🔽many reflections will appear.”

original: gzugs brnyan yang rab tu mang po dag 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yang rab tu mang po dag 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
translated: And the sutra of the Buddha’s Stages of the Arya says,🔽“The mind is like a painter and karma is like a brush.

original: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor la brten nas gzugs brnyan dag snang ngo zhes bya ba nas gzhan yang dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs kyi rkyen la ltos nas gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa
analyzed: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor la brten nas gzugs brnyan dag snang ngo zhes bya ba nas gzhan yang dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs kyi rkyen la ltos nas gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa
translated: For example, it is said, “The reflection appears in dependence on the round mirror,” and so on, up to “For example, the round mirror is the cause for the appearance of various reflections in dependence on the conditions of form.”

original: yin no // gnyis pa ni mdo 'di nyid las /
analyzed: yin no // gnyis pa ni mdo 'di nyid las /
translated: The second is based on this very sūtra, which says:

original: @107a * // dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs kyis rkyen byas pas gzugs nyid mthong yang bdag gis gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du sems so zhes gsungs pa🔽la sogs pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: @107a * // dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs kyis rkyen byas pas gzugs nyid mthong yang bdag gis gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du sems so zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa la brten nas so //
translated: For example, in a very pure round mirror, form is the condition for seeing form, but the thought “I see a reflection” arises, and the thought “The object of the reflection appears separately from the form” arises.

original: theg pa chen po'i slob dpon rnams kyi bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i slob dpon rnams kyi bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o //
translated: Based on this and so on, the explanations of the Mahāyāna masters are also divided into two types.

original: dang po ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi gzhung ste /
analyzed: dang po ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi gzhung ste /
translated: The first is the text of the master Nāgārjuna.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i mdo'i tshig dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo la sogs pa la brten te me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan snang ba yang bdag nyid logs shig na yod par rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i mdo'i tshig dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo la sogs pa la brten te me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan snang ba yang bdag nyid logs shig na yod par rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: The above passage from the sutra and the noble Buddha's Stage Sutra and so on,

original: mdo sde pa'i gzhung dang rang nyid bzhin mthong ba rnam par 'jig par mdzad de //
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i gzhung dang rang nyid bzhin mthong ba rnam par 'jig par mdzad de //
translated: the Vaibhashika system and the self are destroyed, like seeing a reflection.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las grib ma'i gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs ni tha dad par bshad pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las grib ma'i gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs ni tha dad par bshad pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, in the commentary to the noble Perfection of Wisdom, the form of a shadow and the form of a reflection are explained as different, but that is unreasonable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig gi gsal ba me long yongs su dag pa dang phrad pa de rang gi grib ma mthong bas kyang 'od la sgrib pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan snang bar zad kyi chos gzhan ni ci yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi gsal ba me long yongs su dag pa dang phrad pa de rang gi grib ma mthong bas kyang 'od la sgrib pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan snang bar zad kyi chos gzhan ni ci yang med do zhe na /
translated: The clarity of the eye meets the pure mirror and sees its own shadow, but because it obscures light, it is merely the appearance of a reflection. There is no other phenomenon at all.

original: smras pa / dngos po de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: We say: That thing is not like that.

original: dper na 'bru mar gyi nang du gzugs brnyan snang ba dang po'i gzugs nyid ma yin pa dang / ral gri bsnyal te lta ba'i tshe ni gdong che la bsgreng ste lta ba'i tshe ni gdong mchu rings su 'gyur ba lta bu dang po ni bzhin nyid ma yin pa dang chu shel gyi thig le re re'i nang na gzugs brnyan snang ba lta bu'i bzhin gyi
analyzed: dper na 'bru mar gyi nang du gzugs brnyan snang ba dang po'i gzugs nyid ma yin pa dang / ral gri bsnyal te lta ba'i tshe ni gdong che la bsgreng ste lta ba'i tshe ni gdong mchu rings su 'gyur ba lta bu dang po ni bzhin nyid ma yin pa dang chu shel gyi thig le re re'i nang na gzugs brnyan snang ba lta bu'i bzhin gyi
translated: For example, the reflection of a form in a mirror is not the original form, and when a sword is placed on a stand and looked at, the face appears large, but when it is held up and looked at, the face appears small. The first is not the face itself.

original: gzugs brnyan gcig kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gcig kho na ma yin te /
translated: The reflection of a face is not a single thing, like the reflection of a form in each drop of crystal.

original: rgyu dang rkyen de'i phyir dang po'i gzugs nyid mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen de'i phyir dang po'i gzugs nyid mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: For that reason, the original form is not seen.

original: gzhan yang me long dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i ming dang snang ba yod cing rkyen mang po tshogs pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan 'byung gi /
analyzed: gzhan yang me long dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i ming dang snang ba yod cing rkyen mang po tshogs pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan 'byung gi /
translated: Moreover, a reflection arises because of the existence of a mirror, a person who holds it, and the presence of light, and because of the assembly of many conditions.🔽If the many conditions are not present, a reflection does not arise.

original: rkyen mang po dang ldan par ma gyur na gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ngo zhes bshad de zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen mang po dang ldan par ma gyur na gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ngo zhes bshad de zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: bshad pa 'di dag dang rang gi gdong mthong zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis dpe'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan pa yin gyi theg pa chen po'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dag dang rang gi gdong mthong zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis dpe'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan pa yin gyi theg pa chen po'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: The explanations of this and the statement “one sees one’s own face” are the Sautrantikas’ teaching of the characteristics of a simile, but they are not the meaning of the Mahayana.

original: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung ste /
translated: The second is the teaching of the noble Maitreya.

original: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This also has two explanations.

original: kha cig na re me long gi nang @107b na gzugs brnyan gzhan yod pas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs nas skye ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re me long gi nang @107b na gzugs brnyan gzhan yod pas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs nas skye ba'o //
translated: Some say: A reflection exists as another form within the mirror and the eye consciousness arises in dependence on it, focusing on the reflection.

original: gal te gzugs kho nar zad kyi gzugs brnyan gzhan med na ni lta ba'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig yod par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kho nar zad kyi gzugs brnyan gzhan med na ni lta ba'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig yod par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi /
translated: If it were just form and no other reflection existed, then only the aspect of seeing would exist,

original: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ni med par 'gyur bas 'o na ni dpe dang don 'dra ba med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ni med par 'gyur bas 'o na ni dpe dang don 'dra ba med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: but since the aspect of the reason would not exist, then the error would occur that the example and meaning would not be similar.

original: gzhan yang bstan pa rnams las me long gi gzugs brnyan ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan pa rnams las me long gi gzugs brnyan ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dper bstan pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, in the teachings, the reflection in a mirror is taught as an example of the dependent nature.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dpe bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir nges par gzugs brnyan yod de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dpe bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir nges par gzugs brnyan yod de /
translated: The sky flower is taught as an example of the imagined nature. Therefore, a reflection definitely exists,

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: but it is included in the form base.

original: mdo 'di las ni nges par gzugs las logs shig na gzugs brnyan yod do zhes 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa yin pa de'i phyir gzugs kyis rkyen byas pas gzugs nyid mthong yang bdag gis gzugs mthong ngo snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni nges par gzugs las logs shig na gzugs brnyan yod do zhes 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa yin pa de'i phyir gzugs kyis rkyen byas pas gzugs nyid mthong yang bdag gis gzugs mthong ngo snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul
translated: In this sutra, the apprehension that a reflection definitely exists separately from form is refuted. Therefore, it is said that although form is seen through the condition of form, the mind thinks, “I see form,” and the mind thinks, “The object of my eye consciousness is a reflection that exists separately from form.”

original: gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du sems so zhes bya ba gsungs kyang yang dag pa'i don du na gzugs brnyan dang gzugs nyid ni gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du sems so zhes bya ba gsungs kyang yang dag pa'i don du na gzugs brnyan dang gzugs nyid ni gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But in reality, a reflection and form are neither the same nor different.

original: gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ni gzugs dang gzugs brnyan mi mtshungs la /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ni gzugs dang gzugs brnyan mi mtshungs la /
translated: Because they are not the same, form and its reflection are not the same.

original: tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ni gzugs gzugs nyid mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ni gzugs gzugs nyid mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are not different, it is said that one sees form as form.🔽Some say: A reflection is not different from form.

original: kha cig na re gzugs las gud na gzugs brnyan gzhan med do zhes phal cher mdo sde pa dag dang mtshungs par bdag nyid kyi bzhin mthong ba yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzugs las gud na gzugs brnyan gzhan med do zhes phal cher mdo sde pa dag dang mtshungs par bdag nyid kyi bzhin mthong ba yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They say: It is like the Sautrantikas. One sees one’s own face.

original: 'di ltar rmongs shing nor ba'i phyir bdag gis gzugs brnyan mthong snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du sems par zad kyi yang dag pa'i don du na ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmongs shing nor ba'i phyir bdag gis gzugs brnyan mthong snyam du sems shing gzugs las logs shig na spyod yul gzugs brnyan snang ngo snyam du sems par zad kyi yang dag pa'i don du na ci yang med de /
translated: Because one is confused and mistaken, one thinks, I see a reflection and one thinks, The object field of the reflection appears separately from form. But in reality, nothing exists.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Arya Buddha land commentary states:

original: yang dag par gzugs brnyan me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du yod pa ma yin na ji ltar dper rung zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par gzugs brnyan me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du yod pa ma yin na ji ltar dper rung zhe na /
translated: If a reflection does not exist within the sphere of the mirror, how can it be an example?

original: gzugs dang me long yang yod cing tshogs pa las rkyen byas pa'i phyir mtshan ma de lta bur snang bas de'i phyir dper rung ste /🔽'di ltar sems can rnams phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa gzugs brnyan gyis yongs su bsgos pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu'i phyir dang / me long dang gdong gis rkyen byas pa'i phyir rang gi rnam @108a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang me long yang yod cing tshogs pa las rkyen byas pa'i phyir mtshan ma de lta bur snang bas de'i phyir dper rung ste / 'di ltar sems can rnams phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa gzugs brnyan gyis yongs su bsgos pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu'i phyir dang / me long dang gdong gis rkyen byas pa'i phyir rang gi rnam @108a * //
translated: Because the form and the mirror exist and the collection of conditions is present, the reflection appears in that way. Therefore, it is suitable as an example.

original: par shes pa gyur nas bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan lta bur snang bas des na 'jig rten pa dag mngon ba'i nga rgyal bskyed nas bdag gis me long gi nang du gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems kyang gzugs brnyan gzhan me long gi nang du skyes pa gang
analyzed: par shes pa gyur nas bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan lta bur snang bas des na 'jig rten pa dag mngon ba'i nga rgyal bskyed nas bdag gis me long gi nang du gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems kyang gzugs brnyan gzhan me long gi nang du skyes pa gang
translated: Thus, due to the power of the maturation of sentient beings’ distorted clinging, which is like a reflection, and due to the conditions of the mirror and the face, their consciousness transforms and appears like a reflection of a face. Therefore, worldly people, having generated manifest pride, think, “I see a reflection in the mirror.” However, the reflection is not born in the mirror.

original: yang med de de'i phyir mdo las gzugs brnyan mang po snang ngo zhes gsungs kyi skyes pa zhes ni ma gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yang med de de'i phyir mdo las gzugs brnyan mang po snang ngo zhes gsungs kyi skyes pa zhes ni ma gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: But that is not so. Therefore, the sūtra says that many reflections appear, but it does not say that they are produced.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo dang / mdo 'di nyid kyi nang nas sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i le'u las skye ba zhes bya ba gsungs /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo dang / mdo 'di nyid kyi nang nas sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i le'u las skye ba zhes bya ba gsungs /
translated: If that is so, why does the noble Buddha’s Stage Sūtra and this very sūtra, in the chapter on mind, mentality, and consciousness, say that they are produced?

original: smras pa snang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas skye ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa snang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas skye ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: We say that they are produced from the perspective of appearance.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, Master Niḥsvabhāva says in his Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna:

original: gzhan yang dper na me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs brnyan snang ba gzugs nyid mthong yang bdag gis gud na gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs brnyan snang ba gzugs nyid mthong yang bdag gis gud na gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
translated: “Moreover, for example, when a reflection appears in a mirror, one sees the form itself but thinks, ‘I see a reflection over there.’

original: gzugs brnyan de ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: That reflection is not truly existent.”

original: gzhan yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa las //
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa las //
translated: Moreover, the master Vasubandhu, in his commentary to the Mahayana-samgraha, says:

original: dper na gzugs brnyan ni yang dag par don yod pa ma yin yang gzugs de nyid la gzugs brnyan gyi blo skyed par byed de /
analyzed: dper na gzugs brnyan ni yang dag par don yod pa ma yin yang gzugs de nyid la gzugs brnyan gyi blo skyed par byed de /
translated: For example, a reflection is not really an existent object, but it causes the mind to think of that form as a reflection.

original: gzugs brnyan de'i don logs shig na mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de'i don logs shig na mi dmigs so //
translated: That reflection is not perceived as a separate object.

original: 'di yang de bzhin te zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin te zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is also like that.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa na phye ma bzang ste bstan pa rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa na phye ma bzang ste bstan pa rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there are two explanations, the explanation that is given is better, because it is in accord with the teachings.

original: gzugs brnyan med par bstan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan med par bstan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: There are also two explanations of the teaching that there are no reflections.

original: kha cig na re me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan ci yang med do zhes snga ma bzhin du bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa la sogs pa khungs su bstan nas /
analyzed: kha cig na re me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan ci yang med do zhes snga ma bzhin du bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa la sogs pa khungs su bstan nas /
translated: Some people, citing the Mahayana-samgraha and other treatises, teach that nothing at all is reflected in a mirror.

original: gzugs nyid la gzugs ban gyi blo bskyed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzugs nyid la gzugs ban gyi blo bskyed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is the form itself that produces the idea of a reflected form.

original: kha cig na re me long gis bzhin snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa bzhi yod pas /
analyzed: kha cig na re me long gis bzhin snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa bzhi yod pas /
translated: Some say: The mirror makes the face appear. There are four aspects to this.

original: dang po ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: dang po ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The first is the form derived from the foundation consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa las gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa las gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The second is the aspect of the object derived from eye consciousness.

original: gsum pa ni dus mtshungs par yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dus mtshungs par yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The third is the aspect of the object derived from mental consciousness occurring at the same time.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi gzugs nyid @108b dang gnas mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi gzugs nyid @108b dang gnas mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The form of these three aspects is similar to the mirror.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the aspect of the object derived from the conceptual mental consciousness.

original: rnam pa 'di gcig ni me long dang bzhin la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gcig ni me long dang bzhin la yod pa yin te /
translated: This one aspect exists in the mirror and the face.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos sa mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos sa mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: This is explained in the Abhidharma treatise Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: chos kyi skye mched rnam pa lngas bsdus pa'i gzugs las kun brtags pa'i gzugs nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched rnam pa lngas bsdus pa'i gzugs las kun brtags pa'i gzugs nyid do //
translated: The form that is imagined is the form that is included in the five types of form that are included in the sense base of mental objects.

original: de la dang po rnam pa lnga ni bsdus pa las gyur pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa dang yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba dang dbang 'byor pas bskyed pa dang kun brtags pa'i gzugs so zhe'o //
analyzed: de la dang po rnam pa lnga ni bsdus pa las gyur pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa dang yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba dang dbang 'byor pas bskyed pa dang kun brtags pa'i gzugs so zhe'o //
translated: The first five types of form are form that is derived from the elements, form that is space-like, form that is derived from correct vows, form that is generated by the power of mastery, and imagined form.

original: de la me long dang gzugs dang gzugs brnyan bye brag tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: de la me long dang gzugs dang gzugs brnyan bye brag tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: In this regard, the characteristics of the mirror, the form, and the reflection are explained in different ways.

original: kha cig na re me long ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re me long ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dper bstan pa'o //
translated: Some say that the mirror is an example of meditative concentration.

original: gzugs ni sems kyi rgyal po'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni sems kyi rgyal po'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The form is an example of the king of the mind.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i dper bstan pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i dper bstan pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: The reflection is an example of the sign of the object.

original: de ni 'di skad du sems kyi mthu'i dbang gis ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas sngon po la sogs pa la dmigs par byed kyang /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems kyi mthu'i dbang gis ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas sngon po la sogs pa la dmigs par byed kyang /
translated: This is what they say: “By the power of the mind, one focuses on blue and so on in dependence on meditative concentration.

original: gzugs brnyan de ni sems kyis sprul pa'i phyir sems dang bral bas de'i phyir rang nyid kyis sems mthong ba zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de ni sems kyis sprul pa'i phyir sems dang bral bas de'i phyir rang nyid kyis sems mthong ba zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Because the reflection is created by the mind, it is not separate from the mind. Therefore, it is said that the mind sees itself.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi sa lta ba'i rnam pa mthong ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid mthong ba zhes brjod pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi sa lta ba'i rnam pa mthong ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid mthong ba zhes brjod pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not that the aspect of seeing sees the aspect of seeing. Therefore, it is said that it sees itself.

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par g-yeng ba yang bsdus nas dpe 'di gsungs pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par g-yeng ba yang bsdus nas dpe 'di gsungs pa yin na ni /
translated: If this example is given in order to include concentration and distraction,

original: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: then there are two explanations of this.

original: kha cig na re rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs na yang ting nge 'dzin yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs na yang ting nge 'dzin yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say that even in the state of distraction, concentration exists.

original: don ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs 'dra'o zhe'o //
analyzed: don ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs 'dra'o zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the state of concentration is similar.

original: kha cig na re rnam par g-yeng ba'i nang na me long ni rtsa ba'i gzugs kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par g-yeng ba'i nang na me long ni rtsa ba'i gzugs kyi dpe'o //
translated: Some say that in the case of distraction, the mirror is an example of the fundamental form,

original: gzugs ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i dpe'o //
translated: and the form is an example of the aspect of seeing.

original: gzugs brnyan ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i dpe'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i dpe'o zhe'o //
translated: The reflection is the example of the aspect of the objective cause.

original: kha cig na re me long ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re me long ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i dpe'o //
translated: Some say: The mirror is the example of the aspect of seeing.

original: gzugs brnyan ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The reflection is the example of the aspect of the objective cause.

original: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis rtog pa'i rnam pa'i dper bstan to zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis rtog pa'i rnam pa'i dper bstan to zhes zer te /
translated: The form is taught as the example of the aspect of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de ni 'di skad du bdag nyid kyis rtog pa'i rnam pa'i dbang gis lta ba dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa'i phyir lta ba rgyu mtshan la dmigs par byed kyang rgyu mtshan dang lta ba de dag ni bdag nyid kyis rtog pa dang ma🔽bral ba'i phyir rnam par rig @109a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du bdag nyid kyis rtog pa'i rnam pa'i dbang gis lta ba dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa'i phyir lta ba rgyu mtshan la dmigs par byed kyang rgyu mtshan dang lta ba de dag ni bdag nyid kyis rtog pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir rnam par rig @109a * //
translated: This is what is taught: because of the power of the aspect of the imagination of what is unreal, seeing and the objective cause are transformed into the aspect of seeing and the aspect of the objective cause. Therefore, although seeing is made to have the objective cause as its object, because of the absence of the imagination of what is unreal, the objective cause and seeing are said to be mere representation.

original: pa tsam du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa tsam du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “only” in the statement “mere representation” is explained as follows:

original: de bzhin du sems de skyes pa na ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan tha dad pa 'dra bar rab tu snang ngo zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de skyes pa na ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan tha dad pa 'dra bar rab tu snang ngo zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
translated: This is the third, the application of the example and meaning.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sems de ltar skyes pa na rmongs shing nor ba'i phyir sems las phyi rol na tha dad pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba zhig mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sems de ltar skyes pa na rmongs shing nor ba'i phyir sems las phyi rol na tha dad pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba zhig mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
translated: Thus, when the mind of concentration arises in that way, because of delusion and error, one thinks that one sees different images that are external to the mind.

original: yang dag pa'i don du ni sems kyis yongs su bsgyur ba'i mtshan ma dag ni sems las gud na med pa'i phyir sems zhes bshad kyi sems las logs shig na gzhan zhig mthong ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis sems mthong zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du ni sems kyis yongs su bsgyur ba'i mtshan ma dag ni sems las gud na med pa'i phyir sems zhes bshad kyi sems las logs shig na gzhan zhig mthong ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis sems mthong zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya
translated: In reality, because the signs that are completely transformed by the mind do not exist apart from the mind, they are explained to be the mind. It is not that one sees the mind itself by seeing something else apart from the mind.

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i sems dang spyod yul gzugs brnyan gang lags pa de yang sems 'di dang tha dad pa lags zhes bgyi'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i sems dang spyod yul gzugs brnyan gang lags pa de yang sems 'di dang tha dad pa lags zhes bgyi'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang
translated: The second question is asked by Blessed One, is the object of the mind that focuses on form, etc. which is the natural object of sentient beings, also different from this mind? and so on.

original: lan dag gis rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi dmigs pa rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
analyzed: lan dag gis rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi dmigs pa rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
translated: The answers to these questions teach the analysis of the object of a distracted mind.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request to ask and the answer.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the first request to ask:

original: de la zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: de la zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: The intention of the request is that the Bhagavān has said that the object of concentration is:

original: sems can rnams ni rtsol ba med par rang bzhin du gnas pa'i sems kyis gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs so zhes gsungs na gzugs brnyan rnams kyi yul gang lags pa de yang sems 'di dang tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi 'am zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rtsol ba med par rang bzhin du gnas pa'i sems kyis gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs so zhes gsungs na gzugs brnyan rnams kyi yul gang lags pa de yang sems 'di dang tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi 'am zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: If it is said that sentient beings observe forms and so on with a mind that naturally abides without effort, then is the object of those reflections also not different from this mind?

original: go rigs kyi bu tha dad pa ma yin pa yang byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni gzugs brnyan rnams la rnam par rig pa tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so zhes bya ba
analyzed: go rigs kyi bu tha dad pa ma yin pa yang byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni gzugs brnyan rnams la rnam par rig pa tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so zhes bya ba
translated: Son of good family, those with childish, mistaken minds are not aware that reflections are mere cognition, and so they think in a mistaken way.

original: ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second, the Tathāgata’s reply.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi dmigs pa yang sems las gud na med kyang 'di ltar byis pa rnams sems nor par gyur pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan sems las phyi rol du gyur pa yin par sems se zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi dmigs pa yang sems las gud na med kyang 'di ltar byis pa rnams sems nor par gyur pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan sems las phyi rol du gyur pa yin par sems se zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of a distracted mind also does not exist apart from the mind. However, because childish beings are mistaken about the mind, they think that reflections are external to the mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rig pa tsam du gsungs pa la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rig pa tsam du gsungs pa la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the intention of the Bhagavat when he teaches vijñapti-mātra?

original: smras pa / bstan bcos @109b shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos @109b shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las /
translated: It is said in the Hundred Thousand:

original: ji skad du mdo dag las rnam par rig ba tsam mo zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgoms nas phyi rol gyi don spang ba'i ched du ste /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo dag las rnam par rig ba tsam mo zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgoms nas phyi rol gyi don spang ba'i ched du ste /
translated: “In the sūtras, it is said, ‘vijñapti-mātra.’ This is in order to meditate on vijñapti-mātra and abandon external objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don spangs na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems nye bar zhi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don spangs na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems nye bar zhi bar 'gyur la /
translated: When external objects are abandoned, the unreal mind is pacified.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems zhi ba'i phyir ni dbu ma'i lam rtogs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir mdo dag las /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems zhi ba'i phyir ni dbu ma'i lam rtogs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir mdo dag las /
translated: Because the unreal mind is pacified, one realizes the middle path. Therefore, in the sūtras,

original: yul nyid sems tsam du ni ma shes na //
analyzed: yul nyid sems tsam du ni ma shes na //
translated: it is said, ‘Not knowing that objects are mind only,

original: rnam rtog rnam gnyis rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnam gnyis rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: the two kinds of conceptualization arise.

original: yul nyid sems tsam du ni rtogs gyur na //
analyzed: yul nyid sems tsam du ni rtogs gyur na //
translated: When one knows that objects are mind only,

original: rnam par rtog pa dag ni skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dag ni skye mi 'gyur //
translated: conceptualization does not arise.

original: chos rnams sems tsam du ni rig gyur na //
analyzed: chos rnams sems tsam du ni rig gyur na //
translated: When one knows that phenomena are mind only,

original: phyi rol don gyi mtshan ma spong 'gyur te //
analyzed: phyi rol don gyi mtshan ma spong 'gyur te //
translated: The signs of external objects are abandoned.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa rab zhi nas //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa rab zhi nas //
translated: Therefore, conceptualization is completely pacified.

original: mnyam nyid yang dag stong pa go bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam nyid yang dag stong pa go bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: One understands the equality of reality, emptiness.

original: byis ba so so'i skye bo dag ni yul gyi rol mngon par zhen nas 'dod pa rnams kyi bde ba myong zhing gtong ba'i sems med pas 'khor bar 'khor zhing srid pa gsum gyi rgya mtshor bying nas sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad pa myong bas rnam par
analyzed: byis ba so so'i skye bo dag ni yul gyi rol mngon par zhen nas 'dod pa rnams kyi bde ba myong zhing gtong ba'i sems med pas 'khor bar 'khor zhing srid pa gsum gyi rgya mtshor bying nas sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad pa myong bas rnam par
translated: Foolish ordinary beings, strongly attached to the taste of objects, experience the pleasures of desire and have no mind to let go. Therefore, they cycle in saṃsāra, sink in the ocean of the three existences, and experience extremely unbearable suffering.

original: grol bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pas na de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje dang thabs kyis chos rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pas phyi rol gyi yul du 'dzin pa spong bar mdzad do //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pas na de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje dang thabs kyis chos rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pas phyi rol gyi yul du 'dzin pa spong bar mdzad do //
translated: Since they lack the cause of complete liberation, the Tathāgata, with compassion and skillful means, taught the Dharma as mere cognition, causing them to abandon the apprehension of external objects.

original: phyi rol gyi yul spangs pa nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang nye bar zhi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul spangs pa nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang nye bar zhi bar 'gyur la /
translated: By abandoning external objects, unreal consciousness is also completely pacified.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i phyir mdo dag las /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i phyir mdo dag las /
translated: Nirvana is attained through the pacification of unreal consciousness. Therefore, it is said in the sutra:

original: dper na 'jig rten sman pa mkhas pa dag //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten sman pa mkhas pa dag //
translated: Just as a skilled physician

original: sman rab nad rnams yongs su bsal ba ltar //
analyzed: sman rab nad rnams yongs su bsal ba ltar //
translated: gives the best medicine to cure the disease,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du //🔽sems can dag gi ched du sems tsam bshad //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du // sems can dag gi ched du sems tsam bshad //
translated: so the Tathagatas,

original: ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: ces 'byung ste /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings, teach only mind.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in that same text.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of vijnaptimatra should be understood according to the treatises like the Siddhi.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Maitreya Bodhisattva again addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das ci tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad bdun pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zung du bsgom pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad bdun pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zung du bsgom pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: The Bhagavan, up to in what way is a bodhisattva said to cultivate insight exclusively? teaches the seventh chapter, called The Way to Cultivate Serenity and Insight Together.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan @110a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan @110a * //
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Ornament of Mahayana Sutras,🔽it says:

original: las ; de la cha gcig bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: las ; de la cha gcig bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cultivating one part is as follows.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong so so nas bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong so so nas bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cultivating serenity and insight separately.

original: zung du bsgom ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zung du bsgom ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cultivating them together is as follows.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'dres par bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'dres par bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is cultivating serenity and insight in combination.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two:

original: spyi dang bye brag tu bsgom pa bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags zhes bya ba man chad kyis dmigs pa gsum gyi bye brag bzlas te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag tu bsgom pa bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags zhes bya ba man chad kyis dmigs pa gsum gyi bye brag bzlas te bstan pa'o //
translated: teaching cultivation in general and in particular, and teaching the three objects of meditation by way of a repetition beginning with the question, Bhagavan, what are the signs of mind?

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The first is also threefold:

original: gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa bstan pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis cig car 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa bstan pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis cig car 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: 1. The teaching on the cultivation of insight alone; 2. The teaching on the simultaneous practice of serenity and insight.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag re re la yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa yod pas 'di ni dang po lhag mthong las brtsams nas byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag re re la yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa yod pas 'di ni dang po lhag mthong las brtsams nas byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: Each of these three has a question and an answer. This is the first question of the Bodhisattva, which begins with insight.

original: 'di ni lhag mthong bsgom pa'i spyod pa dang / shes pa'i tshad zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lhag mthong bsgom pa'i spyod pa dang / shes pa'i tshad zhus pa yin no //
translated: This is the question about the practice and the measure of knowledge of the cultivation of insight.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the Bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu rgyun chags su yid la byed pa gang gis sems kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyun chags su yid la byed pa gang gis sems kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
translated: “Son of good family, it is the continuous mental attention by which one attends to the signs of the mind.” This is the second correct answer of the Tathagata.

original: 'di ltar rgyun chags su yid la byed pa thos pa dang / bsams pa'i shes rab dang bcas pa'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun chags su yid la byed pa thos pa dang / bsams pa'i shes rab dang bcas pa'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, it is the aspect of the sign of the mind that is the cause of the mind together with the wisdom that comes from hearing and reflection, and is continuous.

original: sngar sems kyi mtshan ma spangs pa zhes gsungs pa de dang 'di bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sngar sems kyi mtshan ma spangs pa zhes gsungs pa de dang 'di bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and the previous mention of the sign of the mind?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / sems kyi mtshan mar mtshungs kyang 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / sems kyi mtshan mar mtshungs kyang 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin la /
translated: Although the sign of the mind is the same in both cases, this is explained from the point of view of the dominant condition,

original: de ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir bye brag yod do //
analyzed: de ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir bye brag yod do //
translated: while the previous one is explained from the point of view of the appropriating cause.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni lhag mthong de'i rjes su mthun par gyur cing sems kyi mtshan ma rgyun mi 'chad ba zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni lhag mthong de'i rjes su mthun par gyur cing sems kyi mtshan ma rgyun mi 'chad ba zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, insight is explained in a way that accords with that, and it is said that the sign of the mind is uninterrupted.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa'i gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhi gnas bsgom pa kho na zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa'i gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhi gnas bsgom pa kho na zhus pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, to what extent is a bodhisattva's cultivation of tranquility one-sided? This is the second question, about the cultivation of tranquility alone.

original: rigs kyi bu rgyun chags su yid la byed ba gang gis bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas @110b rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bar chad med par yid la byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyun chags su yid la byed ba gang gis bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas @110b rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bar chad med par yid la byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is the uninterrupted mental attention by which one attends to the mind without interruption. This is the second. The Tathāgata says in the Stage of Practice: Uninterrupted mental attention is as follows:🔽It is the uninterrupted, continuous engagement at all times.

original: dus thams cad du bar chad med par rgyun du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun chags la bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du bar chad med par rgyun du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun chags la bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that uninterrupted refers to continuity, because it is uninterrupted.

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas kyis sems rnam par mi g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir sems la dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas kyis sems rnam par mi g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir sems la dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, it is only the object of the mind, because tranquility makes the mind undistracted.

original: gzhan yang bar chad med pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni de'i gong ma bar chad med pa'i sems dmigs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bar chad med pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni de'i gong ma bar chad med pa'i sems dmigs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the so-called uninterrupted mind is the uninterrupted mind that is the object of the preceding [mind].

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma bzang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma bzang ngo //
translated: Although there are explanations in two ways like this, the former explanation is better.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni sems kyi mtshan ma rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni sems kyi mtshan ma rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought, it says, “The uninterrupted signs of mind.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te /
translated: Blessed One, to what extent do the two, śamatha and vipaśyanā, become mixed for a bodhisattva?🔽To what extent do they become evenly and fully united?”

original: mnyam par zung du 'jug pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gnyi ga cig car du 'jug ba'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par zung du 'jug pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gnyi ga cig car du 'jug ba'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the third question, asking about the defining characteristics of the simultaneous engagement of the two.🔽“Son of noble family, it is when the mind is correctly attended to as one-pointed.”

original: rigs kyi bu gang gis sems rtse gcig pa nyid yang dag par yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis ba de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gang gis sems rtse gcig pa nyid yang dag par yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis ba de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second reply of the Tathāgata.

original: de la sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for the one-pointedness of mind, it is as follows:

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cig car 'jug cing yul la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cig car 'jug cing yul la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the simultaneous engagement of calm abiding and insight, and the focus on an object.

original: tshig 'di gcig kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas kha cig na re sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rnam par rig pa tsam kho na ste yul ni sems las logs shig na med pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces
analyzed: tshig 'di gcig kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas kha cig na re sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rnam par rig pa tsam kho na ste yul ni sems las logs shig na med pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces
translated: As for the one-pointedness of mind, some say that it is only the relative, mere cognition, because the object does not exist separately from the mind, and therefore it is called the one-pointedness of mind.

original: bya'o // yang na sems rtse gcig pa kho nang zad pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // yang na sems rtse gcig pa kho nang zad pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Or, it is called the one-pointedness of mind because it is the mere one-pointedness of mind.

original: yang na sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par yang rnam par rig pa tsam kho na ste /
analyzed: yang na sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par yang rnam par rig pa tsam kho na ste /
translated: Or, the one-pointedness of mind is also the ultimate mere cognition.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni de kho na nyid gcig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni de kho na nyid gcig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Thus, the one-pointedness of mind is said to be the nature of the single reality of all phenomena.

original: kha cig na re nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gtogs pas /
analyzed: kha cig na re nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gtogs pas /
translated: Some say that the one-pointedness of mind belongs to the relative.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing a Direct Realization of Representation-Only says:

original: rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, that which is the nature of representation is, in brief, twofold.

original: dang po ni kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: dang po ni kun rdzob ste /
translated: The first is conventional,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the nature of the other-dependent.

original: gnyis pa ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The second is ultimate,

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: the nature of the perfected.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni @111a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni @111a * //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: sems la sems rtse gcig tu rtog pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems la sems rtse gcig tu rtog pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “One-pointedly observe the mind.🔽“Bhagavan, what are the signs of mind?” and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag bzlas te bstan pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag bzlas te bstan pa ston to //
translated: This passage teaches the second type, which is a repetition of the above teaching, a differentiation of the three types of objects of observation.

original: 'di yang dmigs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang dmigs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three types by the very teaching of the three types of objects of observation.

original: 'di ni dmigs pa dang po zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa dang po zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the first question about the objects of observation.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is as follows: the object of meditation that is a conceptual image is the object of observation for insight.

original: gong du ji skad bstan pa'i sems kyi mtshan ma nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan yang yin la lhag mthong gi sems kyi spyod yul yang yin pas so //
analyzed: gong du ji skad bstan pa'i sems kyi mtshan ma nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan yang yin la lhag mthong gi sems kyi spyod yul yang yin pas so //
translated: The sign of the mind that was taught above is both the object of meditation that is an image and the object of observation for the mind of insight.

original: bcom ldan 'das bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa gnyis pa zhus pa bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa gnyis pa zhus pa bstan to //
translated: The second object of observation is taught by the question, “Blessed One, what is the mind that is without obstacles?” and so forth.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste ;
translated: Son of noble family, it is as follows:

original: gzugs brnyan de la dmigs pa'i sems zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de la dmigs pa'i sems zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: The mind that observes that image is the object of observation for śamatha.

original: gzugs brnyan de la dmigs pa thos pa dang bsams pa shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i spyod yul yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de la dmigs pa thos pa dang bsams pa shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i spyod yul yin pas so //
translated: The mind that is concomitant with the two kinds of wisdom, that derived from hearing and that derived from contemplation, and that has the aspect of the reason for the reflection is the object-field of the meditative concentration of the reflection.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa gsum pa zhus pa bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa gsum pa zhus pa bstan to //
translated: The question concerning the third object-field is indicated by the passage beginning with the words, “Blessed One, what is one-pointedness of mind?”

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is as follows:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul de la 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes rtogs pa ste de rtogs nas kyang de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul de la 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes rtogs pa ste de rtogs nas kyang de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata has explained that the realization that the object-field of meditative concentration is mere representation, and the attention to suchness that follows from that realization,

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe chos rnams ni rnam par rig pa las gud na med do zhes rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe chos rnams ni rnam par rig pa las gud na med do zhes rtogs pa ste /
translated: is because at that time one realizes that phenomena are not separate from representation.

original: de ltar rtogs nas kyang de bzhin nyid yid la byed de /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs nas kyang de bzhin nyid yid la byed de /
translated: And having realized that, one attends to suchness.

original: snga ma'i sgo gnyis kyis ni sems dang yul tha dad par rtogs pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cig car mi 'jug par bstan la /
analyzed: snga ma'i sgo gnyis kyis ni sems dang yul tha dad par rtogs pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cig car mi 'jug par bstan la /
translated: The first two doors show that śamatha and vipaśyanā do not simultaneously engage because the mind and objects are realized to be different.

original: sgo gsum pa 'dis ni sems dang yul la 'dres par dmigs shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cig car 'jug par bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgo gsum pa 'dis ni sems dang yul la 'dres par dmigs shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cig car 'jug par bstan pas so //
translated: This third door shows that śamatha and vipaśyanā simultaneously engage because the mind and objects are observed to be mixed.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi la gnyi ga cig car 'jug pa rgya @111b cher bshad pa ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi la gnyi ga cig car 'jug pa rgya @111b cher bshad pa ni /
translated: The simultaneous engagement of both śamatha and vipaśyanā is explained extensively

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: in the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid rgya cher bshad pa yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid rgya cher bshad pa yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the one-pointed mind is also to be understood as taught in the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Buddha:

original: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni brgyad pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni brgyad pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes ston to //
translated: This is the eighth chapter, called The Analysis of the Aspects of Serenity and Insight.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This chapter is also divided into two parts:

original: lhag mthong bstan pa dang / zhi gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong bstan pa dang / zhi gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on insight and the teaching on serenity.

original: lhag mthong bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The teaching on insight is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: This is the first part, the request.🔽The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya, Son of good family, in brief, there are two kinds.

original: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa bstan to //
translated: This is the second part, the reply of the Tathagata.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: grangs smos pa dang / ming bkod pa dang / rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: grangs smos pa dang / ming bkod pa dang / rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
translated: the statement of the number, the listing of the names, and the detailed explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su tshol ba'i lhag mthong dang / so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su tshol ba'i lhag mthong dang / so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: The second is the enumeration of the names of the three types of insight, i.e., insight with signs, insight of thorough searching, and insight of thorough differentiation.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa rnam par phye nas bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa rnam par phye nas bshad pa ston to //
translated: The third is the explanation of the three types of insight, i.e., insight with signs, etc.

original: 'di yang mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three types by the teaching of the three characteristics.

original: 'di ni dang po'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question about the first characteristic.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:🔽Insight is the attention given to the mere image with conceptualization that is the domain of samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'ba' zhig yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dang po mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'ba' zhig yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dang po mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the correct explanation of the first characteristic.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan chos dang don 'dra ba 'ba' zhig yid la byed pas na yul las ming du btags pa yin pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan chos dang don 'dra ba 'ba' zhig yid la byed pas na yul las ming du btags pa yin pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “with signs” because it is named after its object, since it is a conceptual image that is similar to the object and the phenomenon.🔽What is discerning that seeks?

original: yongs su tshol ba'i lhag mthong gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i lhag mthong gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: It is discerning that is attention🔽in order to understand well

original: shes rab kyis de dang der shin tu legs par ma rtogs pa'i chos thams cad shin tu legs par rtogs par @112a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyis de dang der shin tu legs par ma rtogs pa'i chos thams cad shin tu legs par rtogs par @112a * //
translated: all phenomena that have not been understood well.

original: bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag bar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag bar bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the correct explanation of the second characteristic.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi dbang gi phyir gzugs brnyan mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i yul legs par ma rtogs pa dag legs par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi dbang gi phyir gzugs brnyan mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i yul legs par ma rtogs pa dag legs par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is attention in order to understand well those objects that have not been understood well, because of the power of wisdom.🔽What is discerning that is satisfied?

original: so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa zhus pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa zhus pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the third question.🔽It is discerning insight of mental attention

original: shes rab kyis de dang der shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos thams cad la legs par shin tu rnam par grol ba mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyis de dang der shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos thams cad la legs par shin tu rnam par grol ba mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because of seeing thorough liberation through the wisdom that thoroughly understands all dharmas in this and that way.

original: yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the correct explanation of the third characteristic.

original: 'di ltar yul de dag shin tu legs par rtogs par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul de dag shin tu legs par rtogs par gyur nas /
translated: Thus, having thoroughly understood those objects,

original: shin tu rnam par grol ba thob par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par grol ba thob par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is mental attention for the sake of attaining thorough liberation.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang phal cher mdo 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang phal cher mdo 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra also explains discerning insight for the most part in accordance with this sūtra.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that treatise says:

original: mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na /
translated: What is discerning insight that is applied to mere signs?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: gang gis thos pa dang bzung ba'i chos sam /
analyzed: gang gis thos pa dang bzung ba'i chos sam /
translated: The Dharma that is heard and retained,

original: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i chos rnam sla mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa las /🔽tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing sems par mi byed /🔽rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i chos rnam sla mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa las / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing sems par mi byed / rtog par mi byed /
translated: the Dharma of instruction and teaching,🔽is not properly attended to, reflected upon,🔽contemplated,

original: 'jal bar mi byed nye bar rtog bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jal bar mi byed nye bar rtog bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: investigated, or fully investigated.

original: de ni mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called insight that is merely engaged in the aspects.

original: gang gi tshe sems par byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems par byed /
translated: When one reflects,

original: rtog par byed /
analyzed: rtog par byed /
translated: contemplates,🔽investigates, and fully investigates,

original: 'jal bar byed nye bar rtog par byed pa de'i tshe na ni yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jal bar byed nye bar rtog par byed pa de'i tshe na ni yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called insight that is engaged in thorough investigation.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid la bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing nye bar brtags nas ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog par byed pa'i tshe na ni so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid la bsams shing brtags la gzhal zhing nye bar brtags nas ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog par byed pa'i tshe na ni so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no
translated: When you reflect on thatness, examine it, evaluate it, and investigate it, and when you discern it just as it is, that is called insight that engages through discernment.

original: // zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: // zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The divisions of serenity and insight should be understood according to the explanation in the Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that text says:

original: zhi gnas gang zhe na sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas gang zhe na sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: What is serenity? It is the nine mental states.

original: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight?

original: de ni gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi lhag mthong dang / rnam pa bzhi'i lhag mthong dang / gzhi rnam pa drug rab tu dbye ba la @112b dmigs pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi lhag mthong dang / rnam pa bzhi'i lhag mthong dang / gzhi rnam pa drug rab tu dbye ba la @112b dmigs pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is discerning the three objects, discerning the four objects, and discerning the six objects.

original: de la gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi lhag mthong ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su tshol ba'i lhag mthong dang / so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi lhag mthong ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su tshol ba'i lhag mthong dang / so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong ngo //
translated: The insight of the three kinds of objects is the insight of the sign, the insight of thorough search, and the insight of discernment.

original: rnam pa bzhi'i lhag mthong ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'i lhag mthong ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The insight of the four kinds of objects is as follows:

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su rtog pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su rtog pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa'i rnam pa'i lhag mthong ngo //
translated: The insight of the aspect of differentiation of phenomena, the insight of the aspect of thorough differentiation, the insight of the aspect of thorough investigation, and the insight of the aspect of thorough analysis.

original: gzhi rnam pa drug rab tu dbye ba la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong ni /
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa drug rab tu dbye ba la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong ni /
translated: The insight of the six kinds of objects is as follows:

original: don la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / dngos po la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang ; mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / phyogs la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / dus la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / rigs la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / dngos po la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang ; mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / phyogs la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / dus la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong dang / rigs la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is insight that focuses on the meaning, insight that focuses on things, insight that focuses on characteristics, insight that focuses on categories, insight that focuses on time, and insight that focuses on types.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du ston te /
translated: The Vyakhyayukti teaches this.

original: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu dang gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi lhag mthong dang / rnam pa bzhi'i lhag mthong ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu dang gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi lhag mthong dang / rnam pa bzhi'i lhag mthong ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The four kinds of insight that focus on the nine mental states and the three foundations were explained earlier.

original: gzhi rnam pa drug gi lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa drug gi lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here we will explain the six kinds of insight that focus on the six foundations.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las de la gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las de la gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong gang zhe na /
translated: Thus, the Yogacarabhmi says, What is insight that focuses on the six foundations?

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: It is as follows.

original: yongs su tshol bar byed pa na gzhi rnam pa drug yongs su tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: yongs su tshol bar byed pa na gzhi rnam pa drug yongs su tshol bar byed de /
translated: When he investigates, he investigates six topics:

original: don dang dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang phyogs dang dus dang rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed cing /
analyzed: don dang dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang phyogs dang dus dang rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed cing /
translated: meaning, fact, definition, reason, time, and viewpoint.

original: yongs su btsal nas kyang de dag la so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su btsal nas kyang de dag la so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: Having investigated, he discerns them individually.

original: de la ji ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he investigate meaning?

original: smras pa / 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes de ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes de ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: He investigates meaning by thinking, “This is the meaning of this word.”

original: ji ltar dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he investigate fact?

original: dngos po rnam pa gnyis po nag gi dang phyi rol gyi ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa gnyis po nag gi dang phyi rol gyi ste /
translated: There are two kinds of facts: internal and external.

original: de ltar dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus he investigates fact.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he investigate definition?

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis po rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis po rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: There are two kinds of definitions: specific and general.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus he investigates definition.

original: ji ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
