analyzed: ji ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he investigate the subject?🔽He investigates the subject in two ways: in terms of the dark side and in terms of the bright side.

original: phyogs rnam pa gnyis po nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs te nag po'i phyogs ni skyon dang nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas so //🔽dkar po'i phyogs ni yon tan dang @113a * //
analyzed: phyogs rnam pa gnyis po nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs te nag po'i phyogs ni skyon dang nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas so // dkar po'i phyogs ni yon tan dang @113a * //
translated: The dark side is investigated in terms of faults and disadvantages.

original: phan yon gyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: phan yon gyi sgo nas te /
translated: The bright side is investigated in terms of virtues and benefits.

original: de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus he investigates the subject.

original: ji ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he investigate the object?

original: dus rnam pa gsum po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus te /
analyzed: dus rnam pa gsum po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus te /
translated: He investigates the object in three ways: in terms of the past, future, and present.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus na 'di lta bu zhig byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus na 'di lta bu zhig byung bar gyur to //
translated: He thinks: “In the past, such and such occurred.”

original: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He thinks: “In the future, such and such will occur.”

original: 'di ltar da ltar byung ba'i dus na 'di lta bu zhig da ltar yod do zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar byung ba'i dus na 'di lta bu zhig da ltar yod do zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: He thinks: “In the present, such and such exists.” Thus he investigates the object.

original: ji ltar rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he investigate the reason?

original: rigs pa bzhi po ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi po ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
translated: The four principles are the principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of logical possibility, and the principle of reality.

original: de ltar rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus he seeks the principles.

original: ci'i phyir gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug gis lhag mthong rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug gis lhag mthong rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is insight presented as a sixfold division of the bases?

original: rtogs pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtogs pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is based on three kinds of understanding:

original: smras pa'i don rtogs pa dang dngos po'i mtha' rtogs pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa'i don rtogs pa dang dngos po'i mtha' rtogs pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: understanding the meaning of statements, understanding the limits of existence, and understanding reality as it is.

original: de la don yongs su tshol bas ni smras pa'i don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la don yongs su tshol bas ni smras pa'i don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: By seeking the meaning, one understands the meaning of statements.

original: dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bas ni dngos po'i mtha' rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bas ni dngos po'i mtha' rtogs pa yin no //
translated: By seeking the thing and seeking the essence, one understands the limits of existence.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol ba dang / phyogs yongs su tshol ba dang / dus yongs su tshol ba dang / rigs pa yongs su tshol bas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol ba dang / phyogs yongs su tshol ba dang / dus yongs su tshol ba dang / rigs pa yongs su tshol bas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The correct understanding of the object of knowledge is by means of the four investigations: the investigation of the general characteristics, the investigation of the specific characteristics, the investigation of the various kinds, and the investigation of the order and number.

original: rnal 'byor pas shes par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas shes par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of knowledge is just this:

original: smras pa'i don dang shes bya'i dngos po ji snyed yod pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid gang yin pa de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: smras pa'i don dang shes bya'i dngos po ji snyed yod pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid gang yin pa de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the meaning of what is said and the nature of the knowable, both its existence and its non-existence.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the Compendium of the Mahāyāna.

original: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi ni phyis 'og nas ston to /🔽// / bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
analyzed: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi ni phyis 'og nas ston to / // / bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
translated: The four kinds of reasoning will be taught later.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas la rnam pa du mchis zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhi gnas kyi rnam pa mang nyung rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas la rnam pa du mchis zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhi gnas kyi rnam pa mang nyung rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: This is the second part, which analyzes the many and few aspects of calm abiding.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: the request and the correct explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol pa'o //
translated: This is the first part, the request.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: bar chad med pa'i sems de'i rjes su @113b 'brang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems de'i rjes su @113b 'brang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it follows that uninterrupted mind,🔽 it is also to be known as having three aspects.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par bshad pa bstan to //
translated: This is the second part, the correct explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: zhi gnas rnam pa gsum bstan pa dang / zhi gnas rnam pa brgyad bstan pa dang / zhi gnas rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas rnam pa gsum bstan pa dang / zhi gnas rnam pa brgyad bstan pa dang / zhi gnas rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the three aspects of calm abiding, the teaching on the eight aspects of calm abiding, and the teaching on the four aspects of calm abiding.

original: 'di ni dang po mtshan ma dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mtshan ma dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first teaching of the three types of meditative development that are respectively associated with the signs, free from signs and also free from the remedy.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.

original: de la de'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang bar byed pa lta ba'i rnam pa'o //🔽de la 'di skad du /🔽sems kyi mtshan ma de la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong la rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la de'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang bar byed pa lta ba'i rnam pa'o // de la 'di skad du / sems kyi mtshan ma de la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong la rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir /
translated: The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.

original: bar chad med pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas kyi sems la yang rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽yang rnam pa brgyad yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas kyi sems la yang rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // yang rnam pa brgyad yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.🔽The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched pa'i bar du re re la yang zhi gnas rnam pa re re yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ting nge 'dzin rnam pa brgyad ston te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched pa'i bar du re re la yang zhi gnas rnam pa re re yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ting nge 'dzin rnam pa brgyad ston te /
translated: The meditative development that is free from signs and also free from the remedy is the meditative development of the counteragent that is superior to the latter.

original: 'di nyid zhi gnas rnam pa brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid zhi gnas rnam pa brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: The

original: ting nge 'dzin brgyad po de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brgyad po de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: These eight concentrations are classified in two ways:

original: bsam gtan bzhi bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi bstan pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bstan pa'o //
translated: the four absorptions and the four formless meditative attainments.

original: bsam gtan bzhi bstan pa yang sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi bstan pa yang sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The four absorptions are explained in two ways:

original: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: their verbal definition and their nature.🔽The verbal definition is explained in two ways:

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang spyi dang bye brag gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang spyi dang bye brag gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: generally and specifically.

original: de la spyi ni thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bshad pa rnam pa gcig yod de /
analyzed: de la spyi ni thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bshad pa rnam pa gcig yod de /
translated: The general explanation is found in the treatise the great commentary on the Kāśyapa Chapter, which is a text of the Sarvāstivādins.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las ci'i phyir bzhi po 'di dag la bsam gtan zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las ci'i phyir bzhi po 'di dag la bsam gtan zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that treatise states, “Why are these four called absorptions?

original: smras pa / rab tu zhi zhing bsam gtan la 'bebs pas sa bzhi po 'di dag tu ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mnyam pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes brjod de /
analyzed: smras pa / rab tu zhi zhing bsam gtan la 'bebs pas sa bzhi po 'di dag tu ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mnyam pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes brjod de /
translated: It is said, ‘Because they are completely pacifying and because they are the basis of absorption, in these four stages concentration and wisdom are equal, and therefore they are called absorptions.’

original: gzhan dag las ni ma tshang bas ming 'di thob po zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag las ni ma tshang bas ming 'di thob po zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Other masters say: The name dhyāna is not applied to the first two because they are incomplete.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las ni bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las ni bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: In the treatise that is in conformity with correct reasoning, two explanations are given.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las don gang gi phyir bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i ming rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las don gang gi phyir bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i ming rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Therefore, that treatise itself says, “Why is the name dhyāna established for this object?

original: smras pa / rab tu zhi ba 'di la brten nas bsam pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir bsam pa gtan la 'bebs pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i don to zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rab tu zhi ba 'di la brten nas bsam pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir bsam pa gtan la 'bebs pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i don to zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said: because one determines the object in dependence on this peace, the meaning of determining the object is the meaning of correct understanding.

original: @114a * // mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kyang de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: @114a * // mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kyang de skad du bshad do //
translated: This is also explained in the treatise Kṣemaṅkara’s Abhidharmakośabhāṣya.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, that treatise says:

original: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin 'dis ni mchog dang / kun du mchog gi tshul bzhin du sems pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin 'dis ni mchog dang / kun du mchog gi tshul bzhin du sems pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: It is called dhyāna because it holds the mind in a supreme and utterly supreme manner.

original: de la mchog ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'dod pa'i khams las rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mchog ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'dod pa'i khams las rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: The word supreme indicates it is distinguished from the desire realm.

original: kun du mchog ces bya bas ni gzugs med pa las rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: kun du mchog ces bya bas ni gzugs med pa las rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: The word thoroughly supreme indicates it is distinguished from the formless realm.

original: tshul bzhin du sems pa zhes bya bas ni tha dad pa'i phyin ci log las rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du sems pa zhes bya bas ni tha dad pa'i phyin ci log las rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: The phrase properly directed mind indicates it is distinguished from the error of being separate.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni gya nom pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin pas gya nom pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni gya nom pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin pas gya nom pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This concentration is the most sublime concentration, therefore it is called dhyana, sublime concentration.

original: tshig 'dis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa phyin ci log med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'dis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa phyin ci log med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan zhes bstan to //
translated: This passage explains that dhyana is concentration that is the union of serenity and insight and is free of error.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de ;
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de ;
translated: Moreover, if this is applied to the treatise Exposition of Valid Knowledge, there are three explanations.

original: kun du sbyor ba gcod pa dang / yang dag par rtog pa dang / don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gcod pa dang / yang dag par rtog pa dang / don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Because it severs fetters, it is correct view, and it possesses two kinds of objects.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Thus the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: don gang gi phyir bsam gtan zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: don gang gi phyir bsam gtan zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called meditative concentration?

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du sbyor ba spong ba'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du sbyor ba spong ba'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is called meditative concentration because it abandons attachment.

original: gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis kun du sbyor ba spong bas bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis kun du sbyor ba spong bas bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i rigs so zhe na /
translated: It is logical that the formless meditative attainments are called meditative concentration because they abandon fetters.

original: smras pa / ting nge 'dzin gang gis mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa rnam pa gnyis kyis kun du sbyor ba spong bar nus pa ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba yin na /🔽gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni lung du mi ston pa 'ba' zhig spong gi //
analyzed: smras pa / ting nge 'dzin gang gis mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa rnam pa gnyis kyis kun du sbyor ba spong bar nus pa ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba yin na / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni lung du mi ston pa 'ba' zhig spong gi //
translated: We respond: Meditative concentration is that which can abandon the two types of fetters, nonvirtuous and neutral states.🔽The formless meditative attainments are called meditative concentration because they abandon only neutral states,

original: mi dge ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya ba zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya ba zhes 'byung ste /
translated: but not nonvirtuous states.

original: kun du sbyor ba spong ba la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba spong ba la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: The two explanations of the abandonment of the fetters are not mentioned here for fear of being too wordy.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las kha cig na re yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las kha cig na re yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Moreover, in the same text, some say: “It is called meditative concentration because it causes correct conception.”

original: gal te de lta na 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin yang dag par rtog par byed pas bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin yang dag par rtog par byed pas bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i rigs so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the concentration of the desire realm should be called meditative concentration, because it causes correct conception.

original: smras pa / ting nge 'dzin gang ting nge 'dzin gyi ming dang / nus pa dang ldan zhing yang dag par rtog par byed pa ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba @114b yin na 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi ming dang ldan yang ting nge 'dzin gyi nus pa med pas /
analyzed: smras pa / ting nge 'dzin gang ting nge 'dzin gyi ming dang / nus pa dang ldan zhing yang dag par rtog par byed pa ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba @114b yin na 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi ming dang ldan yang ting nge 'dzin gyi nus pa med pas /
translated: We say: That concentration which has the name of concentration and is endowed with the power to cause correct conception is called meditative concentration. The concentration of the desire realm has the name of concentration, but it lacks the power of concentration.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i dril bu dang gdung ma zhes brjod pa ltar ming dang ldan yang nus pa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i dril bu dang gdung ma zhes brjod pa ltar ming dang ldan yang nus pa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: For example, it is like the expression “clay pot” or “clay pillar.” Although it has a name, it is not concentration because it lacks potency.

original: yang dag par rtog pa la bshad pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa la bshad pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: The explanation of the three types of correct conception is not mentioned here because it would be too much.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las de ltar bshad pa yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan na gdod bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las de ltar bshad pa yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan na gdod bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that same text explains that concentration is called concentration only when it possesses two meanings:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: kun du sbyor ba spong ba dang / yang dag par rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba spong ba dang / yang dag par rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: It abandons the fetters and it correctly conceives.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin yang dag par rtog par byed kyang kun du sbyor ba spong bar mi byed la gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa kun tu sbyor ba spong bar byed kyang yang dag par rtog par mi byed pa'i phyir bsam gtan ma
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin yang dag par rtog par byed kyang kun du sbyor ba spong bar mi byed la gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa kun tu sbyor ba spong bar byed kyang yang dag par rtog par mi byed pa'i phyir bsam gtan ma
translated: Although the concentration of the desire realm correctly conceives, it does not abandon the fetters and although the concentration of the formless realm completely abandons the fetters, it does not correctly conceive. Therefore it is not concentration.

original: yin no // gzhan yang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dben pa dang ldan yang gtan la 'bebs pa med la /
analyzed: yin no // gzhan yang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dben pa dang ldan yang gtan la 'bebs pa med la /
translated: Moreover, formless concentration possesses seclusion but not full attainment.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin ni bsam pa gtan la 'bebs pa yod kyang dben pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ting nge 'dzin ni bsam pa gtan la 'bebs pa yod kyang dben pa med do //
translated: Concentration of the desire realm possesses full attainment of thought but not seclusion.

original: gzugs kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Concentration of the form realm is called meditative stabilization because it possesses both.

original: don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung ba ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do /
analyzed: don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung ba ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do /
translated: The two explanations of the two types of object are not mentioned here because there is fear of being long-winded.

original: theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dag dang sbyar na yang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dag dang sbyar na yang /
translated: When applied to the teachings of the Mahāyāna,

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las rnam grangs dang pos bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las rnam grangs dang pos bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: the treatise accords with correct reasoning and explains in accordance with the first category of teachings.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la dran pa rtse gcig tu byed cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la dran pa rtse gcig tu byed cing /
translated: Therefore the treatise Yogācārabhūmi says, “What is meditative stabilization? It is the one-pointedness of mindfulness on an object.

original: rab tu dben pa dang yang dag par nye bar gtod pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa dang yang dag par nye bar gtod pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and because they are completely secluded and fully focused, they are called meditative stabilization.

original: de la bye brag gi ming ni dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bye brag gi ming zhes bya ste /🔽de'i phyir bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bsam gtan rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la bye brag med kyang sa'i bye brag rab tu bstan pa'i ched du grangs kyi dbang du byas nas nges tshig bstan pa'i phyir dang po zhes bya
analyzed: de la bye brag gi ming ni dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bye brag gi ming zhes bya ste / de'i phyir bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bsam gtan rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la bye brag med kyang sa'i bye brag rab tu bstan pa'i ched du grangs kyi dbang du byas nas nges tshig bstan pa'i phyir dang po zhes bya
translated: The specific names of the first, second, third, and fourth are called specific names.

original: ba nas bzhi ba zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //🔽gal te dge ba'i ngo bo nyid dang sems rtse gcig tu bsdus pa nyid dang / grogs las bsam @115a * //
analyzed: ba nas bzhi ba zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no // gal te dge ba'i ngo bo nyid dang sems rtse gcig tu bsdus pa nyid dang / grogs las bsam @115a * //
translated: Therefore, in the treatise that accords with correct reasoning, although there is no distinction in the general characteristics of the meditative stabilizations, in order to teach the distinction of the levels, the specific names are taught in terms of number, from the first to the fourth.

original: gtan bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin na /
analyzed: gtan bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin na /
translated: If the four meditative stabilizations are posited from the nature of being virtuous, from the mind being one-pointedly concentrated, and from being companions,🔽then why are they called meditative stabilizations?

original: mtshan nyid gang las brtsams nas dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang las brtsams nas dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: What is the defining characteristic of each of the four meditative states?

original: smras pa / dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang bcas pa las ni dang po rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: smras pa / dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang bcas pa las ni dang po rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The Buddha replied, The first meditative state is established on the basis of the defining characteristic of being associated with investigation, joy, and pleasure.

original: rim gyis yan lag snga ma dang bral ba las ni gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa rnam par gzhag ste /🔽'di ltar dpyod pa spangs shing rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'o //🔽bsam gtan gnyis ni dpyod pa dang bral zhing dga' ba dang bde ba gnyis dang bcas pas gnyis spangs nas bde ba dang bcas pa'o //🔽bsam gtan gsum pa ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba gnyis dang bral zhing bde ba kho na dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis yan lag snga ma dang bral ba las ni gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa rnam par gzhag ste / 'di ltar dpyod pa spangs shing rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'o // bsam gtan gnyis ni dpyod pa dang bral zhing dga' ba dang bde ba gnyis dang bcas pas gnyis spangs nas bde ba dang bcas pa'o // bsam gtan gsum pa ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba gnyis dang bral zhing bde ba kho na dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The second, third, and fourth meditative states are established on the basis of the defining characteristic of being progressively separated from the preceding factors.🔽 The second meditative state is established on the basis of the defining characteristic of being separated from investigation and possessing the two factors of joy and pleasure.🔽 The third meditative state is established on the basis of the defining characteristic of being separated from both investigation and joy and possessing the single factor of pleasure.

original: rnam pa gsum char dang bral ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum char dang bral ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth meditative state is established on the basis of the defining characteristic of being separated from all three factors of investigation, joy, and pleasure.🔽 The Buddha continued, The first meditative state is associated with five factors.

original: dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba spangs pa gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba spangs pa gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The third is the meditative development of the remaining factors, i.e. those that are other than the four beginning with analysis.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig la rnam pa bzhir phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig la rnam pa bzhir phye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the one essential nature of the meditative object is divided into four aspects.

original: bsam gtan rnams la byams pa la sogs pa ltar thun mong ma yin pa'i ming gi mtshan nyid med dam zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la byams pa la sogs pa ltar thun mong ma yin pa'i ming gi mtshan nyid med dam zhe na /
translated: Are there no specific names for the meditative absorptions, as there are for love and the rest?

original: 'dir dang po la sogs pa'i grangs bzhi la brten nas bye brag gi ming rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'dir dang po la sogs pa'i grangs bzhi la brten nas bye brag gi ming rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: In this regard, the specific names are established on the basis of the four numbers beginning with one.

original: smras pa / 'dir thun mong ma yin pa'i ming gi mtshan nyid med pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir thun mong ma yin pa'i ming gi mtshan nyid med pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is said: although there are no specific names here,

original: 'on kyang med pa ni sa gcig gi ming kho nas kun bsdus par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa ni sa gcig gi ming kho nas kun bsdus par 'gyur bas /
translated: nevertheless, since the first is included in the name of the one level alone,

original: de'i phyir grangs la brten nas bye brag gi ming du bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs la brten nas bye brag gi ming du bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: therefore, the specific names are taught on the basis of the numbers.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise on the Abhidharma-kośa is also explained in accordance with this.

original: gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: Moreover, in the verse-text of the treatise on the Abhidharma-kośa, it is said:

original: dang po dag ni dpyod dang dga' bde bcas //🔽phyi ma rim gyis yan lag snga ma spong //
analyzed: dang po dag ni dpyod dang dga' bde bcas // phyi ma rim gyis yan lag snga ma spong //
translated: The first has investigation, analysis, joy, and pleasure.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The latter abandon the former branches in sequence.

original: ci'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa las rtog pa tshang bar ma smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa las rtog pa tshang bar ma smos she na /
translated: Why are the members not mentioned in full in the verse?

original: smras pa / mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /🔽de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan par yang bstan te /
analyzed: smras pa / mdzod kyi bstan bcos las / de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan par yang bstan te /
translated: The treatise Abhidharmakośa states:

original: gdon mi za bar lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore it is taught that it possesses investigation because it definitely engages simultaneously.

original: dper na dud pa dang me lta bur dpyod pa dang yang dga' ba dang bde ba kho na dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: dper na dud pa dang me lta bur dpyod pa dang yang dga' ba dang bde ba kho na dang ldan zhing /
translated: It possesses investigation and joy and pleasure like smoke and fire.

original: rtog pa dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not that it does not possess investigation.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: Moreover, the Great Exegesis states:

original: bsam gtan bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four meditative attainments are as follows:

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i @115b bar du ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i @115b bar du ste /
translated: from the first meditative stabilization up to the fourth meditative stabilization.

original: kha cig na re rtog pa dang dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan ni go rims bzhin du bzhi po dag yin par sbyar ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig na re rtog pa dang dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan ni go rims bzhin du bzhi po dag yin par sbyar ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Some say: The fourth meditative stabilization is associated with investigation, joy, pleasure and equanimity.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na yang grangs kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming bkod pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa dag dang mthun pas /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na yang grangs kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming bkod pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa dag dang mthun pas /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana, the names are posited in order of number, in accordance with the treatise Correct Reason and the teaching.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds explains:

original: grangs kyi go rims dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang du byas pas /
analyzed: grangs kyi go rims dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang du byas pas /
translated: The order of the numbers is as follows:

original: dang po zhes bya ba nas bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba nas bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The first is called the first meditative stabilization and so on up to the fourth is called the fourth meditative stabilization.

original: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos phye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos phye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: The Abhidharmakośa declares that the nature of meditative attainment is the same as the nature of the absorptions and formless states.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa bzhi po dag ni kun kyang rang gis pa'i dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa bzhi po dag ni kun kyang rang gis pa'i dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: The Mahāvibhāṣā explains that the nature of the four types of absorption is that they are all virtuous, afflicted, or unobscured neutral states subsumed by their own level and they are the essence of the five aggregates.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: The Mahāvibhāṣā explains:

original: bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te bsgoms nas thob pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te bsgoms nas thob pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'o //
translated: The nature of absorption is twofold: that obtained through meditation and that obtained from birth.

original: de la bsgoms nas thob pa ni sa de nyid kyis bsdus pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la bsgoms nas thob pa ni sa de nyid kyis bsdus pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
translated: That obtained through meditation is the one pointed mind subsumed by that level.

original: gal te grogs su gyur pa yang bsdus na ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gal te grogs su gyur pa yang bsdus na ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: If it is subsumed by its companions, it is the essence of the five aggregates.

original: skyes nas thob pa ni gang du skyes pa'i sa pa de nyid kyi dang ldan pa gzhan phung po lnga po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa ni gang du skyes pa'i sa pa de nyid kyi dang ldan pa gzhan phung po lnga po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That obtained from birth is the nature of the five aggregates of the same level where one is born.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //🔽'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na yang phal cher bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun par srid pa las skye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do // 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na yang phal cher bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa dang mthun par srid pa las skye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang /
translated: The treatise Abhidharmakośa and its commentary explain this point in accordance with correct reasoning.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana, for the most part it accords with the teaching in the great commentary, the Mahavibhāṣā, that birth from existence and birth from concentration are the nature of the five aggregates of virtue and affliction,

original: dge ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dge ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: and that virtue is the nature of the five aggregates with and without contamination.

original: de la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The four formless meditative attainments are also taught in brief by two methods.

original: nges tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the essence.

original: nges tshig bstan pa yang spyi dang bye brag gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: nges tshig bstan pa yang spyi dang bye brag gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The explanation of the derivation of the term is also twofold: the general derivation and the specific derivation.

original: de la spyi'i ming yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos @116a * //
analyzed: de la spyi'i ming yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos @116a * //
translated: The general derivation is explained in the scriptures of the Sarvāstivāda school:🔽The treatise is called Abhidharma because it is in accordance with correct reasoning.

original: yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du ngon rnam pa gsum yod de //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du ngon rnam pa gsum yod de //
translated: The term abhi-dharma is derived from three aspects:

original: dgag pa'i don dang / mthar thug pa rab tu bstan pa'i don dang / yod pa rab tu bstan pa'i don to zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dgag pa'i don dang / mthar thug pa rab tu bstan pa'i don dang / yod pa rab tu bstan pa'i don to zhes bshad de /
translated: the meaning of negation, the meaning of teaching the ultimate, and the meaning of teaching existence.🔽Therefore, that treatise explains:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las don gang gi phyir gzugs med pa'i ming rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las don gang gi phyir gzugs med pa'i ming rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: For what purpose is the term formless established?

original: r'u pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: r'u pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The term rūpa indicates the meaning of transformation and the meaning of being demonstrable.

original: bstan du yod pa'i don rab tu ston pas /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa'i don rab tu ston pas /
translated: Since it indicates the meaning of transformation and being demonstrable,

original: rnam par 'gyur zhing bstan du yod pa la brten nas gzugs zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur zhing bstan du yod pa la brten nas gzugs zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught that form is based on transformation and being demonstrable.

original: aa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni dgag par byed pa'i don rab tu ston te /
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni dgag par byed pa'i don rab tu ston te /
translated: The word “a” indicates the meaning of negation.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i nang na yang re zhig tsam du gzugs kyi skye mched dgag par yod do zhes rab tu bstan pa'i ched du /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i nang na yang re zhig tsam du gzugs kyi skye mched dgag par yod do zhes rab tu bstan pa'i ched du /
translated: In the ocean of cyclic existence, there is a mere negation of the form base, and this is taught in order to indicate that.

original: dgag pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas med pa zhes bya ba bstan to //🔽'di ltar khams de na rnam par 'gyur zhing bstan du yod pa zlog par byed pas gzugs med pa'i don la brten nas /
analyzed: dgag pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas med pa zhes bya ba bstan to // 'di ltar khams de na rnam par 'gyur zhing bstan du yod pa zlog par byed pas gzugs med pa'i don la brten nas /
translated: From the perspective of the meaning of negation, “nonexistent” is taught.

original: aa r'u pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa r'u pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In that way, since it is a negation of the form base that is transformed and demonstrable in that realm, the meaning of “formless” is based on the word “a-ru-pa.”

original: yang aa zhes bya ba 'di ni mthar thug pa'i don rab tu ston pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yang aa zhes bya ba 'di ni mthar thug pa'i don rab tu ston pa yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, this “a” also indicates the meaning of ultimate.

original: khams gzhan na yang rnam par mi 'gyur zhing bstan du med pa'i chos yod kyang /
analyzed: khams gzhan na yang rnam par mi 'gyur zhing bstan du med pa'i chos yod kyang /
translated: Although there are phenomena that are not transformed and are not demonstrable in other realms,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni rnam par 'gyur ba dang / bstan du med pa'i nang na mthar thug pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni rnam par 'gyur ba dang / bstan du med pa'i nang na mthar thug pa yin te /
translated: the formless realm is the ultimate of those that are not transformed and are not demonstrable.

original: 'di na yod do de na yod do zhes bya ba brten pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na yod do de na yod do zhes bya ba brten pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a form that is based and has spatial dimensions, such as “it exists here” or “it exists there.”

original: yang na aa zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa'i don bstan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na aa zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa'i don bstan pa yang yin te /
translated: Or else, the term “ā” indicates the meaning of existence.

original: 'di ltar khams 'di ni gzugs med pa tsam mo zhes dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams 'di ni gzugs med pa tsam mo zhes dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the idea that this realm is merely non-form,

original: aa zhes bya bas ni gzugs med pa yod par rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: aa zhes bya bas ni gzugs med pa yod par rab tu bstan te /
translated: the term “ā” clearly indicates that non-form exists.🔽In the world, the term “merely” is seen as a negation and as an indication of negation, just as the term “ā” clearly indicates without being a negation alone.

original: 'jig rten na yang tsam zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i tshig dang / dgag nas rab tu bstan pa yang yin par mthong ba ni ji ltar aas 'di rab tu bstan kyang dgag pa kho na ma yin pa lta bu yin pas de'i phyir aa zhes bya bas ni dgag pa dang rab tu bstan pa yang yongs su rdzogs par ston🔽to zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang tsam zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i tshig dang / dgag nas rab tu bstan pa yang yin par mthong ba ni ji ltar aas 'di rab tu bstan kyang dgag pa kho na ma yin pa lta bu yin pas de'i phyir aa zhes bya bas ni dgag pa dang rab tu bstan pa yang yongs su rdzogs par ston to zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the term “ā” fully teaches both negation and indication.

original: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: This is also taught in the treatise Prajñaptibhāṣya.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni ci'i phyir 'di bzhi la gzugs med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni ci'i phyir 'di bzhi la gzugs med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are these four called formless?

original: smras pa / bzhi po 'di dag ni gzugs can gyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can gyi chos @116b thams cad rab tu nyams par byas pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi chos 'dir skye ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / bzhi po 'di dag ni gzugs can gyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can gyi chos @116b thams cad rab tu nyams par byas pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi chos 'dir skye ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They are called formless because they transcend all physical phenomena, because they completely destroy physical phenomena and because there is no opportunity for physical phenomena to arise in them.

original: de la bye brag gi ming yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi ming yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis /
translated: The specific names of these meditative attainments are stated in the scriptures of the Vaibhasikas as follows.

original: dang po nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dang po nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: The first meditative attainment of infinite space is explained in the great treatise on differentiation as follows:

original: rnam grangs rnam pa bzhis ston te de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las sbyor ba'i dbang gis na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs rnam pa bzhis ston te de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las sbyor ba'i dbang gis na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The concentration of the base of infinite space is so called because of its application.

original: 'di ltar las dang po pas thog ma kho nar rtsig pa dang skye shing dang / brag dang khang khyim la sogs pa la yod pa'i nam mkha' rnams kyi mtshan ma yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar las dang po pas thog ma kho nar rtsig pa dang skye shing dang / brag dang khang khyim la sogs pa la yod pa'i nam mkha' rnams kyi mtshan ma yid la byed do //
translated: Thus, a beginner first mentally engages the signs of space that exist in walls, trees, rocks, houses, and so on.

original: mtshan ma de yongs su bzung nas brda'i 'du shes kyi mos pa'i mtha' med pa'i nam mkha'i mtshan ma rnams so sor rtog cing gsal bar khong du chud par byed do //🔽sngar mtha' med pa'i nam mkha'i mtshan ma yid la byas shing sbyor ba bsgoms pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma de yongs su bzung nas brda'i 'du shes kyi mos pa'i mtha' med pa'i nam mkha'i mtshan ma rnams so sor rtog cing gsal bar khong du chud par byed do // sngar mtha' med pa'i nam mkha'i mtshan ma yid la byas shing sbyor ba bsgoms pas /
translated: After apprehending those signs, he imagines the sign of infinite space through the conception of a conventional symbol and clearly comprehends it.🔽Since he previously mentally engaged and cultivated the application of the sign of infinite space,

original: gong nas gong du gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang po rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong nas gong du gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang po rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir /
translated: he is led to the first formless meditative attainment.

original: 'di la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'di la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bshad do //
translated: Therefore it is explained as the base of infinite space.

original: gzhan yang chos nyid kyis dang por gzugs kyis dag dang bral ba'i nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya bas so //🔽gzhan yang chos nyid kyis dang por gzugs kyi sa pa dag las rnam par grol ba la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya bas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos nyid kyis dang por gzugs kyis dag dang bral ba'i nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya bas so // gzhan yang chos nyid kyis dang por gzugs kyi sa pa dag las rnam par grol ba la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya bas so //
translated: Moreover, by its intrinsic nature, it is the base of infinite space, since it is the first to be free from the form of the lower stage.🔽Moreover, by its intrinsic nature, it is the base of infinite space, since it is the first to be free from the form of the lower stage.

original: gzhan yang rgyu mthun pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu mthun pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it is called the base of infinite space because it is the cause of the meditative attainment of infinite space.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bshad de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bshad de /
translated: This meditative attainment is called the base of infinite space because it is the cause of the meditative attainment of infinite space.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa de ting nge 'dzin 'di las langs pa na gdon mi za bar nam mkha' 'dra ba'i 'du shes bskyed pa mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa de ting nge 'dzin 'di las langs pa na gdon mi za bar nam mkha' 'dra ba'i 'du shes bskyed pa mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: When yogins and yoginīs rise from this meditative attainment, they necessarily generate the perception of space.

original: ji skad du dge slong ting nge 'dzin 'di las langs nas lag pa gnyis nam mkha' la bsnyams pa dang gzhan dag gis khyod ci zhig tshol zhes dris so //
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong ting nge 'dzin 'di las langs nas lag pa gnyis nam mkha' la bsnyams pa dang gzhan dag gis khyod ci zhig tshol zhes dris so //
translated: As it is said, “When a monk rises from this meditative attainment, he touches his two hands to space and others ask, ‘What are you seeking?’

original: dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des smras pa /
translated: The monk replies,🔽‘I am seeking space.’

original: bdag gi rang gis rang gi lus tshol lo //
analyzed: bdag gi rang gis rang gi lus tshol lo //
translated: I will search for my own body.

original: des smras pa khyod kyi lus nags khrod na gnas na ci'i phyir gzhan du rang gi lus tshol bar byed ces smras so zhes grags te /
analyzed: des smras pa khyod kyi lus nags khrod na gnas na ci'i phyir gzhan du rang gi lus tshol bar byed ces smras so zhes grags te /
translated: He said, “Your body is in the forest. Why do you search for your body elsewhere?”

original: de'i 'phyir 'di las langs na nam mkha'i 'du shes 'byung bar mngon no //
analyzed: de'i 'phyir 'di las langs na nam mkha'i 'du shes 'byung bar mngon no //
translated: Therefore, when rising from this meditative attainment, the ideation of infinite space appears.

original: 'du shes 'di nyid ni ting nge 'dzin @117a * //
analyzed: 'du shes 'di nyid ni ting nge 'dzin @117a * //
translated: This ideation is the meditative attainment🔽of the base of infinite space.

original: snga ma de'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: snga ma de'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This meditative attainment is called the base of infinite space because it is the homogeneous cause of the prior meditative attainment of infinite space.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni don gyis bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa'i rnam grangs dang po bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni don gyis bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa'i rnam grangs dang po bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Abhidharmakośa explains the first type of meditative attainment of infinite space in accordance with the explanation in the Great Commentary, which is a commentary on the sutra.🔽The second type of meditative attainment of infinite space is explained in the Abhidharmakośa as follows:

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang don gyis bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs dang po gsum gyis bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang don gyis bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs dang po gsum gyis bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise is consistent with correct reasoning, and the text also explains the meaning in accordance with the teaching in the great commentary, which explains the first three synonyms.

original: de la rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de la rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba ni ;
translated: The base of infinite consciousness

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: The great treatise on differentiation teaches this base in two ways.🔽Therefore, the treatise itself states:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las sbyor ba kho na'i dbang gis rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las sbyor ba kho na'i dbang gis rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The concentration of the base of infinite consciousness is called that because it is generated by the power of preparation.

original: 'di ltar las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag thog ma kho nar yongs su dag pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan ma yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag thog ma kho nar yongs su dag pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan ma yid la byed do //
translated: Thus, in the beginning, yogis who are beginners focus their attention on the signs of the six totally pure sense consciousnesses such as eye consciousness.

original: mtshan ma yongs su bzung nas brda'i 'du shes kyi mos pas rnam shes mtha' yas kyi mtshan ma so sor brtags shing gsal bar khong du chud nas sngar rnam shes mtha' yas yid la byas shing sbyor ba la brten nas gong nas gong du gzugs med pa'i ting🔽nge 'dzin gnyis pa rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma yongs su bzung nas brda'i 'du shes kyi mos pas rnam shes mtha' yas kyi mtshan ma so sor brtags shing gsal bar khong du chud nas sngar rnam shes mtha' yas yid la byas shing sbyor ba la brten nas gong nas gong du gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Having fully grasped the sign of infinite consciousness, one focuses on the sign of infinite consciousness through the conception of a conventional symbol, one analyzes and clearly comprehends the sign of infinite consciousness and previously one generated the mental contemplation of infinite consciousness and based on that application, one generates the second formless meditative stabilization.🔽It is called the base of infinite consciousness because it is the second formless meditative stabilization that is generated in dependence on the prior generation of the mental contemplation of infinite consciousness.

original: gzhan yang rgyu mthun pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu mthun pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bshad de /
translated: It is also called the base of infinite consciousness from the perspective of its natural outcome.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa de ting nge 'dzin 'di las langs pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa de ting nge 'dzin 'di las langs pa na /
translated: Thus when a yogin arises from this meditative stabilization,

original: gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa 'dra ba'i 'du shes bskyed pa mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa 'dra ba'i 'du shes bskyed pa mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: he definitely generates the manifest conception of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa la rab tu dga' bas gnas pas de'i phyir rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rab tu dga' bas gnas pas de'i phyir rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because he abides in delight in consciousness, it is called the base of infinite consciousness.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni bshad pa'i rnam grangs dang po dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni bshad pa'i rnam grangs dang po dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Abhidharmakośa explains this in accordance with the first explanation of the term.

original: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise Lokaprajñapti explains this in accordance with the second explanation.

original: de la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya ba ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs lngas ston te /🔽de'i phyir de nyid las 'di ci'i phyir ci @117b yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya ba ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs lngas ston te / de'i phyir de nyid las 'di ci'i phyir ci @117b yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya zhe na /
translated: The great treatise Vibhāṣā explains the base of nothingness in five ways.🔽Why is it called the base of nothingness?

original: smras pa / 'di la bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di la bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the base of nothingness because it is devoid of self and mine.

original: sa thams cad la yang bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa yin na /
analyzed: sa thams cad la yang bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa yin na /
translated: If all levels are devoid of self and mine,

original: ci'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: why is this called the base of nothingness?

original: smras pa / gzhan gang la yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa nyams smad pa dang / 'bigs shing srab pa dang / mthu stobs 'bri bar byed pa sa 'di lta bu'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gang la yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa nyams smad pa dang / 'bigs shing srab pa dang / mthu stobs 'bri bar byed pa sa 'di lta bu'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: It is said: Because it does not have the power to diminish the self-grasping and the grasping at “mine” of any other person, to pierce and thin them, and to reduce their strength, it is called the base of nothingness.

original: gzhan yang sa 'di la de kho na rtag par gnas pa rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i chos med kyang rtag par lta ba nyams smad par byed pas gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sa 'di la de kho na rtag par gnas pa rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i chos med kyang rtag par lta ba nyams smad par byed pas gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, although in this stage there is no reality that always abides and is immutable, it is called the base of nothingness because it is superior to the others since it diminishes the view of permanence.

original: gzhan yang 'di la gzhol ba dang skyabs su 'gro ba'i khang khyim med kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la gzhol ba dang skyabs su 'gro ba'i khang khyim med kyang /
translated: Moreover, although there is no house to which one can go and take refuge,

original: mgon skyabs med cing nga rgyal dang le lo dang bag med pa rnam par gnon pas gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: mgon skyabs med cing nga rgyal dang le lo dang bag med pa rnam par gnon pas gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is superior to the others because it is without a protector or refuge, and because it conquers pride, laziness, and carelessness, it is called the base of nothingness.

original: gzhan yang sa 'dir rnam pa'i mtshan nyid mtha' med pa med cing dang po kho nar de'i mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa 'dir rnam pa'i mtshan nyid mtha' med pa med cing dang po kho nar de'i mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since this base is the first to abandon the characteristic of the aspect of infinity,

original: 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: it is called the base of nothingness.

original: btsun pa dbyig gi bshes gnyen ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyig gi bshes gnyen ni 'di skad du /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says:

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di la yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di la yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the characteristic of the aspect of grasping does not operate in this concentration,

original: ji ltar bdag ma yin pa ni gnas dang dus gang du yang dngos po rjes su 'brel pa dang / gnas dang dus gang du yang bdag dang rjes su 'brel pa med pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o zhes zer te zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ma yin pa ni gnas dang dus gang du yang dngos po rjes su 'brel pa dang / gnas dang dus gang du yang bdag dang rjes su 'brel pa med pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di 'ba' zhig la ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o zhes zer te zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is why it is called the sphere of nothingness.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las ni /
translated: In the treatise that accords with correct reasoning,

original: mos pa'i dbang gis sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa las mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang gis sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa las mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: it is said that the sphere of nothingness is accomplished through the power of aspiration, abandoning all attachment.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa tshad med pa dag la rags shing g-yo ba nyid du lta bas de la skyo zhing spang ba'i ched du sbyor ba 'di bskyed pas de'i phyir gnas 'di ni spangs pa khyad par can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa tshad med pa dag la rags shing g-yo ba nyid du lta bas de la skyo zhing spang ba'i ched du sbyor ba 'di bskyed pas de'i phyir gnas 'di ni spangs pa khyad par can zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is viewed as coarse and unstable in relation to immeasurable aspects, this sphere is cultivated in order to be disenchanted and abandon those aspects. Therefore, this stage is called the special abandonment.

original: 'di yang rnam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par 'du byed pa la mi mos @118a * //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par 'du byed pa la mi mos @118a * //
translated: This also is not to be interested in the characteristics of aspects.🔽

original: pa dang / sems kyi dmigs pa rnams spangs shing zhi ba la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: pa dang / sems kyi dmigs pa rnams spangs shing zhi ba la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is because they do not aspire to manifest conditioning and they abandon the mental supports of meditative concentration and abide in peace.

original: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: This is also explained in accordance with the treatise Exposition of the Summary of the Great Vehicle.

original: de la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba ni /
translated: The base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs gcig gis ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las rnam grangs gcig gis ston te /
translated: The Great Exegesis explains this base in one enumeration:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las 'di la ci'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ces bya zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'di la gsal ba'i 'du shes med cing /🔽'du shes med pa'i mtshan ma yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las 'di la ci'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ces bya zhe na / smras pa / 'di la gsal ba'i 'du shes med cing / 'du shes med pa'i mtshan ma yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Why is it called the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment?🔽It is called that because it is free of the discernment of clarity

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: and it is free of the sign of nondiscernment.

original: gsal ba'i 'du shes med pa ni sa bdun po dag ltar 'du shes dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i 'du shes med pa ni sa bdun po dag ltar 'du shes dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a non-perception of clarity, because it is not a concentration with perception like the seven stages.

original: 'du shes med pa'i mtshan ma yang med pa ni 'du shes pa med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i mtshan ma yang med pa ni 'du shes pa med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a signless non-perception, because it is not a non-perception or a concentration of cessation.

original: sa 'di'i 'du shes mi gsal zhing rtul ba dang / zhen cing gsal ba med pa dang nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa 'di'i 'du shes mi gsal zhing rtul ba dang / zhen cing gsal ba med pa dang nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the perception of this stage is unclear and dull, and because it is not firm, clear, or definite,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: it is called the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: This is in accordance with the treatise on the Abhidharma-kośa and correct reasoning, and is also explained in accordance with this in the Prakaraṇa-śāstra.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las gzugs med pa bzhi po 'di dag skye mched ces bya ba ni srid pa rnams bskyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las gzugs med pa bzhi po 'di dag skye mched ces bya ba ni srid pa rnams bskyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: These four formless states are called bases because they are the bases generating existence.

original: skye mched bzhi po 'di dag tu yod pa dang med pa'i srid pa dag gis las dang nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs skyed cing 'phel par byed pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: skye mched bzhi po 'di dag tu yod pa dang med pa'i srid pa dag gis las dang nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs skyed cing 'phel par byed pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa ma yin pas /
translated: Because existence in these four bases increases and generates various karma and afflictions, they are not real.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa skyed pa'i gnas zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa skyed pa'i gnas zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, in order to destroy the conception that they are nirvana, the Bhagavan said that they are bases generating existence.

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: If applied to the Mahayana scriptures, the treatise Yogacarabhmi states:

original: gzhan yang rnam pa de thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa de thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing /
translated: the perceptions of obstruction having disappeared,🔽not paying attention to the perceptions of multiplicity,

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
translated: they think, 'space is infinite,'

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs @118b pa de la /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs @118b pa de la /
translated: and they achieve and remain in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba ni nam mkhar mos par byed pa'i phyir kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang ldan pa'i 'du shes de dag mi snang ba'i phyir dang /🔽skyo zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag par 'das pas na /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba ni nam mkhar mos par byed pa'i phyir kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang ldan pa'i 'du shes de dag mi snang ba'i phyir dang / skyo zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag par 'das pas na /
translated: As for the passage, completely transcending the perceptions of form in all its aspects, this is because the perceptions of blue, yellow, red, and white do not appear, since one is intent on space.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Since one completely transcends them through disenchantment and detachment, it says, completely transcending the perceptions of form in all its aspects.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba ni de dag las yang dag par 'das shing mi snang bar gyur pa'i rgyus kha dog bsags pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sgrib pa'i 'du shes rnam pa du ma sna tshogs mang po dag dang bral bas na de'i
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba ni de dag las yang dag par 'das shing mi snang bar gyur pa'i rgyus kha dog bsags pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sgrib pa'i 'du shes rnam pa du ma sna tshogs mang po dag dang bral bas na de'i
translated: The phrase “the perception of obstruction has disappeared” means that, due to having completely transcended and made those disappear, he is free of the many different kinds of perceptions that are the causes of the accumulation of colors and that are the obscurations.

original: phyir thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: phyir thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For that reason, it is said, “the perception of obstruction has disappeared.”

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase “he does not pay attention to the perception of variety” means

original: de dag dang bral ba thogs pa khyad par can rnam pa sna tshogs de dag nyid la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba thogs pa khyad par can rnam pa sna tshogs de dag nyid la 'di lta ste /
translated: that he is free of those and does not pay attention to the various kinds of special obstructions.

original: zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang rgyan dang / nags dang / skyed mos tshal dang / nags tshal dang / dmag dang / ri la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa'i 'du shes 'jug pa gang yin pa'i 'du shes de dag de rnams la gtad kyang /
analyzed: zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang rgyan dang / nags dang / skyed mos tshal dang / nags tshal dang / dmag dang / ri la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa'i 'du shes 'jug pa gang yin pa'i 'du shes de dag de rnams la gtad kyang /
