translated: The perception that engages in designating those as food and drink, vehicles, clothing and ornaments, forests, parks, groves, armies, mountains, and so on, is a perception that is directed toward them.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since it will not arise in any way whatsoever,

original: de'i phyir sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: therefore it is said, “he does not pay attention to various perceptions.”🔽Thinking, “space is infinite,”

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni des de ltar gzugs dang thogs pa dang sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dag rnam par bshig nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni des de ltar gzugs dang thogs pa dang sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dag rnam par bshig nas /
translated: means that, having thus eliminated perceptions of form, obstruction, and variety,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i rnam pas mos par byed pas na /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i rnam pas mos par byed pas na /
translated: he cultivates the aspect of infinite space.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de nyer bsdogs las yang dag par 'das shing sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba gsungs so // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de nyer bsdogs las yang dag par 'das shing sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pas /
translated: Therefore it is said, “thinking, ‘space is infinite.’”🔽He achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite space

original: gong ma sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas na /
analyzed: gong ma sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas na /
translated: means that, having transcended its access state, he cultivates the summit of the meditative attainment of the sphere of infinite space.🔽Therefore it is said, “he achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite space.”

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “One achieves and remains in the base of infinite space.”

original: de srid du dngos gzhi la snyoms par mi 'jug pa'i bar du ni de nam mkha' kho na la dmigs par byed do //🔽dngos @119a * //
analyzed: de srid du dngos gzhi la snyoms par mi 'jug pa'i bar du ni de nam mkha' kho na la dmigs par byed do // dngos @119a * //
translated: Up to this point, one focuses on space alone, but not yet enters meditative attainment on the actual basis.

original: gzhi la snyoms par zhugs nas ni nam mkha' de nyid dang de las gzhan pa rang gis pa'i phung po rnams la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: gzhi la snyoms par zhugs nas ni nam mkha' de nyid dang de las gzhan pa rang gis pa'i phung po rnams la dmigs par byed do //
translated: Having entered meditative attainment on the actual basis, one focuses on that space and on the aggregates of one’s level that are other than that space.

original: nyer bsdogs kyi tshe na ni sa 'og ma'i phung po rnams la yang dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi tshe na ni sa 'og ma'i phung po rnams la yang dmigs par byed do //
translated: At the time of access concentration, one focuses on the aggregates of lower levels.

original: gzhan yang de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Moreover, it is said, “One completely transcends the base of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: Thinking, ‘Consciousness is infinite,’ one achieves and remains in the base of infinite consciousness.”

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: One completely transcends the base of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni de rnam par shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos par byed pa /🔽nam mkha' la mtha' yas pa'i rnam pas mos par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis rnam shes mtha' yas la snyoms par 'jug 'dod pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes las bzlog ste /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni de rnam par shes pa gang gis nam mkha' mtha' yas par mos par byed pa / nam mkha' la mtha' yas pa'i rnam pas mos par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis rnam shes mtha' yas la snyoms par 'jug 'dod pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes las bzlog ste /
translated: Thinking, consciousness is infinite, he enters and dwells in the base of infinite consciousness.🔽Thinking, consciousness is infinite, he enters and dwells in the base of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa de nyid la mtha' yas pa'i rnam pas mos par byed cing /🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa las yang dag par 'das pas na de'i phyir /🔽de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /🔽rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de nyid la mtha' yas pa'i rnam pas mos par byed cing / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa las yang dag par 'das pas na de'i phyir / de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te / rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thinking, consciousness is infinite, he enters and dwells in the base of infinite consciousness.🔽Thinking, consciousness is infinite, he enters and dwells in the base of infinite consciousness.🔽Thinking, consciousness is infinite, he enters and dwells in the base of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thinking, consciousness is infinite, he enters and dwells in the base of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs las yang dag par 'das shing /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs las yang dag par 'das shing /
translated: They completely transcend the preparatory stage of the base of infinite consciousness and

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar du yid la byas pas /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar du yid la byas pas /
translated: they bring to mind the final stage of preparation.

original: gong ma sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed na /
analyzed: gong ma sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed na /
translated: When they enter into the actual basis of the result of the higher final stage of preparation,

original: de'i phyir rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs te /
translated: they accomplish the base of infinite consciousness and abide in it.

original: gzhan yang de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Moreover, they completely transcend the base of infinite consciousness in all aspects

original: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: and think, “There is nothing at all,” and they accomplish and abide in the base of nothing at all.

original: de rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las bskyod cing rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa ci yang rung ba dang ldan pa gzugs can ni gzugs can ma yin pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa na ma rnyed de /
analyzed: de rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las bskyod cing rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa ci yang rung ba dang ldan pa gzugs can ni gzugs can ma yin pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa na ma rnyed de /
translated: When they move beyond the base of infinite consciousness and seek any object of observation other than consciousness, they do not find any form that is not form.

original: des dmigs pa de ma rnyed @119b nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: des dmigs pa de ma rnyed @119b nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Since it does not find that object, it completely transcends the actual basis and access concentration of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: dmigs pa gzhan ci yang med do zhes mos par byed cing /
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan ci yang med do zhes mos par byed cing /
translated: It is resolved that there is no other object.

original: de ci yang med pa'i 'du shes kho na la mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ci yang med pa'i 'du shes kho na la mos par 'gyur te /
translated: It is resolved that there is only the discernment of nothingness.

original: des 'du shes la mos pa de la la na mang du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des 'du shes la mos pa de la la na mang du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it cultivates that resolution of discernment,

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: it completely transcends the access concentration of the base of nothingness.🔽It is resolved that there is nothing at all.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar du yid la byas pas sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas na /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar du yid la byas pas sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas na /
translated: Since it is cultivated until the culmination of the preparation, it enters meditative attainment on the actual basis that is the result of the culmination of the preparation.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “In every way it completely transcends the base of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Resolving that there is nothing at all, it establishes and abides in the base of nothingness.”

original: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas /
translated: Totally transcending the sphere of nothingness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: they achieve and abide in the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Totally transcending the sphere of nothingness means

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las bskyod cing ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes la rags par 'du shes shing /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las bskyod cing ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes la rags par 'du shes shing /
translated: that they move beyond the sphere of nothingness and, perceiving the sphere of nothingness as coarse,🔽they turn away from the sphere of nothingness because they perceive it as a fault.

original: nyes dmigs su 'du shes pa'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched las ldog par byed pas na de'i phyir de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nyes dmigs su 'du shes pa'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched las ldog par byed pas na de'i phyir de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “Totally transcending the sphere of nothingness.”

original: 'du shes med ces bya ba ni de sngon ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: 'du shes med ces bya ba ni de sngon ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni /
translated: As for the phrase “neither perception nor nonperception,” when they enter into the meditative absorption of the sphere of nothingness,

original: ci yang gi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das la /
analyzed: ci yang gi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das la /
translated: It is said to be “beyond the perception of something” because it transcends the perception of something.

original: da ltar ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pas na /
analyzed: da ltar ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pas na /
translated: It is said to be “beyond the perception of nothing” because it transcends the perception of nothing.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes med ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes med ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be “without perception.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This means

original: ci yang gi 'du shes dang ci yang med pa'i 'du shes med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ci yang gi 'du shes dang ci yang med pa'i 'du shes med pa la bya'o //
translated: that it is without the perception of something or the perception of nothing.

original: 'du shes med min zhes bya ba ni de'i 'du shes de 'di lta ste /🔽dper na 'du shes med pa 'am /
analyzed: 'du shes med min zhes bya ba ni de'i 'du shes de 'di lta ste / dper na 'du shes med pa 'am /
translated: It is said to be “neither with nor without perception” because the perception of that is not completely ceased,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms 'jug pa dag gi ltar rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pa ma yin te /🔽'du shes de phra zhing dmigs pa de la mtshan ma med par 'jug pa kho na yin pas na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms 'jug pa dag gi ltar rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pa ma yin te / 'du shes de phra zhing dmigs pa de la mtshan ma med par 'jug pa kho na yin pas na /
translated: as in the case of the state of composure without conception or the state of composure that is a cessation.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes med min zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes med min zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be “neither with nor without perception” because that perception is subtle and engages with its object without a sign.

original: skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de de ltar skye mched @120a * //
analyzed: skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de de ltar skye mched @120a * //
translated: It is said to “establish and abide in a sphere” because,

original: de la mos par byed pa na /
analyzed: de la mos par byed pa na /
translated: when one is devoted to that sphere,

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa las yang dag par 'das shing 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar du yid la byas las sbyor ba mthar thug🔽pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas na /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa las yang dag par 'das shing 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar du yid la byas las sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas na /
translated: It is called the base of nothingness because it is the meditative attainment that is the result of the final stage of preparation that fully transcends the actual basis and access concentration of the base of nothingness and focuses on the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment and its access concentration up to the final stage of preparation.🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In every way, fully transcend the base of nothingness and accomplish and abide in the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive differentiation should be understood according to the treatise Exposition of Valid Knowledge.

original: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni /
translated: The explanation of its nature is stated in the scriptures of the Sarvastivadins:

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du gzugs med pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni mdor bsdu na dge ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus shing sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //🔽de yang grogs las ni gzugs kyi phung po ma gtogs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du gzugs med pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni mdor bsdu na dge ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus shing sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid do // de yang grogs las ni gzugs kyi phung po ma gtogs te /
translated: They are also subsumed by the aggregates, bases and elements, since they are not separate from the aggregates, bases and elements, but they are not subsumed by the form aggregate, since they are not form.

original: gzugs med pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //🔽bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni rnam pa gnyis yod do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do // bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni rnam pa gnyis yod do zhes bshad de /
translated: They are also subsumed by the aggregates, bases and elements, since they are not separate from the aggregates, bases and elements, but they are not subsumed by the form aggregate, since they are not form.🔽The great treatise on differentiation explains that they are of two types:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The formless states are of two types:

original: ting nge 'dzin dang skyes nas thob pa'o //🔽de la ting nge 'dzin ni 'di lta ste /🔽gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang skyes nas thob pa'o // de la ting nge 'dzin ni 'di lta ste / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: those obtained from concentration and those obtained from birth.🔽Those obtained from concentration are the formless meditative attainments.

original: skyes nas thob pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Those obtained from birth are the formless realm.

original: der skyes pa gang yin pa de ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: der skyes pa gang yin pa de ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: That which is born there is the feeling, discernment, compositional factors, and consciousness that are unobscured and neutral.

original: tshig 'dis ni phung po bzhi po de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'dis ni phung po bzhi po de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches that the nature of those four aggregates is karmic maturation.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: Moreover, the great treatise on differentiation states:

original: gzugs med pa bzhi po dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bzhi po dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The nature of the four formless states is twofold.

original: bsgoms nas thong pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms nas thong pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'o //
translated: They are obtained through meditation and obtained from birth.

original: bsgoms nas thob ba ni sa de nyid kyis bsdus pa sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsgoms nas thob ba ni sa de nyid kyis bsdus pa sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Those obtained through meditation are the essence of one pointed mind subsumed by that level.

original: grogs dang bcas pa ni phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: grogs dang bcas pa ni phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: When accompanied by companions, they are the essence of the four aggregates.

original: skyes nas thob pa ni sa de nyid dang ldan pa gzhan phung po bzhi po dag gi ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa ni sa de nyid dang ldan pa gzhan phung po bzhi po dag gi ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Those obtained from birth are the essence of the four aggregates that possess that level.

original: theg pa chen po'i @120b gzhung gis ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag dang mthun te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i @120b gzhung gis ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag dang mthun te /
translated: The Mahayana scriptures teach that the nature of reality is the same as that of the Sarvastivadins.

original: de la bye brag yod pa ni gzugs kyi phung po yang yod ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs ni gzugs med par yang gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa ni gzugs kyi phung po yang yod ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs ni gzugs med par yang gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say that form exists in the formless realm because the form that is the object of concentration exists there.

original: yang rnam pa bzhi yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bzhi yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four kinds of immeasurables:

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms tshad med pa bzhi po re re la yang /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms tshad med pa bzhi po re re la yang /
translated: love, compassion, joy, and impartiality.🔽Each of these four has a type of serenity.

original: zhi gnas rnam pa re re yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa zhi gnas rnam pa bzhi bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas rnam pa re re yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa zhi gnas rnam pa bzhi bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the third explanation of the four types of serenity.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The four immeasurables are associated with concentration.

original: tshad med pa bzhi po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis dbye bar bya ste /
translated: These four immeasurables are divided into two types of doors.

original: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the etymology and the explanation of the nature.

original: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The explanation of the etymology is twofold:

original: spyi dang bye brag go //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag go //
translated: the general and the specific.

original: de la tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming ste /
analyzed: de la tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming ste /
translated: The general term is immeasurable.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du rnam grangs rnam pa bzhis ston te /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du rnam grangs rnam pa bzhis ston te /
translated: The treatise of the Sarvastivadins teaches through four enumerations, as taught in the Great Exegesis.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore the treatise itself says:🔽What is the meaning of immeasurable?

original: de'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / sems can la khyab par dmigs shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na / smras pa / sems can la khyab par dmigs shing /
translated: It is said:

original: spros pa'i nyon mongs pa tshad med pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa'i nyon mongs pa tshad med pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they focus on sentient beings and are antidotes to immeasurable proliferation afflictions, they are called immeasurable.

original: spros pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spros pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Proliferation is twofold:

original: lta ba'i nyon mongs pa dang srid pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i nyon mongs pa dang srid pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: afflictions of view and afflictions of existence.

original: de'i phyir spros pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir spros pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called proliferation afflictions.

original: gzhan yang sems can la khyab par dmigs shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can la khyab par dmigs shing /
translated: Furthermore, it is focused on pervading all sentient beings.🔽

original: bag med pa'i nyon mongs pa tshad med pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i nyon mongs pa tshad med pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they are called immeasurables because they focus on sentient beings pervading space and they are the antidote to the immeasurable affliction of carelessness.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Afflictions of the desire realm are called the affliction of carelessness.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyis rgya cher bgrod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyis rgya cher bgrod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, these four are called immeasurables because they are the basis for the extensive journey of āryas.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa yul du gyur pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams tshad med pa skyed pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu tshad med pa rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa yul du gyur pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams tshad med pa skyed pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu tshad med pa rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, these four are immeasurables because they focus on immeasurable sentient beings, they generate immeasurable merit and they lead to immeasurable results.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las ni /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las ni /
translated: This is stated in the treatise on the Abhidharmakośa and it accords with correct reasoning.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa'i rnam grangs bzhi pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //🔽theg pa @121a * //🔽chen po'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa'i rnam grangs bzhi pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo // theg pa @121a * // chen po'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: This is in agreement with the fourth type of immeasurability taught in the Great Commentary.

original: don rnam pa gsum gyis tshad med pa zhes ston te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gyis tshad med pa zhes ston te /
translated: The Mahayana scriptures teach the immeasurabilities in terms of three types of objects, as explained in the commentary.

original: yangs pa dang che ba dang tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa dang che ba dang tshad med pa'o //
translated: They are vast, great, and immeasurable.

original: de la yangs pa ni mthong ba'i spyod yul yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yangs pa ni mthong ba'i spyod yul yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vast means the object of seeing.

original: che ba ni thos pa'i spyod yul yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: che ba ni thos pa'i spyod yul yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great means the object of hearing.

original: tshad med pa ni bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immeasurable means the object of discerning and knowing.

original: 'di ltar don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis phyogs gcig la khyab par dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis phyogs gcig la khyab par dmigs pa nas /
translated: These three types of objects are found in the first immeasurability, the object of seeing.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i bar gyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can gyi 'jig rten mtha' med pa dag la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i bar gyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can gyi 'jig rten mtha' med pa dag la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Likewise, they are called immeasurable because they focus on the limitless world of sentient beings and the world of physical cosmos in the ten directions.

original: de la bye brag gi ming ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi ming ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba nyid de /
translated: They are called specific names of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bstan pa bzhin du byams pa ni bde ba sbyin pa'o /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bstan pa bzhin du byams pa ni bde ba sbyin pa'o /
translated: The treatise of the Abhidharmakośa explains that love is giving happiness,

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal las 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal las 'dren pa'o //
translated: compassion is drawing beings out of suffering,

original: dga' ba ni mos shing ma gu ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni mos shing ma gu ba'o //
translated: joy is delighting in the virtues of others,

original: btang snyoms ni mnyam pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni mnyam pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: and equanimity is sameness.🔽The great treatise on differentiation explains:

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni phan gdags pa gang yin pa de ni byams pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni phan gdags pa gang yin pa de ni byams pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of love is benefiting.

original: gnod pa rab tu sel ba gang yin pa de ni snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnod pa rab tu sel ba gang yin pa de ni snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of compassion is completely eliminating harm.

original: rab tu dga' zhing btang snyoms thob pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu dga' zhing btang snyoms thob pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of joy is that one obtains joy and equanimity.

original: brjed ngas pa 'jig cing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa ni btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa 'jig cing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa ni btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: The characteristic of equanimity is that one destroys forgetfulness and becomes balanced.🔽The Mahayana scriptures explain the four immeasurables in the following way.🔽The immeasurables of love and so on are explained in the Abhidharma

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du byams pa tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du byams pa tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and the Mahayana scriptures.

original: byams pa'i sems dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable of love is the thought of love that is accompanied by the thought of love.

original: byams pa'i sems dang bcas par gyur pa ni sems can sdug bsngal med pa dang / bde ba med pa dag la bde ba'i yo byad sbyin par 'dod cing /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang bcas par gyur pa ni sems can sdug bsngal med pa dang / bde ba med pa dag la bde ba'i yo byad sbyin par 'dod cing /
translated: The thought of love is the desire to give the necessities of happiness to sentient beings who are without suffering and without happiness.

original: yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽snying rje tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro // snying rje tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is accompanied by the thought of aspiration with the mind.

original: snying rje dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable of compassion is the thought of compassion that is accompanied by the thought of compassion.🔽The thought of compassion is the desire to remove the suffering of sentient beings who are suffering.

original: snying rje dang bcas pa'i sems ni sems can sdug bsngal ba dag la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'dron par 'dod cing yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje dang bcas pa'i sems ni sems can sdug bsngal ba dag la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'dron par 'dod cing yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind that is accompanied by compassion is the mind that is accompanied by the aspiration to remove the suffering of suffering beings.

original: dga' ba tshad med @121b pa ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: dga' ba tshad med @121b pa ni 'di lta ste //
translated: The immeasurables of joy are as follows:

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is accompanied by joy.

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mind that is accompanied by joy is as follows:

original: sems can gang dag bde ba dang ldan pa dag la de'i dga' ba'i rjes su yi rang zhing yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bde ba dang ldan pa dag la de'i dga' ba'i rjes su yi rang zhing yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind that is accompanied by the aspiration to rejoice in the joy of those beings who are happy.

original: btang snyoms tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽btang snyoms dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //🔽btang snyoms dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste / btang snyoms dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o // btang snyoms dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The immeasurables of equanimity are as follows:🔽The mind that is accompanied by equanimity.🔽The mind that is accompanied by equanimity is as follows:

original: chags pa med par 'dun cing yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chags pa med par 'dun cing yid kyis mos pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The mind that is accompanied by the aspiration to be free of attachment.

original: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni /
translated: The nature of loving kindness and compassion is taught in the treatise Vaibhashika scriptures explain them in two ways:

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du byams pa dang snying rje tshad med pa la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /🔽de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las kha cig na re byams pa dang snying rje gnyi ga yang zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du byams pa dang snying rje tshad med pa la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan te / de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las kha cig na re byams pa dang snying rje gnyi ga yang zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The great treatise on differentiation explains:

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say: Both loving kindness and compassion have the nature of the root of virtue nonaversion because they are antidotes to aversion.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyang bzung na ni /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyang bzung na ni /
translated: If they are also taken to be concomitant states,

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni phung po bzhi'o //
translated: then in the desire realm they comprise four aggregates.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni phung po lnga'o //🔽de la bye brag yod pa yang byams pa ni srog gcod pa'i zhe sdang gi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni phung po lnga'o // de la bye brag yod pa yang byams pa ni srog gcod pa'i zhe sdang gi gnyen po'o //
translated: In the form realm they comprise five aggregates.

original: snying rje ni rdeg pa la sogs pa'i zhe sdang gi gnyen po'o zhe'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni rdeg pa la sogs pa'i zhe sdang gi gnyen po'o zhe'o //
translated: There is also a distinction in that loving kindness is the antidote to the aversion that takes life and compassion is the antidote to the aversion that beats and so on.

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Some say: Love is the essential nature of the root of the wholesome that is non-hatred.

original: snying rje ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Compassion is the essential nature of the root of the wholesome that is non-violence.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because it is the counteragent to violence.

original: dga' ba tshad med pa'i ngo bo nyid la yang bshad pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: dga' ba tshad med pa'i ngo bo nyid la yang bshad pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four explanations of the essential nature of immeasurable joy:

original: kha cig na re dga' ba ni dga' ba'i dbang po'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: kha cig na re dga' ba ni dga' ba'i dbang po'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Some say: Joy is the essential nature of the faculty of joy.

original: phung po bzhi dang / phung po lnga zhes bya ba yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po bzhi dang / phung po lnga zhes bya ba yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four aggregates and the five aggregates should be understood as above.

original: gal te dga' ba tshad med pa dga' ba'i dbang po'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dga' ba tshad med pa dga' ba'i dbang po'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If immeasurable joy is the essential nature of the faculty of joy,

original: bstan bcos rnam pa'i gnas bstan pa las bshad pa de ji ltar 'thad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam pa'i gnas bstan pa las bshad pa de ji ltar 'thad de /
translated: how can it be tenable that it is explained in the treatise, the teaching of the stages of concentration, as follows:

original: ji skad du dga' ba tshad med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dga' ba tshad med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is immeasurable joy?

original: 'di lta ste dga' ba dang dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / des bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las gnyis dang / des bslang ba'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni dga' ba @122a * //🔽zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /🔽'di dga' ba'i tshor ba tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dga' ba dang dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / des bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las gnyis dang / des bslang ba'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni dga' ba @122a * // zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste / 'di dga' ba'i tshor ba tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: For example, it is said:🔽That which is concomitant with joy and feeling, discernment, formation and consciousness, the two karmas of body and speech motivated by that, and the formations concomitant with the mind motivated by that are joy.🔽🔽Are there any that are concomitant with the feeling of joy?🔽

original: smras pa / tshig 'di ni 'di skad du dga' ba dang dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa'i rigs kyi tshor ba zhes brjod pa'i mi rigs te /🔽de ni 'don pa dag gis nor to //
analyzed: smras pa / tshig 'di ni 'di skad du dga' ba dang dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa'i rigs kyi tshor ba zhes brjod pa'i mi rigs te /🔽de ni 'don pa dag gis nor to //
translated: That is to say, feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness associated with joy and joy itself, the two karmas of body and speech motivated by joy, and the formations concomitant with the mind motivated by joy are joy.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos de las spyir phung po lnga la dga' ba tshad med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pas /🔽dga' ba'i tshor ba tshor ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos de las spyir phung po lnga la dga' ba tshad med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pas / dga' ba'i tshor ba tshor ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan yang /
translated: Moreover, since that treatise generally teaches that the five aggregates are the nature of boundless joy,🔽it is not contradictory to explain that although the feeling of joy is not concomitant with feeling,

original: gzhan yang sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyang 'gal ba med do zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyang 'gal ba med do zhe'o //
translated: other phenomena of the mind and mental factors are concomitant with feeling.

original: slob dpon kha cig ni 'di skad du dga' ba tshad med pa 'di ni mos pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig ni 'di skad du dga' ba tshad med pa 'di ni mos pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Some masters say: This boundless joy is the nature of aspiration,

original: mos pa'i tshor ba ma yin yang sems las byung ba gzhan zhig sems dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes zer te /🔽la la ni dga' ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par bshad la /
analyzed: mos pa'i tshor ba ma yin yang sems las byung ba gzhan zhig sems dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes zer te / la la ni dga' ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par bshad la /
translated: but although it is not the feeling of aspiration, it is a mental factor concomitant with the mind.🔽Some say it is concomitant with the faculty of joy.

original: la la ni dga' ba'i dbang po'i 'og tu skye'o zhes bshad pas de skad du bshad pa dag dang sbyar na /
analyzed: la la ni dga' ba'i dbang po'i 'og tu skye'o zhes bshad pas de skad du bshad pa dag dang sbyar na /
translated: Some say it arises after the faculty of joy.

original: dga' ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan na yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dga' ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan na yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in saying that it is associated with the feeling of joy.

original: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Equanimity is the root of virtue that is nonattachment.

original: phung po bzhi dang phung po lnga zhes bya ba yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phung po bzhi dang phung po lnga zhes bya ba yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The four aggregates and the five aggregates should be understood as above.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni rnam pa bzhi las /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni rnam pa bzhi las /
translated: In the Abhidharmakośa it is said that there are four types of immeasurables.

original: dang po gnyis kyis bdag nyid zhes dang med pa yang /
analyzed: dang po gnyis kyis bdag nyid zhes dang med pa yang /
translated: The first two are the self, and the third is the self and other.

original: yang dag pa'i don du ni snying rje ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du ni snying rje ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In reality, compassion should be said to be nonviolence.

original: dga' ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Joy is feeling.

original: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is nonattachment.

original: 'khor ni phung po lnga'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las kyang tshad med pa gsum ni /
analyzed: 'khor ni phung po lnga'o zhes 'byung ngo // bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las kyang tshad med pa gsum ni /
translated: The retinue is the five aggregates.🔽In the treatise Following Proper Reasoning, the three immeasurables

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bstan pa dag dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bstan pa dag dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: are explained in accordance with the teaching in the Abhidharmakośa.

original: dga' ba ni byed brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa'i slob dpon kha cig gis bshad pa dang mthun par mos pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ba ni byed brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa'i slob dpon kha cig gis bshad pa dang mthun par mos pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Joy is the nature of aspiration, as explained by some masters in the great commentary.

original: yang na ma chags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang na ma chags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: Or it is taught to be the nature of nonattachment.

original: dris lan dag gis rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: dris lan dag gis rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: The analysis of the four immeasurables is taught in the great treatise on differentiation.

original: ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood as taught there.

original: @122b de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las don gang las dgongs pa'i phyir /🔽mdo dag las /
analyzed: @122b de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las don gang las dgongs pa'i phyir / mdo dag las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise itself explains the meaning of the four immeasurables in terms of the sutras.🔽The four immeasurables are taught in the sutras:

original: tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms pa yang byams pa'i mtha' ni dge rgyas kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms pa yang byams pa'i mtha' ni dge rgyas kyi bar du'o //
translated: The limit of love is the abode of virtue.

original: snying rje'i mtha' ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i mtha' ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: The limit of compassion is the base of infinite space.

original: dga' ba ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: The limit of joy is the base of infinite consciousness.

original: btang snyoms ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs /
translated: The limit of equanimity is the base of nothingness.

original: ji ltar na gzugs kyi khams kyi chos kyis gzugs med pa 'bras bu 'dren par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs kyi khams kyi chos kyis gzugs med pa 'bras bu 'dren par byed /
translated: How could a phenomenon of the form realm generate a formless realm result?

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi po dag la snying rje med pa ni gang yang med na ci'i phyir byams pa bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni dge rgyas kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi po dag la snying rje med pa ni gang yang med na ci'i phyir byams pa bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni dge rgyas kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if there is no compassion in the four absorptions, why is the limit of the cultivation of loving kindness only the Abode of Virtue?

original: gzhan kha cig ni mdo'i tshig 'di byams pa'i gtso bos mkhyen pa yin no snyam du bsams nas don 'di 'chad pa yang yod do //🔽tshe dang ldan pa k'a ty'a ya na'i bus sngon don 'di shar ma tar ta la dris pa dang / btsun pa des kyang bsams bzhin du rab tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te /
analyzed: gzhan kha cig ni mdo'i tshig 'di byams pa'i gtso bos mkhyen pa yin no snyam du bsams nas don 'di 'chad pa yang yod do // tshe dang ldan pa k'a ty'a ya na'i bus sngon don 'di shar ma tar ta la dris pa dang / btsun pa des kyang bsams bzhin du rab tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te /
translated: Some think that the words of this sūtra are known by the chief of loving kindness and they explain the meaning in this way.🔽The venerable Kātyāyanīputra asked Śāradvatīputra about this matter and he said, “Venerable, I entered the samādhi of complete peace as I thought about this.”

original: phyi de nyin par bshad par byas pa las de'i tshe k'a ty'a ya na'i bu yang rab tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas ma phrad par gnyis yang mya ngan las 'das pas na /
analyzed: phyi de nyin par bshad par byas pa las de'i tshe k'a ty'a ya na'i bu yang rab tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas ma phrad par gnyis yang mya ngan las 'das pas na /
translated: He said he would explain it the next day, but on that day Kātyāyanīputra also entered the samādhi of complete peace and they both passed into nirvāṇa without meeting.

original: de'i phyir deng sang gi bar du gang gis kyang bshad par mi nus so zhes grag go zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir deng sang gi bar du gang gis kyang bshad par mi nus so zhes grag go zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, it is well known that no one is able to explain it to this day.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag ni 'di skad du mdo 'di ni 'dra ba tsam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag ni 'di skad du mdo 'di ni 'dra ba tsam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: This sutra should be understood to be stated from the perspective of mere similarity.

original: 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba'i chos ni byams pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba'i chos ni byams pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Because the phenomenon of the feeling of pleasure is similar to love,

original: byams pa ni bde ba sbyin pa lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / bde ba ni dge rgyas kyi bar du phyin pa yin pas sa gong ma dag la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byams pa ni bde ba sbyin pa lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / bde ba ni dge rgyas kyi bar du phyin pa yin pas sa gong ma dag la med pa'i phyir /
translated: because love operates like the giving of pleasure and because pleasure exists up to the stage of the extensive increase of virtue, it does not exist on higher levels.

original: byams pa bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni dge rgyas yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni dge rgyas yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the limit of cultivating love is the stage of the extensive increase of virtue.

original: sdug bsngal gyi chos dang ma bral ba gang yin pa de ni snying rje dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi chos dang ma bral ba gang yin pa de ni snying rje dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: That which is not free from the phenomenon of pain is similar to compassion.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal las 'dren pa lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can gyi lus ni sdug bsngal rags pa spyod pa'i rgyu byed pas /
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal las 'dren pa lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / gzugs can gyi lus ni sdug bsngal rags pa spyod pa'i rgyu byed pas /
translated: Compassion engages in the aspect of delivering from suffering and the physical body is the cause of engaging in gross suffering.

original: lus dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag la ni mgo gcad pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs ni lus gzugs can dag la yongs su skyo ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag la ni mgo gcad pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs ni lus gzugs can dag la yongs su skyo ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since those who possess a body have their heads cut off and so on and since the access concentration to the base of infinite space is fully discouraged by the physical body,

original: snying rje bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni nam mkha' mtha' @123a * //🔽yas skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni nam mkha' mtha' @123a * // yas skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the limit of cultivating compassion is the base of infinite space.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i chos ni dga' ba dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i chos ni dga' ba dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The attribute of pliancy is similar to joy.

original: dga' ba ni bde ba'i rnam pa 'byed pa lta bur 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba 'phel ba gang yin pa de ni rang gi rnam par shes pa mtha' med pa la dmigs pa'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dga' ba ni bde ba'i rnam pa 'byed pa lta bur 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba 'phel ba gang yin pa de ni rang gi rnam par shes pa mtha' med pa la dmigs pa'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Joy is like the aspect of differentiation of pleasure and the increase of the bliss of pliancy of the base of infinite consciousness is the gateway of the focus on infinite consciousness.

original: mtha' med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu 'phel ba dang bde bar gyur pa'i phyir dga' ba bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽yongs su spangs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: mtha' med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu 'phel ba dang bde bar gyur pa'i phyir dga' ba bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // yongs su spangs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The limit of the cultivation of joy is the base of infinite consciousness because it is the limit of the increase of the characteristics of infinite consciousness and it is bliss.

original: btang snyoms ni yongs su spangs pa lta bu'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni nyer bsdogs kyi dbang gis mtha' med pa spong ba'i rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni yongs su spangs pa lta bu'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni nyer bsdogs kyi dbang gis mtha' med pa spong ba'i rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: The phenomena that are completely abandoned are similar to equanimity because equanimity engages in the aspect of complete abandonment and the base of nothingness completely abandons the aspect of infinity through the power of access concentration.

original: btang snyoms bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba nas /🔽rnam grangs rnam pa gsum gyis rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms bsgoms pa'i mtha' ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba nas / rnam grangs rnam pa gsum gyis rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The culmination of cultivating equanimity is the base of nothingness.

original: mdo sde dag ni tshad med pa bzhi po dag ni thams cad kyang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: mdo sde dag ni tshad med pa bzhi po dag ni thams cad kyang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: The sutras state that the four immeasurables are all by nature wisdom.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las /
translated: Thus the treatise Establishing Reality states:

original: ci gsum po 'di dag kyang byams pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci gsum po 'di dag kyang byams pa yin nam /
translated: Are these three also love?

original: smras pa / byams pa'i sems kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum nyid yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / byams pa'i sems kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum nyid yin te /
translated: It is said that they are the three specific aspects of the mind of love.

original: 'di ltar sems mnyam pa nyid kyis mdza' ba shes dang dgra bo'i sems spangs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mnyam pa nyid kyis mdza' ba shes dang dgra bo'i sems spangs nas /
translated: Thus, by means of the sameness of mind, one abandons the mind of friend and foe and

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: one rests in the sameness of mind of love for all sentient beings.

original: snying rje dang dga' ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: snying rje dang dga' ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: Compassion and joy are also like that.

original: de'i phyir ngas sngar byams pa'i sems skyes pa'i bye brag gis snying rje dang dga' ba la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi po dag ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngas sngar byams pa'i sems skyes pa'i bye brag gis snying rje dang dga' ba la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi po dag ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore I have taught that the four immeasurables, love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, are by nature wisdom.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana,

original: so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: the explanations of each are not the same.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag kun kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag kun kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: “The four immeasurables are all by nature concentration, wisdom, and the mind and mental factors concomitant with them.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /🔽@123b byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las / @123b byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition states:🔽“Love is the root of virtue of nonaversion.

original: snying rje ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Compassion is the root of virtue of nonviolence.

original: dga' ba ni phrag dog med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ba ni phrag dog med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Joy is the root of virtue that is free of envy.

original: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa dang zhes dang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa dang zhes dang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Equanimity is the root of virtue that is free of attachment and aversion.

original: thams cad kyang sems can la snying brtse ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sems can la snying brtse ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All four are characterized by compassion for sentient beings.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag las byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag las byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa kho na'o //
translated: From among these four types, love is the absence of aversion alone.

original: de'i 'og ma tshad med pa gnyis ni zhes dang med pa'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma tshad med pa gnyis ni zhes dang med pa'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: The next two immeasurables are the absence of attachment alone.🔽Equanimity is the absence of attachment and aversion alone.

original: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i phyogs gcig go / gzhan yang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang de dag gi 'khor dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag kyang tshad med pa bzhi'i bdag nyid yin no zhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i phyogs gcig go / gzhan yang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang de dag gi 'khor dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag kyang tshad med pa bzhi'i bdag nyid yin no zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: Moreover, the concentration associated with them, the mind and mental factors, and their retinue are the nature of the four immeasurables.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽le'u 'di las sngar gong du ni zhi gnas sngar bstan la lhag mthong ni phyis bstan na ci'i phyir sgo gong ma 'di gnyis las sdar lhag mthong bstan la /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o // le'u 'di las sngar gong du ni zhi gnas sngar bstan la lhag mthong ni phyis bstan na ci'i phyir sgo gong ma 'di gnyis las sdar lhag mthong bstan la /
translated: The extensive differentiation should be understood according to what appears in the teaching of characteristics.

original: zhi gnas ni phyis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: zhi gnas ni phyis bstan zhe na /
translated: In this chapter, previously above, śamatha was taught first and then vipaśyanā. Why are the two in the above verse taught in the reverse order, with vipaśyanā taught first and then śamatha?

original: smras pa / go rims la rnam pa gnyis yod pas /
analyzed: smras pa / go rims la rnam pa gnyis yod pas /
translated: It is said: There are two orders.

original: dang po ni rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i go rims te /
analyzed: dang po ni rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i go rims te /
translated: The first is the order of cultivating yoga,

original: sngar zhi gnas bstan la lhag mthong phyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngar zhi gnas bstan la lhag mthong phyis bstan pa'o //
translated: where śamatha is taught first and vipaśyanā is taught later.

original: gnyis pa ni tha snyad kyi go rims te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni tha snyad kyi go rims te /
translated: The second is the order of conventions,

original: don nges pa med pas de'i phyir 'dir ni tha snyad kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don nges pa med pas de'i phyir 'dir ni tha snyad kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa'o //
translated: where there is no fixed order of meaning. Therefore, here the teaching is made in terms of conventions.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na rnal 'byor bsgom pa la don rnam pa gnyis yod pas /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na rnal 'byor bsgom pa la don rnam pa gnyis yod pas /
translated: In another enumeration, there are two topics in the cultivation of yoga.

original: dang po ni zhi gnas la brten nas lhag mthong skye'o //
analyzed: dang po ni zhi gnas la brten nas lhag mthong skye'o //
translated: First, vipaśyanā arises in dependence on śamatha.

original: gnyis pa ni lhag mthong gi dbang gis zhi gnas rab tu 'dren pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lhag mthong gi dbang gis zhi gnas rab tu 'dren pa ste /
translated: The second is that insight leads to serenity.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las zhi gnas kyis rten byas pa'i phyir ni lhag mthong myur du rnam par dag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las zhi gnas kyis rten byas pa'i phyir ni lhag mthong myur du rnam par dag par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus the Levels of Yogic Deeds says, “Because serenity is the basis, insight becomes swift and pure.

original: lhag mthong gis rten byas pa'i phyir ni zhi gnas 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas /🔽don de'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis rten byas pa'i phyir ni zhi gnas 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas / don de'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do /
translated: Because insight is the basis, serenity increases and expands.”

original: // / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction between these two.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
translated: “Bhagavat, you have also said that there is serenity and insight that abide in reality.

original: @124a * // gzhan yang chos la mi gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
analyzed: @124a * // gzhan yang chos la mi gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
translated: You have also said that there is serenity and insight that do not abide in reality.

original: dgu pa chos la brten pa dang mi brten pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: dgu pa chos la brten pa dang mi brten pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The ninth chapter is called “The Gate of Teaching on Śamatha and Vipaśyanā That Are and Are Not Supported by Dharma.”

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: chos la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bstan pa'i sgo dang 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bstan pa'i sgo dang / 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: chos la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bstan pa'i sgo dang 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bstan pa'i sgo dang / 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i sgo'o //
translated: the gate of teaching on being and not being supported by dharma, the gate of teaching on the observation of mixed and unmixed dharmas, and the gate of teaching on the distinctions of the observation of mixed dharmas.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is also divided into two parts: the request and the reply.

original: zhu ba gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The request is also divided into two parts:

original: brten pa'i mtshan nyid smos pa dang bstan pa nyid la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: brten pa'i mtshan nyid smos pa dang bstan pa nyid la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: the request that mentions the characteristics of support and the request that is based on the teaching itself.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: ji ltar na chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags /
translated: How is it that śamatha and vipaśyanā are supported by dharma?

original: ji ltar na chos la mi gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa nyid la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos la mi gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa nyid la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the second question, which is a request for instruction.

original: zhu pa gsol ba la dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: zhu pa gsol ba la dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The two intentions in the request are evident from the sutra itself.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:🔽Son of noble family, the calm abiding and insight of a bodhisattva who has previously taken up and contemplated the meanings of the signs of phenomena are called calm abiding and insight that rely on phenomena.

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sngar yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'i don dag la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de ni chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs🔽pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sngar yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'i don dag la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de ni chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This passage from here on teaches the second, the Tathagata's reply.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts.

original: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa dang / chos la brten nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis dang / dad pa la brtsams nas chos la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa dang / chos la brten nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis dang / dad pa la brtsams nas chos la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the question, beginning with “in dependence on the Dharma,” teaches the abiding and non-abiding in the Dharma, beginning with faith.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also twofold:

original: chos la gnas pa bstan pa dang / chos la mi gnas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos la gnas pa bstan pa dang / chos la mi gnas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of abiding in the Dharma and the teaching of non-abiding in the Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos la gnas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos la gnas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of abiding in the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sdar thos pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i shes rab kyis bsams pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de nyid la chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas @124b dang lhag mthong zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sdar thos pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i shes rab kyis bsams pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de nyid la chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas @124b dang lhag mthong zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas, by the wisdom of hearing, are well-taken care of, and by the wisdom of reflection, they attain serenity and insight into the meaning of the twelve branches of the scriptures, the Dharma that is reflected upon. That itself is called the serenity and insight of abiding in the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma la mi ltos par gzhan gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma la mi ltos par gzhan gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la brten nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have taken it up and who, without depending on the signs of the Dharma that they have contemplated, rely on the instructions and follow up teachings of others.

original: de dag gi don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa chos la mi gnas pa ston to //
analyzed: de dag gi don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa chos la mi gnas pa ston to //
translated: The second is shown by the passage beginning “The bodhisattva who has attained serenity and insight on the basis of another’s instruction and demonstration, without relying on the signs of the Dharma that have been received and contemplated.”

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three sections:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: a brief introduction, an extensive explanation, and a concluding summary.

original: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the brief introduction:

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang bzhin brtul ba'i phyir yongs su bzung ba dang bsams pa'i chos kyi don la mi ltos par /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang bzhin brtul ba'i phyir yongs su bzung ba dang bsams pa'i chos kyi don la mi ltos par /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas who have attained serenity and insight on the basis of another’s instruction and demonstration, without relying on the meaning of the Dharma that has been received and contemplated, do not rely on the signs of the Dharma.🔽This is the extensive explanation:🔽It is like this.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i dbang gis de dag gi don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i dbang gis de dag gi don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have attained serenity and insight on the basis of another’s instruction and demonstration, without relying on the meaning of the Dharma that has been received and contemplated, do not rely on the signs of the Dharma.🔽This is the concluding summary:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rnam par bsngos pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa 'am /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have attained serenity and insight on the basis of another’s instruction and demonstration, without relying on the meaning of the Dharma that has been received and contemplated, do not rely on the signs of the Dharma.

original: rnam par rnags pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam par rnags pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa 'am /
translated: The discernment of the repulsiveness of the bloated, etc.

original: 'du byed thams cad kyi mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad kyi mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: The impermanence of all conditioned phenomena.

original: 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: The suffering of conditioned phenomena.

original: chos thams cad la bdag med pa zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bdag med pa zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: The selflessness of all phenomena.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du zhi ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rgya cher bshad pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du zhi ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rgya cher bshad pa ste /
translated: Nirvana is the ultimate peace.🔽The five aspects of the purity of meditative object are due to the power of instruction.

original: rjes su bstan pa'i mthus dmigs pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga po dag las mi gtsang ba nyid du bsgom pa la so sor rtog pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i mthus dmigs pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga po dag las mi gtsang ba nyid du bsgom pa la so sor rtog pa 'di lta ste /
