translated: The discernment of the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body is as follows:

original: rnam par bsngos pa dang rnam par rangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa dang rnam par rangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the repulsiveness of the bloated, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the livid, etc.🔽The word “etc.” includes the meditation on the repulsiveness of the festering, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the cut up, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the gnawed, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the scattered, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the decomposed, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the skeleton, the meditation on the repulsiveness of blood, the meditation on the repulsiveness of pus, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the bloated, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the worm infested, the meditation on the repulsiveness of the burning, and the meditation on the repulsiveness of the corpse.🔽The meditation on the repulsiveness of the bloated is the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body in the aspect of its being like a bloated leather bag filled with air.🔽The meditation on the repulsiveness of the livid is the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body in the aspect of its being like a leather bag filled with blood.🔽The meditation on the repulsiveness of the festering is the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body in the aspect of its being like a leather bag filled with pus.🔽The meditation on the repulsiveness of the cut up is the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body in the aspect of its being like a leather bag cut open and turned inside out.🔽The meditation on the repulsiveness of the gnawed is the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body in the aspect of its being like a leather bag gnawed by rats.🔽The meditation on the repulsiveness of the scattered is the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body in the aspect of its being like a leather bag filled with excrement and urine and scattered in all directions.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya bas ni byams pa bsgom pa'i yul nas de bzhin du bye brag gi mtshan nyid dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs pa'i yul rnams bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya bas ni byams pa bsgom pa'i yul nas de bzhin du bye brag gi mtshan nyid dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs pa'i yul rnams bsdu ba'o //
translated: The meditation on the repulsiveness of the decomposed is the meditation on the repulsiveness of the body in the aspect of its being like a leather bag filled with excrement and urine and left for three or four days in the hot season.🔽The meditation on the repulsiveness of the skeleton is the

original: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dran pa nyer bar gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dran pa nyer bar gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are taught by the words “all formations are impermanent” up to “all dharmas are without self.”

original: gong du bstan pa'i rnal 'byor de dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dmigs pa'i yul las mi rtag pa nas bdag med pa la sogs par so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dran pa nyi bar gzhag pa yin te
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i rnal 'byor de dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dmigs pa'i yul las mi rtag pa nas bdag med pa la sogs par so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dran pa nyi bar gzhag pa yin te
translated: The yogas taught above are the foundations of mindfulness of the general characteristics, which are the individual conceptualizations of impermanence, etc. up to the absence of self in regard to the objective supports of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: / de bzhin du brag pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis sdug bsngal dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'am /🔽yang na mi slob dpa'i gnas skabs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'o zhes so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du brag pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis sdug bsngal dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'am / yang na mi slob dpa'i gnas skabs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'o zhes so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the yogas of the absence of a real being, etc. are the foundations of mindfulness of the general characteristics, which are the individual conceptualizations of suffering, impermanence, etc.🔽Or else, the foundations of mindfulness of the general characteristics are the individual conceptualizations of the state of the adept, i.e., nirvana, as peace.

original: yang na rnam par bsngos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi gtsang ba nyid du bsgom pa'i rnal @125a * //
analyzed: yang na rnam par bsngos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi gtsang ba nyid du bsgom pa'i rnal @125a * //
translated: Or else, the foundations of mindfulness of the general characteristics are the individual conceptualizations of the state of the adept, i.e., nirvana, as peace.

original: 'byor las / 'du shes rnam pa dgu'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: 'byor las / 'du shes rnam pa dgu'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: The yoga of the nine perceptions is the yoga of the prosperous.

original: 'du shes rnam pa dgu'i rnal 'byor ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: 'du shes rnam pa dgu'i rnal 'byor ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las rgya cher ston to //
translated: The yoga of the nine perceptions is taught extensively in the commentary on the noble perfection of wisdom.

original: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa la sogs par bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa la sogs par bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi phyag rgya yin te /
translated: The meditation on all compounded things as impermanent and so on is the dharma mudra.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid nges pa nyid du rtog cing rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i don gyis chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid nges pa nyid du rtog cing rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i don gyis chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the dharma mudra because it is the definite characteristic of phenomena and it is the meaning that is immutable.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Ornament of Mahayana Sutras says:

original: chos kyi phyag rgya bzhi ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyag rgya dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i phyag rgya dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa'i phyag rgya dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de ni chos kyi phyag rgya bzhi zhes bya ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya bzhi ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'i phyag rgya dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i phyag rgya dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa'i phyag rgya dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de ni chos kyi phyag rgya bzhi zhes bya ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The four Dharma seals are the seal of impermanence of all conditioned phenomena, the seal of suffering of all conditioned phenomena, the seal of all phenomena being selfless and the seal of nirvana being peace.🔽The Sutra Gathering the Bodhisattva Canon states that there are four summaries of Dharma:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bsdus nas sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las ni chos kyi mdo bzhi zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bsdus nas sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las ni chos kyi mdo bzhi zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The four summaries of Dharma are:

original: de ni mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid de ji skad du mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos mdor bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid de ji skad du mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos mdor bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The summary of impermanence is the defining characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The summary of suffering is the defining characteristic of contaminated phenomena.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase selflessness is the defining characteristic of the brief indication of all dharmas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas mdor bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase nirvana is peace is the defining characteristic of the brief indication of the unconditioned.

original: bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Reality and in the commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom,

original: chos kyi phyag rgya gsum zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya gsum zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the three seals of the Dharma are mentioned.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phyag rgya bstan pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phyag rgya bstan pas so //
translated: The seal of the Dharma is taught by the seal of suffering.

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi'i don rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi mdo dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo dang / bstan bcos sa yongs su 'dzin pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //

translated: The extensive analysis of the meaning of the four aphorisms of the Dharma should be understood according to the Bodhisattva Canon Sutra, the Sutra Teaching Good Conduct, and the treatises Holding the Levels and Levels of Yogic Practice.
