original: 'di ni dang po ste 'di ltar chos la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po rno ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes ston par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste 'di ltar chos la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po rno ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes ston par mdzad pas so //
translated: This is the first, since one who obtains serenity and insight on the basis of the teachings is said by the Tathāgata to be a follower of the teachings, because he has sharp intellectual faculties.

original: chos la mi brten par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la mi brten par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir /
translated: One who obtains serenity and insight without relying on the teachings🔽is said by the Tathāgata to be a follower of faith, because he has dull intellectual faculties.

original: ngas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang po rtul po nyid du 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa chos la mi brten pa rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ngas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang po rtul po nyid du 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa chos la mi brten pa rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the second explanation of the one who does not rely on the teachings.

original: gzhan dag gi rjes su bstan pa la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po rtul ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes ston par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rjes su bstan pa la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po rtul ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes ston par mdzad pas so //
translated: One who obtains serenity and insight on the basis of the instructions of others is said by the Tathāgata to be a follower of faith, because he has dull intellectual faculties.

original: dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang pa de yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang pa de yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: These followers of faith and of the teachings are also called followers by faith and followers of reality, respectively.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni 'di skad du mdo las /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni 'di skad du mdo las /
translated: The scriptures of the Sarvastivadins state:

original: gang zag ni rnam pa bdun yod do /
analyzed: gang zag ni rnam pa bdun yod do /
translated: There are seven types of persons:

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: those who follow by faith, those who follow by doctrinal insight, those resolute in faith, those who obtain by insight, those physically liberated, those liberated by wisdom, and those liberated by both aspects.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs la gnas pa dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pas rjes su 'brang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs la gnas pa dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pas rjes su 'brang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those of dull faculty who abide in the state of the path of seeing are called those who follow by faith.

original: dbang po rnon po gang yin ba de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po gang yin ba de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculty are called those who follow by doctrinal insight.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs la gnas pa dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pas mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs la gnas pa dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pas mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those of dull faculty who abide in the state of the path of meditation are called those resolute in faith.

original: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculty are called those who obtain by insight.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has obtained the meditative attainment of cessation is called “liberated by the body.”

original: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs su 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa da dung ma thong ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs su 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa da dung ma thong ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has not yet obtained the meditative attainment of cessation in the state of no more learning is called “liberated by wisdom.”

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: One who has obtained the meditative attainment of cessation is called “liberated from both aspects.”

original: zhib tu ni bstan bcos rnams las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni bstan bcos rnams las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the treatises.

original: mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis @126a * //
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis @126a * //
translated: The Sautrāntika system says that both followers of faith and followers of reality

original: ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol ba'o //
analyzed: ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol ba'o //
translated: are in the presence of the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes zer te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes zer te /
translated: One who abides on the path of seeing is called “one who practices without signs.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Establishing Reality says:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three types of persons who follow the stream-enterer.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang mtshan ma med par spyod pa can no //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang mtshan ma med par spyod pa can no //
translated: They are the one who follows by faith, the one who follows by doctrines, and the one who practices without signs.

original: de la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ni gang zag gis stong ba dang / bdag med pa'i shes pa ma thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ni gang zag gis stong ba dang / bdag med pa'i shes pa ma thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The one who follows by faith is the person who has not yet attained the knowledge of the emptiness of the person and of selflessness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung la mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung la mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has faith in the Buddha's teaching and follows the Buddha's teaching, he is called the one who follows by faith.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni gang zag de bdag med pa'i shes pa thob nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi la gnas shing /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni gang zag de bdag med pa'i shes pa thob nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi la gnas shing /
translated: The one who follows by doctrines is the person who, having attained the knowledge of selflessness, abides in the four roots of merit.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who follows doctrines is called the one who follows by doctrines.

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag 'di gnyis mthong ba'i lam la zhugs nas /🔽'gog pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i phyir mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag 'di gnyis mthong ba'i lam la zhugs nas / 'gog pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i phyir mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: These two persons who follow faith and the dharma are called “those who practice without signs” because they have entered the path of seeing and have seen the truth of cessation.

original: bshad pa 'di dang spyar na dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol ba yin par mngon no //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang spyar na dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol ba yin par mngon no //
translated: This passage clearly shows that those who follow faith and the dharma are on the path of seeing.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po ba'i bstan pa dang sbyar na yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po ba'i bstan pa dang sbyar na yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: When this is applied to the Mahāyāna, there are also different explanations.🔽The commentary on the perfection of wisdom states:

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems bco lnga po dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems bco lnga po dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those with sharp intellectual faculty who have the fifteen moments of the path of seeing are called those who follow the dharma.

original: dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those with dull intellectual faculty are called those who follow faith.

original: gang zag gnyis po de nyid la mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes kyang bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang zag gnyis po de nyid la mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes kyang bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Those two persons are also called “those who practice without signs.”🔽The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis ni tshogs kyi lam dang mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis ni tshogs kyi lam dang mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa /
translated: Those who follow faith and those who follow the dharma are on the path of accumulation and the path of seeing.

original: sems bco lnga pa dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems bco lnga pa dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those of dull faculty who have fifteen moments of mind are called “those who follow faith.”

original: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculty are called “those who follow the dharma.”

original: sems bcu drug pa las gnas pa de nyid ni mthong bas thob pa zhes kyang bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sems bcu drug pa las gnas pa de nyid ni mthong bas thob pa zhes kyang bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Those who abide in the sixteenth moment of mind are also called “those who obtain results through seeing.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore the treatise itself states:

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who follow faith are as follows:

original: tshogs bsags pa dbang po rtul @126b po pha rol gyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nas /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa dbang po rtul @126b po pha rol gyis bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nas /
translated: Those who have accumulated the collections, who have dull faculties, who follow the teachings of others,

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the application to realize the truths.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The one who follows the teaching is as follows:

original: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rnon po bdag nyid kyis bden pa'i dbang du bya ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bden pa mngon par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rnon po bdag nyid kyis bden pa'i dbang du bya ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bden pa mngon par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the application to realize the truths by one who has accumulated the collections, has sharp faculties and, having followed the teaching that is the basis of the truths, has attained the result.

original: dad pas mos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dad pas mos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: One resolute in faith is as follows:

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang zag gang 'bras bu'i gnas su phyin pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang zag gang 'bras bu'i gnas su phyin pa'i dus na'o //
translated: It is the person who follows faith when he has attained the stage of the result.

original: mthong bas thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: One who obtains by insight is as follows:

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag 'bras bu'i gnas su phyin pa'i dus na'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag 'bras bu'i gnas su phyin pa'i dus na'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is the person who follows the teaching when he has attained the stage of the result.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la dad pas mos pa dang mthong bas thob pa zhes bya bas de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni dang pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin par
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la dad pas mos pa dang mthong bas thob pa zhes bya bas de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni dang pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin par
translated: Because of faith and interest in the state of the result, and because of the attainment of seeing, therefore, the state of the fifteenth moment of the path of seeing is the state of the follower of faith and the follower of reality.

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood.🔽The Vyakhyayukti and the Yogacarabhumi also explain this.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
translated: The Yogacarabhumi Sastra states:

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol pa gang yin pa de ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol pa gang yin pa de ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which precedes the path of seeing is called the follower of faith and the follower of reality.🔽That which abides on the path of seeing is called the one who practices without signs.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med par spyod pa can zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yang 'gal ba med de /
translated: This explanation is not contradictory.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mtshan ma med par spyod pa can gyi gang zag dang / dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag gnyis kyang mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol ba zhes bstan na ni 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par spyod pa can gyi gang zag dang / dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag gnyis kyang mthong ba'i lam gyi mdun rol ba zhes bstan na ni 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is taught that the person who practices without signs and the person who follows faith and the teachings are in front of the path of seeing, there would be a contradiction.

original: gal te de skad mi ston nan dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yang mthong ba'i lam du gtogs so //
analyzed: gal te de skad mi ston nan dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yang mthong ba'i lam du gtogs so //
translated: If it is not taught like that, then those who follow faith and the teachings would also belong to the path of seeing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nges par bstan pa'i gsung rab med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nges par bstan pa'i gsung rab med de /
translated: The bodhisattva is not included in the teachings of the definitive scriptures.

original: don gyis sa'i mdun rol ba dang sa la gnas pa dag dang sbyar bar bshad na yang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: don gyis sa'i mdun rol ba dang sa la gnas pa dag dang sbyar bar bshad na yang 'gal ba med de /
translated: If it is explained that the one in front of the stage and the one on the stage are connected by meaning, there is no contradiction.

original: yang dad pas mos pa la sogs pa logs shig na rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dad pas mos pa la sogs pa logs shig na rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because faith and devotion, etc. are established separately.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Blessed One as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavān said, “There is also śamatha and vipaśyanā that take up the mixed dharmas.”🔽The section that follows from “What is that?”

original: gzhan yang 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas ngang lhags thong zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston @127a * //🔽to ; /'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas ngang lhags thong zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston @127a * // to ; /'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: is the second part, the explanation of the gateway to the presentation of śamatha and vipaśyanā that take up mixed and unmixed dharmas.

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //🔽zhu pa gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o // zhu pa gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also divided into two parts: the request and the reply.

original: zhu ba gleng ba'i gnas bstan pa dang bstan pa bzhin du zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gleng ba'i gnas bstan pa dang bstan pa bzhin du zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: The request is also twofold: the statement that introduces the request and the actual request.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: ji ltar na ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi ba lags /
translated: What is called śamatha and vipaśyanā that take up the unmixed dharmas?”

original: ji ltar na 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi pa lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa bzhin du zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi pa lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa bzhin du zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the request for instruction in the second type.

original: zhu ba gsol ba la dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The request for instruction has two intentions, which are evident in the sutra itself.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' gang gis mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar gzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos la so sor dmigs shing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' gang gis mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar gzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos la so sor dmigs shing /
translated: Son of good family, when a bodhisattva has taken up the Dharma of the sutras and so on, and when he focuses on the Dharma that is contemplated,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: and when he cultivates serenity and insight, this is called serenity and insight that focus on unmixed phenomena.

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This passage shows the second type of reply, the Tathagata's correct response.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This reply is also of two types:

original: ma 'dres pa dmigs pa'i lan gsungs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa dmigs pa'i lan gsungs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The answer to the question of the object of the unmixed is stated, and the object of the unmixed is taught.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This statement of the sutra is also divided into two parts.

original: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The explanation and the conclusion.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This statement of the sutra also has two kinds of explanations.

original: kha cig na re ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis bstan pa dag so so nas tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig na re ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis bstan pa dag so so nas tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say that the object of the unmixed is the twelve branches of the scriptures taught separately,

original: so sor ma 'dres pa zhes bya'i sde re re la so so nas rnam pa mang ba'i phyir ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor ma 'dres pa zhes bya'i sde re re la so so nas rnam pa mang ba'i phyir ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: and that the unmixed is not called unmixed because each of the individual unmixed scriptures has many aspects.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so so'i yul gyi bdag nyid ma 'dres pa bstan to zhes zer te /
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so so'i yul gyi bdag nyid ma 'dres pa bstan to zhes zer te /
translated: The so-called Dharma of the sutra collection and so on refers to the twelve branches of the scriptures taught as the nature of each individual unmixed object.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ma 'dres pa'am 'dres pas sde re re la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ma 'dres pa'am 'dres pas sde re re la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When this explanation is applied, the object of each collection, whether unmixed or mixed, is called the object of the unmixed.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na 'dres pa phyi ma gsum las dang po 'dres pa chung du yang 'di'i nang du bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na 'dres pa phyi ma gsum las dang po 'dres pa chung du yang 'di'i nang du bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When this explanation is applied, the first of the last three mixed objects is included in this explanation.

original: kha cig na re so sor ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sde re re la yang so so nas rnam pa mang po yod @127b pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re so sor ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sde re re la yang so so nas rnam pa mang po yod @127b pa ste /
translated: Some say: The object of the unmixed is called the object of each unmixed collection, because each has many aspects.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag so so nas tha dad pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag so so nas tha dad pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa zhes bya'i /
translated: The twelve branches of scripture are called unmixed because each has a different meaning.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis kyi ming tha dad pa la ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis kyi ming tha dad pa la ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The different names of the twelve branches are not called unmixed.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya bas ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so so'i ma 'dres pa'i yul bstan to zhes zer te /
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya bas ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so so'i ma 'dres pa'i yul bstan to zhes zer te /
translated: The term Dharma of the sūtras and so on refers to the object of each unmixed branch of scripture.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan na gdod ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan na gdod ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When applied to this explanation, if it has two topics, it is called “observing the unmixed.”

original: sde tha dad pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: sde tha dad pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is different classes and different aspects.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa 'dir ni 'dres pa chung du mi bsdu ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa 'dir ni 'dres pa chung du mi bsdu ste /
translated: When applied to this explanation, the unmixed does not include the small mixed.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what it says.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos so sor ma 'dres pa la dmigs pas sngar bstan pa'i thos pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i shes rab kyis bsams pa'i tshig dang don gyi chos dag la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos so sor ma 'dres pa la dmigs pas sngar bstan pa'i thos pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i shes rab kyis bsams pa'i tshig dang don gyi chos dag la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that by observing the unmixed Dharma of the sutra collection and so on, it is the retention by the wisdom of hearing taught previously and it is the cultivation of serenity and insight with regard to the Dharma of words and meaning contemplated by the wisdom of contemplation.🔽That is called “observing the unmixed.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs shing /
translated: The bodhisattva observes all Dharma such as the sutra collection and so on.

original: gcig tu bzlum pa dang / gcig tu bsdu ba dang / gcig tu brtul ba dang / phung po gcig tu byas nas 'di snyam du yid la byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa 'dres pa la dmigs pa ston to //
analyzed: gcig tu bzlum pa dang / gcig tu bsdu ba dang / gcig tu brtul ba dang / phung po gcig tu byas nas 'di snyam du yid la byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa 'dres pa la dmigs pa ston to //
translated: The phrase having combined them into one, having collected them into one, having subdued them into one, having made them into one aggregate, he attends to them in this way and so on teaches the second object of meditation, the combined object.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is also twofold: explanation and summary.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The explanation is divided into three parts.

original: ma 'dres pa 'dres par bsdu ba'i yid la byed pa bstan pa dang / yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa 'dres par bsdu ba'i yid la byed pa bstan pa dang / yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: The first is the teaching on the mental attention that combines the uncombined, the second is the teaching on the characteristics of mental attention, and the third is the summary of the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: 'di ni dang po'o /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o /
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of this passage from the sutra.

original: kha cig na re mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs shing /
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs shing /
translated: Some say that all phenomena, such as the scriptural collections, are the objects of observation.

original: gcig tu bzlum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis spyir gcig tu zlum par byed pas /
analyzed: gcig tu bzlum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis spyir gcig tu zlum par byed pas /
translated: The phrase comprehensively included in one and so forth indicates that the twelve branches of scripture are generally included in one.

original: de'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase all is stated.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan na gdod thams cad bya ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan na gdod thams cad bya ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: If one possesses the twelve aspects, then one is called all-knowing because one knows all.

original: kha cig na re thams cad ces bya ba ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: kha cig na re thams cad ces bya ba ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: Some say that the word all possesses three meanings.

original: dang po ni gsung rab yan lag re re la yang rnam pa mang po yod pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: dang po ni gsung rab yan lag re re la yang rnam pa mang po yod pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
translated: The first is that the word all is stated because each of the twelve branches of scripture has many aspects.

original: @128a * // gnyis pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bsdus nas gcig tu bzlums pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: @128a * // gnyis pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bsdus nas gcig tu bzlums pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
translated: The second is that the word all is stated because the twelve branches of scripture are included and comprehensively subsumed in one.

original: gsum pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis bstan pa med pa rnams bsdus pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis bstan pa med pa rnams bsdus pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs te /
translated: The third is that the word all is stated because the twelve branches of scripture include what is not taught.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las 'dres pa 'di nyid las rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las 'dres pa 'di nyid las rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the sutras state that this very mixing is divided into three types:

original: 'dres pa chung du la sogs pa'o zhes zer te /🔽de ltar bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod kyang bshad pa ni phyi ma yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dres pa chung du la sogs pa'o zhes zer te / de ltar bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod kyang bshad pa ni phyi ma yang dag pa yin te /
translated: small mixing and so on.

original: tshig dang don dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig dang don dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there are two explanations, the latter is correct because it is consistent with the words and meaning.

original: de la bzlum pa dad bsdu ba dang brtul ba dang / phung po zhes bya ba yang don ni gcig la ming tha dad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzlum pa dad bsdu ba dang brtul ba dang / phung po zhes bya ba yang don ni gcig la ming tha dad par gyur pa'o //
translated: The words “compounded” saṃskṛta, “collected” saṃcita and “aggregate” skandha have the same meaning but different names.

original: de ni 'di skad du mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs shing /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs shing /
translated: This is stated in the sutras:🔽All phenomena such as the sutra class are observed and contemplated as the single collection of correct knowledge and then śamatha and vipaśyanā are cultivated.

original: gcig tu bzlum pa la yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid du bsams nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig tu bzlum pa la yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid du bsams nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is called śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on mixed phenomena.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: ci'i phyir yang rnam par rig pa tsam de la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rnam par rig pa tsam de la 'jug ce na /
translated: Why is that mere consciousness also engaged?

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis shes pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis shes pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is known through the supramundane śamatha and vipaśyanā that observe the mixed phenomena.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
translated: In the commentary on this by Rangjung Dorjé, it says:

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i de bzhin nyid yul du gyur pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i de bzhin nyid yul du gyur pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: “Observing mixed phenomena” refers to observing the suchness that is distinguished by the mixed characteristics of all phenomena.

original: theg pa chen po'i bstan pa las bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid byed pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i bstan pa las bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid byed pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i tshe /
translated: Because it is the suchness of all the phenomena that are taught in the Mahāyāna teachings, when suchness is observed,

original: de nyid chos thams cad gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa yin pas /
analyzed: de nyid chos thams cad gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa yin pas /
translated: that itself is the comprehension of the essence of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad la dmigs pa nyid de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dmigs pa nyid de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The object of all dharmas is the object of thusness.🔽All these dharmas are directed to thusness, flow to thusness,

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa /🔽de bzhin nyid la bab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa / de bzhin nyid la bab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: are fixed on thusness.

original: gnyis pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The second is the characteristic of attention.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also is twofold:

original: bstan pa la nus pa khyad par can rnam pa gsum yod par yid la byed pa bstan pa dang 'phags pa'i bstan pas dge ba'i chos mngon par brjod par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa la nus pa khyad par can rnam pa gsum yod par yid la byed pa bstan pa dang 'phags pa'i bstan pas dge ba'i chos mngon par brjod par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of attention to the three kinds of ability in the teaching, and the teaching of attention to the expression of good dharmas by the teaching of the noble ones.

original: dang po yang @128b rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang @128b rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also twofold:

original: de bzhin nyid kyi tshul las brtsams nas nus pa rnam pa gsum yid la byed par bstan pa dang / byang chub la sogs pa las brtsams nas nus pa rnam pa gsum yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi tshul las brtsams nas nus pa rnam pa gsum yid la byed par bstan pa dang / byang chub la sogs pa las brtsams nas nus pa rnam pa gsum yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of attention to the three kinds of ability beginning with thusness, and the teaching of attention to the three kinds of ability beginning with enlightenment.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first:

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di snyam du yid la byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di snyam du yid la byed de /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas think,

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag la nus pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag la nus pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The twelve branches of scripture have three kinds of power:

original: de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba dang / de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa dang / de bzhin nyid la bab pa'o snyam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba dang / de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa dang / de bzhin nyid la bab pa'o snyam pa ste /
translated: they lead to suchness, they descend into suchness, and they enter into suchness.

original: 'phags pa'i bstan pa de dag yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su gzhol ba'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'bab pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bstan pa de dag yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su gzhol ba'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'bab pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teachings of the noble ones are consistent with correct reasoning, they descend from correct reasoning, and they are consistent with correct reasoning.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na 'phags pa'i gsung rab kyi dbang gis shes rab rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na 'phags pa'i gsung rab kyi dbang gis shes rab rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In another enumeration, one obtains three kinds of wisdom through the power of the noble scriptures:

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis ni gzhol bar byed do //🔽bsams pa'i shes rab kyis ni 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis ni gzhol bar byed do // bsams pa'i shes rab kyis ni 'bab par byed do //
translated: through the wisdom of hearing, one is led to suchness;🔽through the wisdom of reflection, one descends into suchness;

original: bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis ni bab par byed do //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis ni bab par byed do //
translated: and through the wisdom of meditation, one enters into suchness.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa'i gsung rab kyi dbang gis sbyor ba rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te /🔽de la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la yun ring po nas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa'i gsung rab kyi dbang gis sbyor ba rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te / de la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la yun ring po nas sbyor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, through the power of the noble teachings, one obtains three kinds of application.🔽Application to that is application to reality for a long time.

original: 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application in that is proximate application.

original: bab pa zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bab pa zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application in it is final application.

original: tshig 'di gsum yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin las brtsams nas ston to //
analyzed: tshig 'di gsum yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin las brtsams nas ston to //
translated: These three terms are taught in the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra in terms of the applications of mindfulness, the meditative absorptions, and the samādhis.

original: byang chub la gzhol ba mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba gnas gyur pa gzhol ba /
analyzed: byang chub la gzhol ba mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba gnas gyur pa gzhol ba /
translated: Application to enlightenment, application to nirvāṇa, and application to the transmutation of the basis are the three kinds of application.

original: de dag la 'bab pa de dag la bab pa dag ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa byang chub la sogs pa las brtsams nas nus pa rnam pa gsum yid la byed par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'bab pa de dag la bab pa dag ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa byang chub la sogs pa las brtsams nas nus pa rnam pa gsum yid la byed par bstan pa'o //
translated: Application in them, application to them, and application in it are taught in the second verse, which refers to enlightenment, etc., and indicates three kinds of ability.

original: mtshan nyid 'di gsum ni gnas gsum du 'jug ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di gsum ni gnas gsum du 'jug ste /
translated: These three characteristics apply to three bases.

original: byang chub dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gnas gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gnas gyur ba'o //
translated: nirvana, and transformation.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag la ltos na /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag la ltos na /
translated: In relation to these twelve branches of the scriptures,

original: thams cad la yang gzhol ba dang 'bab pa dang bab pa'i nus pa khyad par can rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: thams cad la yang gzhol ba dang 'bab pa dang bab pa'i nus pa khyad par can rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: all of them have the three kinds of special power to lead to, to flow to, and to descend to.

original: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as above.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang gnas gyur ba la bye brag ci yod ce na /🔽smras pa / mya ngan @129a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang gnas gyur ba la bye brag ci yod ce na / smras pa / mya ngan @129a * //
translated: What is the difference between nirvana and transformation?

original: las 'das pa ni de bzhin nyid sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba'i don la brten nas bstan pa yin la gnas gyur pa ni byang chub dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yang bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: las 'das pa ni de bzhin nyid sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba'i don la brten nas bstan pa yin la gnas gyur pa ni byang chub dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yang bsdus pa yin te /
translated: It is said: Nirvana is taught in dependence on the meaning of thusness free from the two obstructions, and transformation includes both enlightenment and nirvana.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing the Reality of Representation says:

original: gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir gnas gyur ba thob pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir gnas gyur ba thob pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: “Because of the elimination of negative reflex actions, one attains transformation.”

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa las kyang byang chub dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas gyur pa rnam pa gnyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa las kyang byang chub dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas gyur pa rnam pa gnyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: And Master Dharmāśoka explains: “One attains the two transformations of enlightenment and nirvāṇa.”

original: gzhan yang byang chub ni 'dus byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub ni 'dus byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Moreover, enlightenment is the result of conditioned phenomena.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is the result of unconditioned phenomena.

original: gnas gyur pa ni chos kyi sku'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni chos kyi sku'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Transformation is the result of the dharmakāya.🔽All these phenomena are the expression of immeasurable and innumerable virtuous qualities.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag mngon par brjod pa yin no snyam du zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'phags pa bstan pas dge ba'i chos mngon par brjod par 'gyur bar yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag mngon par brjod pa yin no snyam du zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'phags pa bstan pas dge ba'i chos mngon par brjod par 'gyur bar yid la byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second mental attention taught, the expression of virtuous qualities through the teaching of the noble ones.

original: yang dag pa'i don du ni 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams ngo bo nyid yongs su rdzogs par ston pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du ni 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams ngo bo nyid yongs su rdzogs par ston pa yin mod kyi /
translated: In reality, the teachings of the noble ones fully reveal the essence.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yid la byed cing bsgom pa yongs su bstan par bzhed pa'i phyir phyogs gcig tu dge ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yid la byed cing bsgom pa yongs su bstan par bzhed pa'i phyir phyogs gcig tu dge ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase virtuous in one part is used because it is intended to show that one cultivates and practices attention to serenity and transcendent insight.

original: de ltar sems shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who is thus reflecting and cultivating serenity and transcendent insight is the third summary of the cultivation of serenity and transcendent insight.

original: de ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa bshad pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa bshad pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: The phrase this is called serenity and transcendent insight focused on compounded objects is the second summary of the explanation of the focus on compounded objects.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The sutra itself explains the meaning of compounded and uncompounded.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya then said to the Lord, Lord, you have said that there is serenity and transcendent insight focused on a small compounded object.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
translated: Lord, you have said that there is serenity and transcendent insight focused on a middling compounded object.

original: 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhig gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
analyzed: 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhig gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs /
translated: It is also called serenity and insight that focus on a combined object.🔽It is also called serenity and insight that focus on a combined object to an immeasurable degree.

original: 'dres pa tshad med pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: 'dres pa tshad med pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The passage beginning with the words “If you ask why, it is because…” and ending with the words “This is the first” presents the third section of this chapter, the section that explains the different kinds of serenity and insight that focus on a combined object.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du @129b dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du @129b dbye ste /
translated: This section is divided into three parts:

original: 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i sgo dang 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa rkyen dang ldan par rab tu bstan pa'i sgo dang rtogs pa dang thob pa'i gnas skabs rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i sgo dang 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa rkyen dang ldan par rab tu bstan pa'i sgo dang rtogs pa dang thob pa'i gnas skabs rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the section that explains the different kinds of serenity and insight that focus on a combined object, the section that explains the conditions for focusing on a combined object, and the section that analyzes the states of realization and attainment.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first part is divided into two sections:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request and the reply.

original: zhu ba gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The request is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba'i gnas gsung rab smos pa dang / bstan pa la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba'i gnas gsung rab smos pa dang / bstan pa la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: The first is the request for instruction, which is the request for instruction based on the scriptures.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: ji ltar na 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags /
translated: How is there śamatha and vipaśyanā that observe phenomena with little mixing?

original: ji ltar na 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags /
translated: How is there śamatha and vipaśyanā that observe phenomena with great mixing?🔽How is there śamatha and vipaśyanā that observe immeasurable phenomena?

original: ji ltar na 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the second request for instruction based on the teachings.

original: zhu ba gsol ba gsum yod pa ni mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba gsum yod pa ni mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The three requests are self-explanatory in the sūtra itself.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu gang gis mdo'i sde nas gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag gis so so la dmigs shing gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gang gis mdo'i sde nas gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag gis so so la dmigs shing gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Son of noble family, that which is the mental attention that observes each of the scriptures, from the scriptural divisions of the sutras up to the scriptural divisions of the clear science, and combines them into one,🔽that is to be known as the serenity and insight that observe the small mixed object.

original: 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This is the second, the reply that the Tathagata actually gives.

original: 'di yang 'dres pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa gsum pa bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang 'dres pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa gsum pa bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three types by the very teaching of the three types of mixed objects.

original: 'di ni dang po chung du'i chos la dmigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po chung du'i chos la dmigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the first explanation of the small mixed object.

original: 'di ltar gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag la so sor tha dad par dmigs par byed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag la so sor tha dad par dmigs par byed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the mental attention that observes each of the twelve branches of scripture separately,

original: mdo'i sde mang po rnams gcig tu sdud pa nas gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde mang po'i bar dag gcig tu sdud par byed pas de'i phyir 'dres pa chung du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde mang po rnams gcig tu sdud pa nas gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde mang po'i bar dag gcig tu sdud par byed pas de'i phyir 'dres pa chung du zhes bya'o //
translated: From the collection of many sutras up to the collection of many texts that are established as the canon, they are combined into one. Therefore, it is called the lesser combination.

original: gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos ji snyed yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i bar dag la dmigs shing gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed kyi so so la dmigs par byed pa @130a * //
analyzed: gang gis mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos ji snyed yongs su bzung ba dang / bsams pa'i bar dag la dmigs shing gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed kyi so so la dmigs par byed pa @130a * //
translated: That which takes as its object the Dharma such as sutras, up to the extent that they are retained and contemplated, combines them into one and attends to them, but does not take them as separate objects.

original: ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: That is the calm abiding and insight that take as their object the combined and extensive Dharma. This is the explanation of the second, the combined and extensive object.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This verse of the sutra is also divided into three parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: explanation, classification, and conclusion.

original: rnam par bshad pa las gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa las gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Vyakhyayukti says, “By what?

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bstan pa dag la yongs su tshang bar gang gis dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bstan pa dag la yongs su tshang bar gang gis dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the observation of the complete teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: yongs su bzung ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa'i tshad bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa'i tshad bstan pa ste /
translated: By the words “grasping” and so on, the measure of observation is taught.

original: de ni 'di skad du 'dres pa chen por gyur pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi spyi la dmigs shing de dag gi tshad nas ji tsam du khong du chud par gyur pa yongs su bzung ba dang
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'dres pa chen por gyur pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi spyi la dmigs shing de dag gi tshad nas ji tsam du khong du chud par gyur pa yongs su bzung ba dang
translated: This is what is said: “The observation of the great mixture is the observation of the general teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures. The measure of that is the extent to which one comprehends the teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: bsams pa'i gnas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bstan pa'i bar dag gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed pa ni 'dres pa chen po zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsams pa'i gnas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bstan pa'i bar dag gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed pa ni 'dres pa chen po zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Grasping and reflecting are the mental attentions that include the teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures as one. This is called the great mixture.”

original: so so la dmigs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa chung du las rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: so so la dmigs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa chung du las rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: “Not observing each” distinguishes the small mixture.

original: 'dres pa chung du ltar te re re'i so so la dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dres pa chung du ltar te re re'i so so la dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not that each of them individually is the object.🔽The immeasurable object of the immeasurables is the object of the immeasurables of the bodhisattvas.

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa rnams dang / gong nas gong du shes rab kyis brtags shing khong du chud pa la dmigs shing gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed kyi yongs su bzung ba dang bsams pa'i bar dag la dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa'i tshad med pa'i
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa rnams dang / gong nas gong du shes rab kyis brtags shing khong du chud pa la dmigs shing gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed kyi yongs su bzung ba dang bsams pa'i bar dag la dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa'i tshad med pa'i
translated: The immeasurable Dharma of the Tathagata, the immeasurable words and letters of the Dharma, and the ever increasing investigation and comprehension by wisdom, all of which are focused on and combined into one, but not focused on and combined with the objects of retention and contemplation.

original: chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa 'dres pa tshad med pa la dmigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa 'dres pa tshad med pa la dmigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This should be known as the shamatha and vipashyana that focus on the immeasurable Dharma. This explains the third, the immeasurable object of the immeasurables.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du phye nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du phye nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: This sutra passage should be explained by dividing it into three parts.

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The explanation, the divisions, and the summary.

original: rnam par bshad pa las gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa'i tshad med pa la sogs pa la dmigs zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa las gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa'i tshad med pa la sogs pa la dmigs zhes bya bas ni /
translated: In the explanation, it is said that the immeasurable teachings of the Tathagata are observed.

original: tshad med pa rnam pa gsum la dmigs par bstan te /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnam pa gsum la dmigs par bstan te /
translated: This shows the observation of three types of immeasurables.

original: gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig tu bzlums nas yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mental contemplation that combines them is called the immeasurable combination.

original: de la tshad med pa rnam pa gsum @130b yang dang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa tshad med pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshad med pa rnam pa gsum @130b yang dang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa tshad med pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Among them, the first is the observation of the immeasurable teachings of the Tathagata.

original: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod do /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod do /
translated: Here too, there are three explanations.

original: kha cig ni chos bstan pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sgra skad tshad med pas chos tshad med pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chos bstan pa tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni chos bstan pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sgra skad tshad med pas chos tshad med pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chos bstan pa tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: The so-called immeasurable teachings are called immeasurable teachings because they teach immeasurable dharmas with immeasurable sounds and languages.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya bas ni gsung ba po rab tu bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya bas ni gsung ba po rab tu bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: The phrase the Tathagata indicates the speaker.

original: kha cig na re tshad med pas zhes bya bas ni gsung ba po phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pas mang po rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re tshad med pas zhes bya bas ni gsung ba po phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pas mang po rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say that the word immeasurable indicates the speaker, because the Tathagatas of the ten directions and three times are many.

original: kha cig na re tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su gtogs pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the word immeasurable is included in two categories:

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang bstan pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang bstan pa'o zhe'o //
translated: thus, Buddha and teaching.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi tshig la sogs pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni sgra la brten nas ming dang tshig dang yi ge 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi tshig la sogs pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni sgra la brten nas ming dang tshig dang yi ge 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The second is the phrase immeasurable Dharma words, etc., which refers to the arising of names, words, and letters based on sound.

original: gsum pa gong nas gong du shes rab kyis brtags shing khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par byed pa'i shes pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa gong nas gong du shes rab kyis brtags shing khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par byed pa'i shes pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The third is the phrase investigated and penetrated by wisdom, which refers to the consciousness that takes as its object.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i bstan pas rab tu phye ba'i shes pa ni gcig kho na ma yin pas de'i phyir gong nas gong du zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i bstan pas rab tu phye ba'i shes pa ni gcig kho na ma yin pas de'i phyir gong nas gong du zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te //
translated: The consciousness of the bodhisattva is not distinguished by the teaching of the object, and therefore it is said, “in ever higher stages.”

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las gong ma gong ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las gong ma gong ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, it says, “in ever higher stages.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni gcig gis gcig rnam par bshad pa'i phyir gong nas gong du zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni gcig gis gcig rnam par bshad pa'i phyir gong nas gong du zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: In the treatise Establishing Knowledge as Mere Consciousness, it says, “in ever higher stages,” because one explains the other.

original: ci'i phyir tshad med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di gcig tu bzlums pa la sogs par gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshad med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di gcig tu bzlums pa la sogs par gsungs she na /
translated: Why are these three immeasurables taught as one, and so on?

original: 'dis ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul chos bstan pa la don rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul chos bstan pa la don rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches that the object of observation has three topics.

original: dang pos ni ston par byed pa'i gang zag smos pas /
analyzed: dang pos ni ston par byed pa'i gang zag smos pas /
translated: The first mentions the person who teaches

original: bstan pa las mngon par zhen par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: bstan pa las mngon par zhen par byed pa bstan to //

original: gnyis pas ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge bstan pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge bstan pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa bstan to //

original: gsum pas ni dmigs par byed pa shes pa la brten nas dmigs par bya ba'i yul bstan pa la mngon par zhen pa bstan te /
analyzed: gsum pas ni dmigs par byed pa shes pa la brten nas dmigs par bya ba'i yul bstan pa la mngon par zhen pa bstan te /

original: chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo //

original: shes pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni don dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid de don khong du chud nas thabs mkhas pa bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: smras pa / 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /

analyzed: kha cig na re 'dres pa gsum po 'di dag gis ni bstan pa kho na yid la byed de /

translated: As previously explained, they focus on the sūtra collection and so on and bring them to mind by combining them into one, thus they possess the three powers of inclination and so on and they express all virtuous Dharmas.

original: kha cig na re 'dres pa gsum po 'di dag ni de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig yid la byed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dres pa gsum po 'di dag ni de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig yid la byed de /
translated: Some say: These three combined bring suchness alone to mind.

original: phyis 'og nas bstan pa'i rkyen rnam pa lnga las 'byung ba bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor las brtsams nas gnas ngan len la sogs pa thams cad 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: phyis 'og nas bstan pa'i rkyen rnam pa lnga las 'byung ba bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor las brtsams nas gnas ngan len la sogs pa thams cad 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Subsequently, as explained below, they destroy all negative tendencies and so on, since they arise from the five conditions that commence with the yoga of suchness.

original: kha cig na re don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas bstan pa la dmigs pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs par bshad kyang don du 'gal ba med do zhe'o /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu pa /
analyzed: kha cig na re don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas bstan pa la dmigs pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs par bshad kyang don du 'gal ba med do zhe'o / // / bam po bzhi bcu pa /
translated: Some say: Although it is explained that it focuses on the two kinds of objects and on suchness, in fact there is no contradiction.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Bhagavan:🔽Bhagavan, to what extent does one obtain śhamatha and vipaśhyanā that focus on mixed phenomena?

translated: This is the second section, called The Door of Teaching the Conditions for Attaining the Focus on Mixed Phenomena.

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa thob pa'i tshad bstan pa'i sgo zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa thob pa'i tshad bstan pa'i sgo zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called The Door of Teaching the Measure of Attaining the Focus on Mixed Phenomena.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te zhu ba gsol ba dang / yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te zhu ba gsol ba dang / yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: This also has two parts: the request and the explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /

analyzed: rkyen du zhig dang ldan na 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What are the conditions for attaining śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on combined phenomena?”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal ba /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bshad pa ston to //

analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po de yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po dag gi ming bkod par zad kyi /
translated: The five aspects of meditation are merely listed in the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna and the Compendium of Abhidharma, but

original: rnam par bshad pa ni med pas 'dir ni slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba dang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig dang sbyar na /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa ni med pas 'dir ni slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba dang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig dang sbyar na /
translated: they are not explained. Therefore, here, the master Niḥsvabhāva has applied the explanations from his commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna and his commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna in one place.

original: de la ming bkod nas rnam par bshad pa yang 'byung bas /
analyzed: de la ming bkod nas rnam par bshad pa yang 'byung bas /
translated: Since the explanation is based on the name,

original: de'i phyir 'dir re zhig ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa la sogs pa la brten nas bsgom pa lnga'i mtshan nyid bshad nas de'i 'og tu mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i 'bras bu lnga'i bye brag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir re zhig ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa la sogs pa la brten nas bsgom pa lnga'i mtshan nyid bshad nas de'i 'og tu mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i 'bras bu lnga'i bye brag bstan par bya'o //
translated: therefore, relying on the commentary on the lack of entityness and so on, I will explain the characteristics of the five meditations and then I will teach the distinctions of the five results set forth in this sutra.

original: de la bsgom pa rnam pa lnga ni /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa rnam pa lnga ni /
translated: The five types of meditation are as follows.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang sa la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa na rnam pa lngas bsgom ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang sa la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa na rnam pa lngas bsgom ste /
translated: Thus when bodhisattvas meditate on śamatha and vipaśyanā on the bhūmis, they meditate in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five? They are as follows:

original: 'dres par bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par bsgom pa dang / lhun gyis grub par bsgom pa dang / 'bar bar bsgom pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin par bsgom pas so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dres par bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par bsgom pa dang / lhun gyis grub par bsgom pa dang / 'bar bar bsgom pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin par bsgom pas so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: meditation on the combined, meditation on the signless, meditation on the effortless, meditation on the blazing, and meditation on not grasping satisfaction.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary on this says:

original: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin te rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin te rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Tranquility is concentration, the antidote to distraction.

original: lhag mthong ni phyin ci log gi gnyen po ste shes rab po //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni phyin ci log gi gnyen po ste shes rab po //
translated: Insight is wisdom, the antidote to erroneous inversion.

original: sa nas sar rnam pa de nyid bsgom pa yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas yang nas yang du sgom par byed de /
analyzed: sa nas sar rnam pa de nyid bsgom pa yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas yang nas yang du sgom par byed de /
translated: The repeated cultivation of the same process on the various spiritual levels is also a five-fold process.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga ni 'dres par bsgom pa la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga ni 'dres par bsgom pa la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: The five aspects are: cultivation as a combination, etc.

original: de la 'dres par bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dres par bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Of these, cultivation as a combination is as follows.

original: 'dres pa thams cad phung po gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dres pa thams cad phung po gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: All the combinations are collected together in a single heap and,

original: dogs pa nyid bsal nas sgom par byed pas chos bstan pa'i don rnams kyis 'dres pa phung po gcig tu 'dus shing de bzhin nyid rab @132b tu phye nas dgongs pa nyid sgom pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa nyid bsal nas sgom par byed pas chos bstan pa'i don rnams kyis 'dres pa phung po gcig tu 'dus shing de bzhin nyid rab @132b tu phye nas dgongs pa nyid sgom pa gang yin pa'o //
