translated: having eliminated any doubt, one cultivates them. It is the cultivation of the very intention after having combined all the combinations into a single heap through the meanings of the teachings and after having distinguished suchness.

original: gzhan keng rus la sogs pa'i dngos po'i spyod yul sgom pa na yang thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: gzhan keng rus la sogs pa'i dngos po'i spyod yul sgom pa na yang thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: Even when one cultivates the objective supports such as skeletons, etc., all are combined into one.

original: 'dres par sgom par byed do snyam pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dres par sgom par byed do snyam pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel the thought that one meditates on the unified,🔽he says,

original: mtshan ma med par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: meditation on the absence of attributes.

original: 'dis ni gnyis pa mtshan ma med par bsgom pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis pa mtshan ma med par bsgom pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the second, meditation on the absence of attributes.

original: bsgom pa phyi ma bzhi po dag ni 'dres par bsgom par don gyi bye brag tu gyur pa yod kyang mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba de kho na nyid chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par bsgom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgom pa phyi ma bzhi po dag ni 'dres par bsgom par don gyi bye brag tu gyur pa yod kyang mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba de kho na nyid chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par bsgom pa'i phyir te /
translated: The latter four meditations are different in meaning from meditation on the unified, because they meditate on the undifferentiable dharmadhatu reality free from all attributes.

original: 'dis ni mtshan ma med pa dngos po yongs su bsal ba'i bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan ma med pa dngos po yongs su bsal ba'i bye brag bstan to //
translated: This teaches the difference between the actual absence of attributes and the elimination of attributes.🔽If one thinks that although meditation on the absence of attributes makes the meaning itself free from attributes, it is still associated with exertion, to teach that meditation is not dependent on exertion and is naturally engaged, he says,

original: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa yang don nyid mtshan ma med par byed kyang rtsal ba dang bcas pa yin no snyam na sgom pa de rtsol ba la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis 'jug go zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa yang don nyid mtshan ma med par byed kyang rtsal ba dang bcas pa yin no snyam na sgom pa de rtsol ba la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis 'jug go zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: meditation on spontaneous accomplishment.

original: de'i 'og tu lhun gyis grub par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhun gyis grub par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: After that, it is called “meditation on spontaneous accomplishment” because one engages in it naturally without the need for effort.

original: 'dis ni lhun gyis grub par bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhun gyis grub par bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the meditation on spontaneous accomplishment.

original: bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug par bsgom pa yin yang /
analyzed: bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug par bsgom pa yin yang /
translated: Even though one meditates on engaging in it naturally without the need for effort,🔽one might think that it is of two types, supreme and not supreme.

original: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu bzhi pa 'bar bar sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu bzhi pa 'bar bar sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To dispel that idea, after that, it is called “meditation on blazing.”

original: 'bar ba dang mchog ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: 'bar ba dang mchog ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Blazing and supreme have the same meaning.

original: 'dis ni 'bar bar bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bar bar bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the meditation on blazing.

original: la la 'bar bar bsgom pa thob nas 'di thams cad byas zin nas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes chog par 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: la la 'bar bar bsgom pa thob nas 'di thams cad byas zin nas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes chog par 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: After attaining the meditation on blazing, one might think, “I have done all this, what else is there to do?”

original: tha mar chog par mi 'dzin par bsgom pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha mar chog par mi 'dzin par bsgom pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To dispel that complacency, it is called “meditation on not being complacent in the end.”

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa dang / 'bar bar bsgom pa kho nar zad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa dang / 'bar bar bsgom pa kho nar zad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not just meditation on the signless, the effortless, and the blazing.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu khyad par can thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu khyad par can thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: One should strive to meditate in order to attain the special result of Buddhahood.

original: 'dis ni chog par mi 'dzin par bsgom pa bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni chog par mi 'dzin par bsgom pa bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This shows the meditation of not being satisfied with just a little.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gsung rab tshad ma las yang dag par bstan pa med kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par phye ste bstan na thams cad kyang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dag lhan cig 'jug pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gsung rab tshad ma las yang dag par bstan pa med kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par phye ste bstan na thams cad kyang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dag lhan cig 'jug pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: These five kinds of meditation are not taught in the authentic scriptures as having any specific nature of their own, but if their general characteristics are analyzed and taught, they are all of the nature of concentration, wisdom, and the simultaneous functioning of those two.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni go rims @133a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las ni go rims @133a * //
translated: In the commentary to the Mahayana-samgraha, there is a different explanation of the order of the five meditations.

original: bzhin du shes rab dang / mtshan ma dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / dang pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bzhin du shes rab dang / mtshan ma dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / dang pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
translated: Likewise, it is the essence of wisdom, signlessness, right view, effort, and faith.

original: zhib tu ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in detail as it is taught in that text.

original: theg pa bsdus pa'i 'grel pa hyan tsang gis bsgyur ba dang / de'i 'gab lo la bsgyur ba las ni 'di lta bur rnam par phye ba med do //
analyzed: theg pa bsdus pa'i 'grel pa hyan tsang gis bsgyur ba dang / de'i 'gab lo la bsgyur ba las ni 'di lta bur rnam par phye ba med do //
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna by *Candragomin and the commentary by Kamalaśīla, there is no such analysis.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po de dag gi ming bkod par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med de /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po de dag gi ming bkod par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med de /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma, only the names of those five types of meditation are listed, but there is no explanation.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'di ltar rnam pa lngar bsgoms pas 'bras bu lnga thob par 'gyur te lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'di ltar rnam pa lngar bsgoms pas 'bras bu lnga thob par 'gyur te lnga gang zhe na /
translated: Therefore, in that treatise it says, “By meditating in those five ways, one attains five results. What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba'i sgom pa dang mthun pa'i sgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par sgom pa dang / rtsol ba med par sgom pa dang / mtshan ma bzlog pa'i sgom pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba'i sgom pa dang mthun pa'i sgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par sgom pa dang / rtsol ba med par sgom pa dang / mtshan ma bzlog pa'i sgom pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The sutra says, The cultivation of the signless, the cultivation of the nondiscriminated, the cultivation of the non-apprehensible, the cultivation of the non-existent, the cultivation of the pacification of discrimination, the cultivation of the concordant, the cultivation of the signless, the cultivation of the effortless, and the cultivation of the reversal of discrimination.

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The Abhidharma-samuccaya says,

original: mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba sgom pa zhes 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa las 'bar bar sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba sgom pa zhes 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa las 'bar bar sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The cultivation of the pacification of discrimination is the same as the teaching of the cultivation of the burning of the Compendium of the Great Vehicle.

original: mthun pa'i sgom pa'i zhes 'byung ba ni 'dras par sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //🔽mtshan ma med par sgom pa dang / rtsol ba med par sgom pa zhes 'byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa dang lhun gyis grub par sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i sgom pa'i zhes 'byung ba ni 'dras par sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do // mtshan ma med par sgom pa dang / rtsol ba med par sgom pa zhes 'byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa dang lhun gyis grub par sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The cultivation of the concordant is the same as the teaching of the cultivation of the similar.🔽The cultivation of the signless and the cultivation of the effortless is the same as the teaching of the cultivation of the signless and the spontaneous.

original: mtshan ma bzlog pa'i sgom pa zhes 'byung ba ni chog par mi 'dzin par sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma bzlog pa'i sgom pa zhes 'byung ba ni chog par mi 'dzin par sgom pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The cultivation of the reversal of discrimination is the same as the teaching of the cultivation of the insatiable.

original: de ltar bstan bcos gnyis tha dad par gyur pa yang /🔽slob dpon rtogs pa'i seng ges rigs pa logs shig tu rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos gnyis tha dad par gyur pa yang / slob dpon rtogs pa'i seng ges rigs pa logs shig tu rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Thus, these two treatises are distinct.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga'i go rims de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga'i go rims de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Master Ārya Siṃha posits the five aspects of meditative concentration separately and posits the sequence of the five aspects of meditation in that way.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pas dang po kho nar rnal 'byor la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pas dang po kho nar rnal 'byor la 'jug pa na /
translated: Thus, when a yogin first enters yoga,

original: mtshan ma nye bar zhi bar byed cing 'bar bar byed pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma nye bar zhi bar byed cing 'bar bar byed pas /
translated: he pacifies signs and blazes.

original: de'i phyir 'bar bar byed pa dang por smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bar bar byed pa dang por smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, blazing is mentioned first.

original: 'bras bu lnga zhes bya ba yang mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu lnga zhes bya ba yang mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The five results are also mentioned in this sūtra itself.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon thogs med kyis bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa mdzad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon thogs med kyis bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa mdzad pa las /
translated: Therefore, Master Asaṅga, in composing the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna,

original: mdo'i tshig 'di rdzogs par smos kyi rnam par bshad pa ni ma mdzad do //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di rdzogs par smos kyi rnam par bshad pa ni ma mdzad do //
translated: quotes this sūtra passage in full but does not explain it.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis ni so so nas rnam par bshad pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis ni so so nas rnam par bshad pa mdzad nas /
translated: Masters Vasubandhu and Niḥsvabhāva each composed explanations.

original: don rnam pa lnga rnam par bshad @133b pas de'i phyir bstan bcos gnyis la brten nas mdo'i tshig yang dag par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga rnam par bshad @133b pas de'i phyir bstan bcos gnyis la brten nas mdo'i tshig yang dag par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Since the meaning is explained in five parts, therefore, based on the two treatises, the words of the sutra should be explained correctly.

original: yid la byed pa'i tshe skad cig skad cig la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa rkyen rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i tshe skad cig skad cig la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa rkyen rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: When attending to the mind, it is said, it destroys all the bases of negative tendencies moment by moment, and so on. This is the second, the explanation of the conditions by distinguishing them.

original: 'di yang rkyen rnam pa lnga bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rkyen rnam pa lnga bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
translated: This is also classified into five parts by the very teaching of the five conditions.

original: 'di ni dang po gnas ngan len 'jig par byed pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po gnas ngan len 'jig par byed pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the teaching of the result that destroys negative tendencies.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni skad cig skad cig la nyon mongs pa'i lus kyi rten thams cad 'og par byed pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni skad cig skad cig la nyon mongs pa'i lus kyi rten thams cad 'og par byed pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought, it says, “it destroys all the bases of the body of afflictions moment by moment.”

original: slob dpon thogs med ni mdo 'di nyid la brten nas bstan bcos mdzad do //
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med ni mdo 'di nyid la brten nas bstan bcos mdzad do //
translated: Master Asaṅga composed a treatise based on just this sutra.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len zhes gsungs te /
translated: The seeds of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience that have been infused since beginningless time are called “negative tendencies.🔽”

original: sgrib pa'i phung po 'di gnyis kyang 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes pa'i stobs kyis skad cig re re la 'jig par byed de /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i phung po 'di gnyis kyang 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes pa'i stobs kyis skad cig re re la 'jig par byed de /
translated: These two heaps of obstructions are destroyed moment by moment through the power of the knowledge of serenity and insight that focuses on mixed phenomena.

original: 'dir don du sgrib pa'i phung po 'jig par byed pa bzung ba'i phyir yang 'jig par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir don du sgrib pa'i phung po 'jig par byed pa bzung ba'i phyir yang 'jig par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, since the heaps of obstructions are destroyed in reality, it is also called “destroyer.🔽”

original: nyon mongs pa shin tu nyams smad par byed pa'i phyir yang 'jig par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shin tu nyams smad par byed pa'i phyir yang 'jig par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is also called “destroyer” because it greatly weakens the afflictions.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Ācārya Svābhāvika’s Commentary says:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rten zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rten zhes bya ste /
translated: The foundation consciousness is called the “basis of negative tendencies.”

original: de'i tshe tshogs nyams shing 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'jig par byed pa'o zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshogs nyams shing 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'jig par byed pa'o zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: At that time, it is called “destructive” because it destroys and annihilates the collections.

original: 'dir bstan bcos gnyis kyi dgongs pa bye brag bstan na /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos gnyis kyi dgongs pa bye brag bstan na /
translated: If the intention of the two treatises is distinguished here,

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen ni sa bon la gnas ngan len zhes bstan te /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen ni sa bon la gnas ngan len zhes bstan te /
translated: the master Vasubandhu explains that the seeds are called “negative reflex actions”

original: las su rung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las su rung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not pliable.

original: gnas zhes kyang bstan te /
analyzed: gnas zhes kyang bstan te /
translated: He also explains that they are called “bases”

original: gnas su snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽sa bon gtan du spang bas 'jig par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas su snang ba'i phyir ro // sa bon gtan du spang bas 'jig par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because they appear as bases.🔽They are called “destructive” because the seeds are completely abandoned.

original: mngon du snang ba'i sa bon rnam par gnon pas shin tu nyams smad par byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mngon du snang ba'i sa bon rnam par gnon pas shin tu nyams smad par byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: They are called “extremely diminished” because the seeds that appear are suppressed.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med ni snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la rten du bstan to //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med ni snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la rten du bstan to //
translated: The master *Svabhāvatrāta explains that the seeds are the support of the consciousness that appears.

original: sa bon dang snang ba gcig tu bsdus pa la ni tshogs zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sa bon dang snang ba gcig tu bsdus pa la ni tshogs zhes bstan to //
translated: The seeds and appearances are combined into one and are called “collections.”

original: tshogs pa'i nang na sa bon kho na nyams par byed kyi snang ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir nyams shing 'jig @134a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i nang na sa bon kho na nyams par byed kyi snang ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir nyams shing 'jig @134a * //
translated: For, in the assembly, only the seed is damaged, not the appearance.🔽

original: par byed pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: par byed pa zhes bstan to //
translated: In the assembly, only the seed is damaged, not the appearance. Therefore, it is taught as “damaged and destroyed.🔽”

original: yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyi dgongs pa yang /
analyzed: yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyi dgongs pa yang /
translated: Moreover, the intention of Master Niḥsvabhāva is also

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang mthun par bshad na don du 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang mthun par bshad na don du 'gal ba med do //
translated: explained in accordance with Master Vasubandhu, so there is no contradiction in meaning.

original: bstan bcos theg ngan po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de'i 'gab lo la bsgyur ba las ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bshad pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg ngan po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de'i 'gab lo la bsgyur ba las ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bshad pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle translated by Lva, it appears in accordance with the explanation of Master Vasubandhu.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle translated by Devacandra, afflictive obscuration and knowledge obscuration are called negative tendencies.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon yod pa thams cad kyis ni 'di gnyis kyi rten gyi chos byed do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon yod pa thams cad kyis ni 'di gnyis kyi rten gyi chos byed do //
translated: All that exists as seeds fully permeating the fundamental consciousness on the side of affliction make this the basis of those two.

original: skad cig ma dang pos ni de ma thag pa'i lam byed la /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang pos ni de ma thag pa'i lam byed la /
translated: The first moment acts as the uninterrupted path.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pas ni rnam par grol ba'i lam byed pas skad cig ma dang pos ni mngon du snang ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed la skad cig ma gnyis pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye bar byed do zhes 'byung
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pas ni rnam par grol ba'i lam byed pas skad cig ma dang pos ni mngon du snang ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed la skad cig ma gnyis pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye bar byed do zhes 'byung
translated: The second moment acts as the liberated path. Thus the first moment pacifies manifest afflictions and the second moment prevents the arising of future afflictions.

original: bas / des nas thams cad la yang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong bar mngon no /
analyzed: bas / des nas thams cad la yang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong bar mngon no /
translated: Therefore it is clear that all moments abandon the afflictive obstructions.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te /
translated: Free from the discernment of multiplicity🔽and attaining the joy of the joy of Dharma

original: chos kyi dga' ba'i dga' ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa chos kyi dga' ba thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba'i dga' ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa chos kyi dga' ba thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: is the teaching of the result of attaining the joy of Dharma.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni 'du shes sna tshogs rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni 'du shes sna tshogs rnam par spangs te /
translated: The Sūtra Unraveling the Profound Thought says, “Having abandoned the discernment of multiplicity,

original: chos kyi dga' ba'i dga' ba thob pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba'i dga' ba thob pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: attain the joy of the joy of Dharma.”

original: slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las kyang sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral zhing chos kyi kun dpa' la dga' ba thob pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las kyang sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral zhing chos kyi kun dpa' la dga' ba thob pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Also, in the treatise composed by Master Asaṅga, it says, “Having abandoned the notion of the various natures of phenomena, one attains the joy of the Dharma-realm.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says:

original: rnam grangs gnyis kyis ston to //
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis kyis ston to //
translated: It is taught by two enumerations.

original: rnam grangs dang po las ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid sna tshogs la gnas pas /
analyzed: rnam grangs dang po las ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid sna tshogs la gnas pas /
translated: In the first enumeration, it says, “Because one abides in the various natures of phenomena, such as the sūtra collection,

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yongs su spangs pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yongs su spangs pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba thob pa yin te /
translated: one abandons the notion of the various natures and attains the joy of the Dharma-realm.”

original: de gnas su gyur pa'i phyir kun dga' zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de gnas su gyur pa'i phyir kun dga' zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because that is the basis, it is called “joy.”

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las 'dis ni bstan pa spangs nas de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa thob pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos kyi dga' ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las 'dis ni bstan pa spangs nas de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa thob pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos kyi dga' ba zhes bstan to //
translated: In the commentary on this, it says, “Here, having abandoned the teachings, one attains the single taste of suchness, and from the perspective of that, it is called ‘the joy of the Dharma.’”

original: de la mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid sna tshogs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la gsung rab yan lag bcu @134b gnyis ni /
analyzed: de la mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid sna tshogs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la gsung rab yan lag bcu @134b gnyis ni /
translated: The essence of the Dharma, the sutra collection and so on, is called the various abodes.🔽

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The reality of the Dharma, such as the category of scriptures, is called “diversely based.” The twelve branches of the scriptures are called “the category of scriptures.”

original: bcu gnyis mi mthun pa nyid ni sna tshogs la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis mi mthun pa nyid ni sna tshogs la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The twelve are called “diversely based” because they are not the same.

original: yang na mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos ni rjod par byed pa'i bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos ni rjod par byed pa'i bstan pa'o //
translated: Or else, the Dharma, such as the category of scriptures, is the teaching that expresses.

original: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs la gnas pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs la gnas pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don de /
translated: The reality of the diversely based is the meaning that is expressed.

original: chos dang don sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi 'du shes spangs pas na chos kyi kun dga' ba'i dga' ba thob pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos dang don sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi 'du shes spangs pas na chos kyi kun dga' ba'i dga' ba thob pa zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the attainment of the joy of delight in the Dharma is due to the elimination of the notion that the reality of the diverse Dharma and meaning is diverse.

original: rnam grangs gnyis pa las ni don gzhan du na ji ltar na yongs su bzung ba rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'i chos dag myong ba dang so sor rtog pa rags shing gsal ba ma bskyed par yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis snang ba yid la byed pa'i dbang gis myong zhing /
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis pa las ni don gzhan du na ji ltar na yongs su bzung ba rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'i chos dag myong ba dang so sor rtog pa rags shing gsal ba ma bskyed par yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis snang ba yid la byed pa'i dbang gis myong zhing /
translated: The second type is stated in the Abhidharmasamuccaya:🔽What is subtle investigation?🔽It is the investigation and analysis of other objects that is not generated by the coarse and clear experience and discernment of investigation and analysis.

original: so sor rtog pa shin tu phra mo 'byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa shin tu phra mo 'byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is the experience and discernment that arises from the power of attention that is the appearance of calm abiding and insight.🔽The Autocommentary states:

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las 'di ni bstan pa'i don dag la phra ba nyid du so sor rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las 'di ni bstan pa'i don dag la phra ba nyid du so sor rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: This is taught from the perspective of subtle discernment of the meaning of the teachings.

original: chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba zhes bstan to //
translated: It is the joy of the pleasure of Dharma.

original: 'di ni logs shig nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan pa las /
analyzed: 'di ni logs shig nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan pa las /
translated: This is taught separately from the three types of samādhi that possess investigation and analysis and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa nyid de 'di ltar myong ba dang / so sor rtog pa rags shing gsal ba dang bral nas shin tu phra ba'i snang ba yid la byed pa de dang ldan pa'i myong ba dang so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa'i chos la brten pa'i myong ba dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa nyid de 'di ltar myong ba dang / so sor rtog pa rags shing gsal ba dang bral nas shin tu phra ba'i snang ba yid la byed pa de dang ldan pa'i myong ba dang so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa'i chos la brten pa'i myong ba dang /
translated: Thus, when one is free from coarse, clear experience and discernment, the experience and discernment that possess the mental attention of extremely subtle appearance are called experience and discernment that depend on the doctrine that is taught.

original: so sor rtog pa zhes kyang bya chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa zhes kyang bya chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: They are also called the joy of the joy of the doctrine.

original: gsum pa de ni chos rnams kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ci yang med pa'i myong ba dang so sor rtog pa yin pas de'i phyir chos kyi dga' ba'i dga' ba zhes mi bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gsum pa de ni chos rnams kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ci yang med pa'i myong ba dang so sor rtog pa yin pas de'i phyir chos kyi dga' ba'i dga' ba zhes mi bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The third is the experience and discernment that is the mental attention of any sign of doctrine whatsoever. Therefore, it is not called the joy of the joy of the doctrine.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni bdag dang chos dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni bdag dang chos dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The commentary of Abhidharma without nature says, “Because one is free from the discriminations of signs of self, phenomena, buddhas, and so on.

original: kun dga' ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun dga' ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Joy is as follows.

original: 'dir kun dga' bas kun dga' ste /
analyzed: 'dir kun dga' bas kun dga' ste /
translated: Here, joy is joy.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni kun dga' yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni kun dga' yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the realm of phenomena is a pleasure grove,

original: chos kyi kun dga' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' zhes bya ste /
translated: so it is called the pleasure of the Dharma.

original: 'dir dgar zhing tshim pa yin pa de ni chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dgar zhing tshim pa yin pa de ni chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the joy and satisfaction is called the joy of the pleasure of the Dharma.

original: de nyid thob pa'i phyir chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid thob pa'i phyir chos kyi kun dga'i dga' ba thob pa ste /
translated: In order to attain that, one attains the joy of the pleasure of the Dharma.🔽For example, it is like the excellent pleasure groves or parks outside the palace of a king, where one experiences the superior joy of play.

original: dper na rgyal po'i pho brang gi phyi rol gyi kun dga' ra ba'am skyed mos tshal gya nom pa dag tu der rtse zhing dga' ba khyad par du 'phags pa myong ba ltar chos kyi dbyings su yang @135a * //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i pho brang gi phyi rol gyi kun dga' ra ba'am skyed mos tshal gya nom pa dag tu der rtse zhing dga' ba khyad par du 'phags pa myong ba ltar chos kyi dbyings su yang @135a * //
translated: The realm of phenomena is also like that.

original: de bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /🔽'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bgrod pa'i gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes 'byung ste / 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bgrod pa'i gnas /
translated: The commentary on this says:

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi kun dga' ra bar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dga' ba thob pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi kun dga' ra bar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dga' ba thob pa zhes bshad de /
translated: The abode of the attainment of nonconceptual wisdom is the pleasure grove of the realm of phenomena, where one attains the joy concomitant with nonconceptual wisdom.

original: phal cher slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bshad pa'i rnam grangs dang po dang mthun no //
analyzed: phal cher slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bshad pa'i rnam grangs dang po dang mthun no //
translated: The first of the three explanations of Vasubandhu is the most likely.

original: de la bye brag yod pa yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i 'du shes kho na las so //
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i 'du shes kho na las so //
translated: Vasubandhu says that the first is due to the perception of the collections of sutras, etc.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med ni dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes tshar bar spang ba las so //🔽de la bdag dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med ni dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes tshar bar spang ba las so // de la bdag dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Asvabhava says that it is due to the complete abandonment of the perception of the signs of the Three Jewels.

original: sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun gyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun gyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: The first is called “free from self” because it is free from the signs of the Buddha and the Sangha.

original: chos dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni chos dkon mchog gi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni chos dkon mchog gi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: The second is called “free from Dharma” because it is free from the signs of the Jewel of Dharma.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de'i 'gab pa lo la bsgyur ba las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de'i 'gab pa lo la bsgyur ba las kyang /
translated: In the commentary on the Mahayana-samgraha, which was translated by Sarvajnadeva,

original: phal cher hyan tsang gis bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: phal cher hyan tsang gis bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: it is explained in accordance with the teaching of the majority of the translations of the works of Xuanzang.

original: lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni bshad pa phyi ma mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni bshad pa phyi ma mi 'byung ste /
translated: In the translation of the commentary by Jinamitra, the latter explanation does not appear.

original: gzhan ni hyan tsang gis bsgyur ba las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni hyan tsang gis bsgyur ba las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The other is explained in accordance with what appears in the translation by Yānamati.

original: phyogs bcu bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa chos kyi snang ba yang dag par khong du chud pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa chos kyi snang ba yang dag par khong du chud pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the knowledge of the limitless Dharma illumination that is the characteristic of the ten directions without distinction” is the explanation of the result of the third, the complete understanding of the illumination of the Dharma.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: In the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention, it says:

original: phyogs bcu'i mtha' tshad med pa shes pa dang / chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang dag par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i mtha' tshad med pa shes pa dang / chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang dag par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: “The knowledge of the limitless ends of the ten directions and the knowledge of the limitless Dharma illumination arise.”

original: slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las ni /
translated: In the treatise composed by the master Asaṅga,

original: chos kyi snang ba chen po thams cad du tshad med cing rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par shes pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba chen po thams cad du tshad med cing rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par shes pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it says: “The knowledge of the limitless and uncategorized characteristic of the great illumination of the Dharma.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni phyogs bcu mtha' med pa rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par shes pa dag ni /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni phyogs bcu mtha' med pa rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par shes pa dag ni /
translated: Those who correctly know the ten directions to be infinite and not characterized by a limit

original: dper na yi ge'i snang ba legs par kha ton du 'don pa lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: dper na yi ge'i snang ba legs par kha ton du 'don pa lta bu yin pas /
translated: are like those who recite the appearance of letters well,

original: chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: so it is called the appearance of phenomena.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni /
translated: Master Niḥsvabhāva’s commentary states:

original: phyogs bcu 'di tsam zhes mtha' med cing /
analyzed: phyogs bcu 'di tsam zhes mtha' med cing /
translated: Since the ten directions are infinite and not characterized by a limit,

original: rnam pa yongs su ma chad par gsal bar @135b 'jug pa'i phyir chos kyi snang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa yongs su ma chad par gsal bar @135b 'jug pa'i phyir chos kyi snang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: they are clearly engaged without a limit of aspects, so it is called the appearance of phenomena.

original: dper na / yi ge'i snang ba legs par kha ton du 'don pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: dper na / yi ge'i snang ba legs par kha ton du 'don pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: For example, it is like reciting the appearance of letters well.

original: 'grel pa gnyis las chos kyi snang ba bstan pa de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'grel pa gnyis las chos kyi snang ba bstan pa de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of the teaching on the appearance of phenomena in those two commentaries.

original: kha cig na re mdo'i sde kha ton du byed pas chos kyi snang ba 'di thos nas sems la snang ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo'i sde kha ton du byed pas chos kyi snang ba 'di thos nas sems la snang ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: This light of the Dharma is heard and appears in the mind through reciting the class of sutras.

original: kha cig na re ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs mi brjod par dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyis gsal bar dran pa'i phyir chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs mi brjod par dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyis gsal bar dran pa'i phyir chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: It is called the light of the Dharma because it clearly recalls the collection of names, phrases, and letters without expressing them through the mind that focuses on them.

original: gzhan yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are two other explanations:

original: kha cig na re phyis thos pas shes par bya ba rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhe'o /
analyzed: kha cig na re phyis thos pas shes par bya ba rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhe'o /
translated: Some say: That which appears in the form of a sign to be known through later hearing is called the light of the Dharma.

original: kha cig na re mtshan rtogs pa'i lta ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re mtshan rtogs pa'i lta ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: That which is the view that realizes the characteristics is called the light of the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis las ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis las ni /
translated: From the treatise that summarizes the Mahāyāna,

original: gsal bar mthong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gsal bar mthong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: it is explained that any cognition that clearly sees is called the light of the Dharma.

original: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma rgyun mi 'chad pa mngon sum du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa rgyu dang / ye shes mngon du snang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma rgyun mi 'chad pa mngon sum du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa rgyu dang / ye shes mngon du snang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: The fourth cause is called the manifestation of the sign of the absence of conceptualization that is associated with the side of purification that is concomitant with the consummate state of mind.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sūtra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: bya ba yongs su grub pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma mngon sum du gyur pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bya ba yongs su grub pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma mngon sum du gyur pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The sign of the absence of conceptualization that is associated with the side of purification that is concomitant with the consummate state of mind manifests.🔽In the treatise composed by the master Asaṅga, it says:

original: slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las ni rnam par dag pa'i cha mthun pa rnam par ma brtags pa'i mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las ni rnam par dag pa'i cha mthun pa rnam par ma brtags pa'i mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The sign of the absence of analysis that is associated with the side of purification that is concomitant with the state of culmination arises.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las 'di lta ste /
translated: In the commentary composed by the master Vasubandhu, it says:

original: dngos po yongs su grub pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: dngos po yongs su grub pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: Phenomena concomitant with the fully present nature are

original: rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pha mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pha mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: called the absence of signs that is the source of purity.

original: 'dir don du na bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa de la dngos po yongs su grub pa zhes bya bar bzung ngo zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir don du na bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa de la dngos po yongs su grub pa zhes bya bar bzung ngo zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In this context, the fully present nature is considered to be the attainment of the result of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen ni slob dpon thogs med kyi dgongs pa yongs su bzung nas rgyu kho na smos kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par phye ba'i phyir mdo las gsungs @136a * //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen ni slob dpon thogs med kyi dgongs pa yongs su bzung nas rgyu kho na smos kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par phye ba'i phyir mdo las gsungs @136a * //
translated: Master Vasubandhu, having fully understood the thought of master Asaṅga, says that only the cause is mentioned in the sūtra and not the result because it is distinguished.

original: pa'i dngos po yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba de 'grel pa'i tshig tu bstan nas bstan bcos de rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i dngos po yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba de 'grel pa'i tshig tu bstan nas bstan bcos de rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: He explains that the fully present nature mentioned in the sūtra is taught in the commentary as the fully present nature.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa dang sbyar na /
translated: If the words of this sūtra are applied to the explanation in the commentary composed by master Vasubandhu,

original: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa nyid ni sangs rgyas su grub pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa nyid ni sangs rgyas su grub pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The fully accomplished transcendent state itself is the result of buddhahood.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa man chad ni rgyu'i ming bstan pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa man chad ni rgyu'i ming bstan pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The associated factors and so on are the presentation of the names of the causes.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Svābhāvikakṣānti explains in his commentary:

original: ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The future attainment of buddhahood

original: rnam par dag pa'i cha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i cha zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the pure aspect.

original: 'dis de 'dren par byed pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa'i mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba dang mthun pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dis de 'dren par byed pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa'i mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba dang mthun pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because this leads to that, it is called the arising of the unanalyzed sign that accords with the unarisen.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis slob dpon thogs med kyis bstan pa'i rnam par dag pa'i cha rnam par bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid ni mdo las gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yongs su grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis slob dpon thogs med kyis bstan pa'i rnam par dag pa'i cha rnam par bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid ni mdo las gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yongs su grub pa nyid do //
translated: The pure aspect taught by Master Asaṅga is the fully accomplished transcendent state taught in the sūtras.

original: mthun pa dang rnam par ma brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu'i ming bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthun pa dang rnam par ma brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu'i ming bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The terms “accordant” and “unanalyzed” and so on are the presentation of the names of the causes.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Svābhāvikabhūmi’s Commentary says:

original: mdo'i tshig 'di rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na /
translated: If these sūtra passages are applied to the explanation,

original: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i ming ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i ming ngo //
translated: “the fully present reality” is a name for the result.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu'i ming ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu'i ming ste /
translated: “The pure side of the associated factors” and so on are names for the causes.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyogs zhes bstan pa ni dngos po yongs su grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyogs zhes bstan pa ni dngos po yongs su grub pa nyid do //
translated: The teaching on “the pure side” is the fully present reality itself.

original: mdo las dgongs pa yongs su grub pa zhes logs shig tu smos pas /
analyzed: mdo las dgongs pa yongs su grub pa zhes logs shig tu smos pas /
translated: Since the sūtra mentions “the fully present reality” separately,

original: de'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i ming zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par dag pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i ming zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught that “the pure side of the associated factors” is a name for the causes.

original: de ltar 'grel pa rnam pa gnyis mi mthun pas /
analyzed: de ltar 'grel pa rnam pa gnyis mi mthun pas /
translated: Since these two commentaries are not in agreement,

original: 'dir mdo'i tshig 'di slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar nas bshad pa yin te brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i tshig 'di slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar nas bshad pa yin te brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: here the sūtra passage is explained in accordance with Master Vasubandhu’s commentary, and if you examine it, you will understand.

original: chos kyi sku thob pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to attain the Dharma body, to perfect it, and to complete it,

original: gong ma bas ches gong ma khyad par du 'phags pa gya nom pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni lnga pa gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma bas ches gong ma khyad par du 'phags pa gya nom pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni lnga pa gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu'i 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: one takes up the cause that is superior to the superior, which is the cause that is most excellent.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa dang / rgyu mchog tu gyur pa dang khyad par du gyur pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa dang / rgyu mchog tu gyur pa dang khyad par du gyur pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says that one attains the perfection of the Dharma body, the supreme cause, and the special and superior.

original: slob @136b dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las ni /
analyzed: slob @136b dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i bstan bcos las ni /
translated: The treatise composed by Master Asaṅga states:

original: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to perfect and to fully accomplish the Dharma body,

original: gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: one takes up the cause that is superior to the superior.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu states:

original: 'di lta ste sa bcu pa'i chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sa bcu pa'i chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmakāya of the tenth stage is called “fully perfected.”

original: bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmakāya of the eleventh stage, the buddha stage, is called “fully accomplished.”

original: rgyu thams cad las gang gis sangs rgyas kyi sa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas de'i phyir gong ma bas ches gong ma khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu yang yang dag par yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes🔽bya ba bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu thams cad las gang gis sangs rgyas kyi sa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas de'i phyir gong ma bas ches gong ma khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu yang yang dag par yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it is the cause that generates the buddha stage, it is supreme and superior. Therefore, it is taught that it is the cause that fully upholds the most superior state above the former stages.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: The commentary by Asvabhāva also states:

original: sa bcu pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The tenth stage is called “fully perfected.”

original: sangs rgyas kyis la mnga' ba gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis la mnga' ba gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The dharmakāya that is possessed on the buddha stage is called “fully accomplished.”

original: 'di thob par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di thob par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas /
translated: Since the cause that obtains this is supreme and special,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu zhes bshad de /🔽rgyu snga ma las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu zhes bshad de / rgyu snga ma las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: it is explained as the cause of special attainment.

original: gong ma bas ches gong ma zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gong ma bas ches gong ma zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Since it arises from the former cause, it is called higher than the higher.

original: kha cig na re sa bcu bzhi yongs su grub pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: kha cig na re sa bcu bzhi yongs su grub pa zhes bya la /
translated: Some say: The fourteenth stage is called perfect and

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya na ni bstan bcos rnams dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya na ni bstan bcos rnams dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: if the buddha stage is called perfect, it would contradict the treatises.🔽The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna and its commentary explain that the four results are conceived in the context of the four results of stream entry and so on, since it says:

original: chos kyi sku thob pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de'i 'gab lo dang / lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las 'bras bu bzhi rnam par rtog par 'byung bas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de'i 'gab lo dang / lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las 'bras bu bzhi rnam par rtog par 'byung bas /
translated: The result of stream entry is the attainment of the Dharma body, the result of once return is the perfect establishment of the Dharma body, the result of nonreturn is the perfect completion of the Dharma body and the result of an arhat is the perfect perfection of the Dharma body.

original: mdo 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: mdo 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur la /
translated: This contradicts this sūtra.

original: gzhan ni hyan tsang gis bsgyur po'i dpe dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ni hyan tsang gis bsgyur po'i dpe dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The other is in accordance with the text translated by Xuanzang.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad zin to //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad zin to //
translated: The words of the sutra have already been explained.

original: bstan bcos rnams las tha dad pa'i bye brag kyang rnam ba bzhi yod pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnams las tha dad pa'i bye brag kyang rnam ba bzhi yod pas /
translated: There are also four types of distinctions different from the treatises.

original: dang po ni ming rnam par bzhag nas 'bras bu dang ma sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: dang po ni ming rnam par bzhag nas 'bras bu dang ma sbyar ba ste /
translated: The first is positing the names without applying them to the results.

original: 'bras bu'i ming logs shig tu rnam par bzhag nas bsgom pa rnam pa lngas logs shig tu 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang ma sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ming logs shig tu rnam par bzhag nas bsgom pa rnam pa lngas logs shig tu 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang ma sbyar ba yin te /
translated: Having separately posited the names of the results, the five aspects of meditation are not separately applied to the five aspects of the results.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ji skad du 'byung ba @137a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ji skad du 'byung ba @137a * //
translated: As it appears in the treatise Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras:

original: phyis 'og nas bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyis 'og nas bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As will be taught later below.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu dang sbyar nas ming rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu dang sbyar nas ming rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The second is positing the names by applying them to the results.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lngas logs shig tu 'bras bu'i ming rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lngas logs shig tu 'bras bu'i ming rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The five aspects of meditation are separately posited as the names of the results.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As explained by Master Nihsvabhava in his commentary.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las de ltar bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po de yang grangs kyi go rims bzhin du 'bras bu rnam pa lnga thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las de ltar bsgom pa rnam pa lnga po de yang grangs kyi go rims bzhin du 'bras bu rnam pa lnga thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that same text says, “The five kinds of results are obtained in accordance with the order of the five aspects of meditation.”

original: gsungs pa / ming yang rnam par gzhag la 'bras bu dang yang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / ming yang rnam par gzhag la 'bras bu dang yang sbyar ba ste /
translated: It is said: “The name is also established and applied to the result.”

original: 'bras bu'i ming yang logs shig tu rnam par gzhag la 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ming yang logs shig tu rnam par gzhag la 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang sbyar ba ste /
translated: The name of the result is also established separately and applied to the five kinds of results.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ji skad du bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ji skad du bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is taught in the commentary to the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, translated by the one called Lang.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi nas mi skye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni 'dres par bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi nas mi skye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni 'dres par bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that same text says, “The result of non-arising, which is the pacification of afflictions, is obtained through meditation on the mixed.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su grub pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med par bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su grub pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma med par bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
translated: “The result of the accomplishment of the Buddha’s qualities is obtained through meditation on the signless.”

original: ye shes gnyis kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni lhun gyis grub bar bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni lhun gyis grub bar bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
translated: The result of the two kinds of intuition is attained by the meditation of spontaneous accomplishment.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni 'bar bar bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni 'bar bar bsgoms pas thob pa'o //
translated: The result of emancipation is attained by the meditation of blazing.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni chog par mi 'dzin par bsgoms pas thob pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni chog par mi 'dzin par bsgoms pas thob pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The result of perfection is attained by the meditation of non-satisfaction.

original: bzhi pa ni ming yang rnam par ma bzhag la 'bras bu dang yang ma sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni ming yang rnam par ma bzhag la 'bras bu dang yang ma sbyar ba ste /
translated: The fourth is neither named nor applied to any result.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa dang / de'i 'gab lo la bsgyur ba las bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa dang / de'i 'gab lo la bsgyur ba las bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the commentary to the Mahayana-samgraha composed by Asvabhava and Vasubandhu and translated into Tibetan, and the commentary to the Abhisamayalamkara composed by Haribhadra and translated into Tibetan.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni rnam pa gnyis su bsngags pa brjod nas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang sbyar ba bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni rnam pa gnyis su bsngags pa brjod nas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang sbyar ba bshad de /
translated: In the treatise entitled the Abhisamayalamkara of the Sutras, the praise is expressed in two ways and is explained as applied to five results.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las yon tan lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las yon tan lnga gang zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “What are the five qualities?

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: In the metrical version of the text, it says:🔽Moment by moment, all traces are purified,🔽the body and mind are very pliable,

original: skad cig re re bag chags kun sbyong dang // lus dang sems kyang shin tu sbyangs pa dang // shin tu gsal dang mtshan ma mthong ba ste //
analyzed: skad cig re re bag chags kun sbyong dang // lus dang sems kyang shin tu sbyangs pa dang // shin tu gsal dang mtshan ma mthong ba ste //
translated: very clear, and the signs are seen.

original: yongs rdzogs rnam par dag pa chos kyi sku //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yongs rdzogs rnam par dag pa chos kyi sku // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The completely perfect, pure dharmakāya

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las yon tan rnam pa lnga ni bag chags kun sbyong ba dang / lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba dang @137b shin tu gsal ba dang mtshan ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las yon tan rnam pa lnga ni bag chags kun sbyong ba dang / lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba dang @137b shin tu gsal ba dang mtshan ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The Commentary on this text says, “The five qualities are the purification of all traces, the pliancy of the body, the pliancy of the mind, clarity, and the seeing of signs.

original: de la bag chags kun sbyong ba ni skad cig re re la bag chags kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bag chags kun sbyong ba ni skad cig re re la bag chags kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purification of all traces is because moment by moment the entire mass of traces is destroyed.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa bsgoms pas lus kun tu khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa bsgoms pas lus kun tu khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pliancy of the body is because the cultivation of pliancy pervades the body.

original: sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the purification of mind.

original: shin tu gsal ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad la shin tu mkhas shin chad dang grangs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad la shin tu mkhas shin chad dang grangs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is very clear, because it is very skilled in all the aspects of emptiness and is free from number.

original: mtshan ma mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba ste /
translated: The seeing of signs is the seeing of signlessness without conceptualization.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyi ma'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyi ma'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the subsequent purification.

original: yongs rdzogs rnam par dag pa chos kyi sku //
analyzed: yongs rdzogs rnam par dag pa chos kyi sku //
translated: The complete purification of the Dharma Body is the perfection of the aspects.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir rtag par rgyu lnga po 'di dag mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir rtag par rgyu lnga po 'di dag mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to perfect and purify the Body of all the aspects, these five causes are always actualized.

original: dus gang gi tshe yongs su rdzogs shing dus gang gi tshe rnam par dag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe yongs su rdzogs shing dus gang gi tshe rnam par dag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: At what time is it perfected? At what time is it purified?

original: smras pa / sa bcu'i tshe ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: smras pa / sa bcu'i tshe ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: It is said: It is perfected at the time of the ten stages.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i tshe ni rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i tshe ni rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of the Buddha stage, it becomes completely pure.

original: 'dir yon tan rnam pa lnga po de dag las snga ma gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin la phyi ma gnyis ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yon tan rnam pa lnga po de dag las snga ma gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin la phyi ma gnyis ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Here, from among those five aspects of excellence, the first three are to be known as the side of calm abiding, and the last two are to be known as the side of profound insight.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni sa bcu'i gnas skabs dang sbyar nas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga bstan na /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni sa bcu'i gnas skabs dang sbyar nas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga bstan na /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, the five aspects of the result are taught in connection with the situation of the ten stages.

original: ci'i phyir mdo sde'i rgyan las sa'i mdun rol ba dang sbyar te bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo sde'i rgyan las sa'i mdun rol ba dang sbyar te bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are they taught in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras in connection with the stages prior to the stages?

original: smras pa / bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan ni las dang po pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sa'i mdun rol pa dang sbyar te bstan to //
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan ni las dang po pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sa'i mdun rol pa dang sbyar te bstan to //
translated: It is said: The treatise Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras is taught in connection with the stages prior to the stages for the sake of beginners.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa ni brag pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir sa bcu dang sbyar te bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa ni brag pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir sa bcu dang sbyar te bstan to //
translated: The Compendium of the Great Vehicle is taught in connection with the ten stages for the sake of those who are free of doubt.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni rnam pa gsum du bsngags pa brjod nas 'bras bu lnga sdud par ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni rnam pa gsum du bsngags pa brjod nas 'bras bu lnga sdud par ston to //
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma praises it in three ways and teaches that it is the collection of five fruits.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that treatise itself says:

original: gzhan yang shin tu rgyas pa'i phyogs la ting nge 'dzin du mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang shin tu rgyas pa'i phyogs la ting nge 'dzin du mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: “Moreover, how should the bodhisattva who is skilled in concentration in the domain of the vaipulya be understood?

original: 'di ltar rgyu rnams lnga'i phyir te //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu rnams lnga'i phyir te //
translated: It is like this: because of five causes.

original: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob @138a * //
analyzed: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob @138a * //
translated: In every instant, it destroys all the bases of the negative tendencies, it is free from the discrimination of multiplicity, it attains the joy of the delight in Dharma, it is the cause of the attainment of the great intuition of the supramundane, and it is the cause of the attainment of the great superknowledges.

original: pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan ma tshang med pa yang dag par shes pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang cha mthun pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma kun du 'byung ba dang / gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan ma tshang med pa yang dag par shes pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang cha mthun pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma kun du 'byung ba dang / gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
translated: and the sign of nonconceptuality is fully understood,🔽the sign of nonconceptuality that is concordant with pure superior states arises,

original: yongs su 'grub par bya ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa yang dgongs pa mi mthun pas de'i phyir de la mdo sde khongs su bzhag nas bstan pa las 'di ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan rnam pa gsum las brtsams
analyzed: yongs su 'grub par bya ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ngo // bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa yang dgongs pa mi mthun pas de'i phyir de la mdo sde khongs su bzhag nas bstan pa las 'di ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan rnam pa gsum las brtsams
translated: and the cause for attaining the fully perfected body of attributes of a buddha that is superior to the previous is fully appropriated.🔽The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma and the Compendium of the Mahāyāna have different intentions, and therefore they are included in the sūtras.

original: nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The five topics are taught in the sūtras in this way, and they are taught in the sūtras based on the three qualities of the praiseworthy bodhisattvas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: zhi gnas kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan dang / lhag mthong gi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan dang / de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan dang / lhag mthong gi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan dang / de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The qualities of praising serenity, the qualities of praising insight, and the qualities of praising both.

original: zhi gnas kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The qualities of praising serenity are twofold:🔽The destruction of all the bases of the negative tendencies moment by moment, because of the uninterrupted pervasion of all states by pliancy, which increases moment by moment.

original: skad cig re re la gong nas gong du shin tu sbyangs pa nyid du gyur pas rgyun chad pa med par gnas kun du khyab pa'i phyir skad cig skad cig la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / bstan pa'i chos thams cad la bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid du mos pas yang dag pa nyid du so sor rtog pas ro gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir phung po dang /
analyzed: skad cig re re la gong nas gong du shin tu sbyangs pa nyid du gyur pas rgyun chad pa med par gnas kun du khyab pa'i phyir skad cig skad cig la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / bstan pa'i chos thams cad la bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid du mos pas yang dag pa nyid du so sor rtog pas ro gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir phung po dang /
translated: The single taste of all the various topics such as the aggregates, elements and sense spheres, because of the nondifferentiation of all the topics of the teachings through conviction in their sameness in reality through correct discernment.

original: khams dang skye mched la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi don rnams kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang bral te /
analyzed: khams dang skye mched la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi don rnams kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang bral te /
translated: The absence of the conception of signs of the various topics such as the aggregates, elements and sense spheres, because of the absence of the conception of the multiplicity of signs of the various topics.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i dga' ba chos kyi dga' ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i dga' ba chos kyi dga' ba thob pa'o //
translated: and the joy of Dharma, which is the joy of the scriptures, etc.

original: lhag mthong gi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The qualities of the praise of insight are also twofold:
