original: chos rnam par 'byed pa la rgyun chad med pa'i phyir dran pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa dang mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos shes rab kyis gsal bar khong du chud pa dang / gnas gyur pa'i mdun rol du gzugs kyi dngos po ji snyed pa de dag la rnam par rtog pa med cing 'bad pa med pa'i mtshan ma mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa la rgyun chad med pa'i phyir dran pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa dang mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos shes rab kyis gsal bar khong du chud pa dang / gnas gyur pa'i mdun rol du gzugs kyi dngos po ji snyed pa de dag la rnam par rtog pa med cing 'bad pa med pa'i mtshan ma mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: the sign of non-discursive thought through mindfulness, because of the uninterrupted analysis of the Dharma, and the sign of the direct realization of the scriptures, etc., through wisdom, and the sign of the direct realization of the things of form, without discursive thought and without effort, prior to the transmutation.

original: lnga pa gcig tu ni de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: lnga pa gcig tu ni de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan te /
translated: The fifth is the quality of the praise of both of them:

original: chos kyi sku ni shes bya'i sgrib pa gtan du spangs pa'i gnas su gyur pas bsdus pas de yang sa bcu pa la ni yongs @138b su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni shes bya'i sgrib pa gtan du spangs pa'i gnas su gyur pas bsdus pas de yang sa bcu pa la ni yongs @138b su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the Dharma Body is included in the state of the eternal abandonment of the obstacle to the knowable, and that is called “perfect” on the tenth stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni yongs su grub pa bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni yongs su grub pa bya ste /
translated: The thoroughly established nature is to be made on the stage of the Tathāgata.

original: chos kyi sku myur du yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su grub par byed pa'i phyir mdo las gsungs pa'i gong ma bas kyang ches gang ma zhes bya ba khungs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku myur du yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su grub par byed pa'i phyir mdo las gsungs pa'i gong ma bas kyang ches gang ma zhes bya ba khungs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because it quickly perfects the Dharma body and makes it thoroughly established, the sutra teaches that it is “far superior to the former” and this is the source.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags yin pas de'i phyir de'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags yin pas de'i phyir de'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a habitual propensity of natural outflow, and therefore it is said to “uphold its cause.”

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ni bsgoms pa rnam pa lngas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga thob par bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ni bsgoms pa rnam pa lngas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga thob par bstan te /
translated: Thus, through these five aspects, it teaches that the five results are obtained through the five aspects of meditation.

original: lnga gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five? They are:

original: mtshan ma nye bar zhi bar bsgom pa dang / mthun pa'i bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par bsgom pa dang / rtsol ba med par bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma bzlog pa'i bsgom pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma nye bar zhi bar bsgom pa dang / mthun pa'i bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par bsgom pa dang / rtsol ba med par bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma bzlog pa'i bsgom pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the meditation on the pacification of signs, the meditation on conformity, the meditation on signlessness, the meditation on effortless, and the meditation on the reversal of signs.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni rnam pa gnyis su bsngags pa brjod na /🔽ci'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni rnam pa gnyis su bsngags pa brjod na / ci'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The Ornament of Mahayana Sutras praises the Buddha in two ways.

original: rnam pa gsum du bsngags pa brjod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du bsngags pa brjod ce na /
translated: Why does the Compendium of Abhidharma praise the Buddha in three ways?

original: smras pa / khungs su bstan pa'i mdo nyid las 'phags pa byams pa dang / slob dpon thogs med kyis rnam par phye ba med kyi /🔽slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / rtogs pa'i seng ges so so nas logs shig tu rigs pa re re bskyed nas /
analyzed: smras pa / khungs su bstan pa'i mdo nyid las 'phags pa byams pa dang / slob dpon thogs med kyis rnam par phye ba med kyi / slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / rtogs pa'i seng ges so so nas logs shig tu rigs pa re re bskyed nas /
translated: The noble Maitreya and Master Asaṅga did not divide the praise into three in the sutra that is the source of the treatise.

original: mdo las gsungs pa'i 'bras bu lnga bshad pa yin pas /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa'i 'bras bu lnga bshad pa yin pas /
translated: However, Master Vasubandhu and Haribhadra each generated a separate reasoning and explained the five results mentioned in the sutra.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction between them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again said to the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang las rtogs shing gang las thob par 'tshal bar bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa rtogs pa dang / thob pa'i sa'i gnas skabs rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang las rtogs shing gang las thob par 'tshal bar bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa rtogs pa dang / thob pa'i sa'i gnas skabs rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on is the third, the explanation of the stage of understanding and attainment, called the door of discernment.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the first, the request.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: It is understood from the sutra itself.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya,

original: rigs kyi bu sa dang po rab tu dga' ba las ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sa dang po rab tu dga' ba las ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, on the first ground, the Joyous, it is called understanding.🔽On the third ground, the Luminous, it is called attainment.

original: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa las ni thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa las ni thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa bstan to //
translated: And so on. This shows the second, the Tathagata's true reply.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: @139a * // zhu ba snga ma'i lan yang dag par gsungs pa dang / las dang po pa la bslab par bskul ba'o //
analyzed: @139a * // zhu ba snga ma'i lan yang dag par gsungs pa dang / las dang po pa la bslab par bskul ba'o //
translated: the correct response to the former question and the exhortation to train in the beginner’s stage.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba snga ma'i lan yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba snga ma'i lan yang dag par gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the correct response to the former question.

original: 'di ltar sa dang po nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang da dung yongs su ma byang bas thob pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang po nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang da dung yongs su ma byang bas thob pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, because the suchness realized by the first ground itself is not yet completely purified, it is not called attainment.

original: yang na sa dang po yan chad kyi sa rnams ni thams cad kyang rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sa dang po yan chad kyi sa rnams ni thams cad kyang rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, all the grounds from the first ground onward are called realization.

original: sa gsum pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sa thob pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la brtan nas lhag mthong bskyed pa dang / yongs su byang ba yang thob pas /
analyzed: sa gsum pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sa thob pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la brtan nas lhag mthong bskyed pa dang / yongs su byang ba yang thob pas /
translated: The third ground is called the ground of the luminous one because the bodhisattva on this ground attains the ground of concentration and, on the basis of concentration, generates insight and attains complete purification.

original: de'i phyir sa gong ma rnams la thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa gong ma rnams la thob pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du yang nas rnams kun la yang don rnam pa gnyis tshang bar yod kyang /

original: mtshan nyid rab tu gsal ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rab tu gsal ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs ba yin no //
translated: It is stated in that way in consideration of the clear elaboration of the characteristics.🔽And in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning:

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang sa dang po ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang sa dang po ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: sa gsum pa ni thob pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' las dang po bas kyang de la rjes su bslab cing yid la bya ste /

original: da dung bsngags par bya ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: da dung bsngags par bya ba ma yin mod kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang le los gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa las dang po la bslab par bskul ba ste /
translated: This is the exhortation to train in the first stage from the second stage.

original: sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems dpa' dag ni rtogs par yang ma gyur thob pa yang ma yin pas da dung bsngags par bya ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems dpa' dag ni rtogs par yang ma gyur thob pa yang ma yin pas da dung bsngags par bya ba ma yin mod kyi /

translated: However, since one must practice it earnestly by training in it and keeping it in mind, it is not to be abandoned through laziness. This is the meaning of the verse.🔽🔽The bodhisattva Maitreya again said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, how is it that among those śamatha and vipaśyanā, there is a samādhi that is analytical and has analysis?”🔽

translated: However, since one must practice them earnestly by training in them and keeping them in mind, one should not abandon them through laziness. This is the meaning.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs @139b pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol pa ste /

analyzed: de la zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs pa ni gong du bstan pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam pa gnyis po de dag kyang rtog pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag gang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa lags na /

analyzed: ji ltar na rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bgyi lags /
translated: How is it that there is samādhi that is with conceptualization and with analysis?

analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar na rtog pa ma mchis pa dang / dpyod pa ma mchis pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bgyi lags zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, how is it that there is samādhi that is without conceptualization and without analysis?”

analyzed: rnam pa gsum char la yang ting nge 'dzin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is said that all three are called samādhi

translated: They are different in that the treatise of the Sarvastivadins explains that they exist as different individual natures, but they are mutually concomitant.🔽The treatise of the Sautrāntikas explains that although they have the same

analyzed: mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa mtshungs kyang cig car 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /

analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na gnyi ga yang sems pa dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Here, if we apply this to the teaching of the Mahayana, both are the essence of thought and wisdom.

analyzed: phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not mutually concomitant,

translated: because grossness and subtlety are different.🔽It is explained in the Yogācārabhūmi-śāstra:

analyzed: rnam pa gcig la rtsing ba dang zhib pa snga phyi tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' @140a * //

analyzed: byams pa la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thus, the Lord said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:🔽The serenity and insight that are the coarse and obvious experiences🔽of the bodhisattva who is a beginner, who is engaged in learning and reflection, and who is investigating the characteristics of the words and🔽meanings of the Dharma, is called “the concentration that is accompanied

translated: by both investigation and analysis.”

analyzed: 'on kyang de'i snang ba'i dran pa phra ma tsam gyi myong ba dang so sor rtog pa dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rtog
translated: However, when there is shamatha and vipashyana that is the experience and discernment of just a subtle mindfulness of those appearances, that is concentration that is without conception but with just analysis.

translated: There is no coarse and clear discernment of the signs of those mixed and unmixed phenomena that were previously taught above, but there is the experience of the recollection of just a subtle mindfulness of the appearance of the Dharma of the scriptures that were previously taught as mixed and unmixed.

analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum la brten nas chos kyi snang ba bstan pa yang yod de /
translated: The illumination of dharma is also taught based on three kinds of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /

analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //

analyzed: de la don gyi skabs 'dir snang ba'i 'du shes ni chos sems shing rnal 'byor yid la byed pa'i bar du gcod pa spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: In this context, the perception of light is the perception of phenomena up to the mental contemplation of the yoga of stopping.

original: chos kyi snang ba dang / don gyi snang ba dang / zhi gnas kyi snang ba dang / lhag mthong gi snang ba dang / snang ba de dag gi dbang du byas pa ni snang ba'i 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba dang / don gyi snang ba dang / zhi gnas kyi snang ba dang / lhag mthong gi snang ba dang / snang ba de dag gi dbang du byas pa ni snang ba'i 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: You should know that the perception of light is the perception of the light of the Dharma, the light of meaning, the light of serenity, and the light of insight, and it is based on those lights.

original: snang ba de dag la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: snang ba de dag la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of those lights.

original: kha cig na re de'i snang ba zhes bya ba ni des yongs su bzung ba'i chos dang cha mtshungs pa'i gzugs brnyan dran zhing gsal bar snang ba ni de'i dran pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de'i snang ba zhes bya ba ni des yongs su bzung ba'i chos dang cha mtshungs pa'i gzugs brnyan dran zhing gsal bar snang ba ni de'i dran pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the so-called light of those is the clear appearance of the recollection of a mental image that is similar to the phenomena that it has apprehended; this is called its recollection.

original: de ni dmigs par byed pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs par byed pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: This is mindfulness that takes as its object.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na snang ba'i dran pa nyid ni snang ba'i dran pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na snang ba'i dran pa nyid ni snang ba'i dran pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When applied to this explanation, the mindfulness of appearance is called the mindfulness of appearance.

original: bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation in terms of the dominant condition.

original: kha cig na re dmigs par byed pa'i dran pas gsal bar khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni de'i snang ba zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re dmigs par byed pa'i dran pas gsal bar khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni de'i snang ba zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the clarity of understanding through mindfulness that takes as its object is called its appearance.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to this explanation,

original: @141a * // 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: @141a * // 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: this is the explanation in terms of the function of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because mindfulness itself is appearance.

original: chos de dag thams cad kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ci yang med pa'i myong ba dang / so sor rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rtog pa dang /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ci yang med pa'i myong ba dang / so sor rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rtog pa dang /
translated: The experience of not attending to any of the characteristics of those phenomena and the serenity and insight that discern them are called concentration that is free from thought and discernment.

original: dpyod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-discursive thought is taught.

original: snga ma'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi gnas skabs kyi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la rang gi ngang nyid du yongs su byang bar gyur nas yid la byed pa ci yang med pa'i myong ba dang / so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi gnas skabs kyi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la rang gi ngang nyid du yongs su byang bar gyur nas yid la byed pa ci yang med pa'i myong ba dang / so sor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When the phenomena which are the objects of those former śamatha and vipaśyanā are completely purified in their own nature, and there is the experience of no mental activity at all, and discernment, that is called the samādhi of non-discursive thought and non-discursive analysis.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na yid la byed pa ci yang med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na yid la byed pa ci yang med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Another explanation is that “no mental activity at all” means

original: sa'i mdun rol du de bzhin du bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor bslabs pas rnam par rtog pa rnams nye bar zhi bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yid la byed pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol du de bzhin du bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor bslabs pas rnam par rtog pa rnams nye bar zhi bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yid la byed pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: as follows. When the yogin who is training in meditation in that way in front of the earth element has pacified discursive thought, that is called “no mental activity.”

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu yongs su tshol ba dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sa la gnas pa'i spyi'i
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu yongs su tshol ba dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sa la gnas pa'i spyi'i
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, śamatha and vipaśyanā that are accompanied by thorough investigation are called “samādhi that is accompanied by investigation and analysis.”

original: dbang du mdzad nas bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa ston to //
analyzed: dbang du mdzad nas bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa ston to //
translated: The passage that begins with this line teaches the specific characteristics from the perspective of the second ground.

original: 'di yang rnam gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three types by the teaching of the three types.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ni sa'i mdun rol ba'i yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sa'i mdun rol ba'i yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the four types of thorough investigation on the ground of Supreme Joy.

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Thus, at the time of preparation,

original: dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas pa dag gis ming dang ngon gyi bye brag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su tshol ba gang yin pa de ni yongs su tshol ba zhes bya bas na /
analyzed: dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas pa dag gis ming dang ngon gyi bye brag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su tshol ba gang yin pa de ni yongs su tshol ba zhes bya bas na /
translated: the thorough investigation of the nature of the specific names and meanings of the roots of virtue of the heat and peak levels is called “thorough investigation.”

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called concentration that is accompanied by both investigation and analysis.🔽The serenity and insight that are accompanied by discernment are called concentration that is without investigation but with analysis.

original: so sor rtog pa dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the second type, concentration that is without investigation but with analysis.

original: 'di ltar bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnam pa gnyis kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas pa dag gis yang dag pa @141b ji lta ba bzhin du ming la sogs pa'i yul bzhi po dag khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni so sor rtog pa zhes bya
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnam pa gnyis kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas pa dag gis yang dag pa @141b ji lta ba bzhin du ming la sogs pa'i yul bzhi po dag khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni so sor rtog pa zhes bya
translated: The discernment that is the thorough understanding of the four objects such as name that is gained by those who abide in the two types of roots of virtue, i.e., the receptivities and the supreme mundane state, is called investigation.

original: ste / de nyid ni rtog pa mad cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ste / de nyid ni rtog pa mad cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called concentration that is without investigation but with analysis.

original: 'di ltar so sor rtog pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor rtog pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: Thus, the discernment of the individual and the extensive discernment of the understanding of reality just as it is,🔽

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, discernment and thorough understanding of the way things really are are to be known in detail from the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only, the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, and the Levels of Yogic Deeds, according to the teachings in the Bodhisattva Levels.🔽The meditative serenity and insight that focus on the combined topics are called “concentration without applied or sustained thought.”

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the third explanation of the characteristics of concentration without applied or sustained thought.

original: 'di ltar sa la gnas pa dag gis 'dres pa'i chos rnams la dmigs shing de bzhin nyid du bsgoms pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la gnas pa dag gis 'dres pa'i chos rnams la dmigs shing de bzhin nyid du bsgoms pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is free from investigation and analysis is called “free from investigation and analysis.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: don gang gi phyir rnam par rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: don gang gi phyir rnam par rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid la 'jug ce na /
translated: “For what purpose does one enter the essence of mere representation?

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Because one knows the supramundane śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on mixed phenomena.”

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi don zhib tu mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi don zhib tu mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the characteristics of this samādhi that has investigation and analysis should be understood in detail according to the explanations in the Compendium of Characteristics.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
translated: What is the sign of serenity?

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
translated: What is the sign of exertion?🔽What is the sign of equanimity?

original: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad bcu gcig pa zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //🔽'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad bcu gcig pa zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter called The Analysis of the Signs of Serenity, Exertion, and Equanimity.

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This chapter is also in two parts: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the first part, the request.

original: de la dang po zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs ba ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms rnam pa gsum po dag gi bye brag gi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dang po zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs ba ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms rnam pa gsum po dag gi bye brag gi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: The thought behind the request is as follows: The Lord has taught the differences in the characteristics of the three kinds of serenity, exertion, and equanimity.

original: de la zhi gnas ni sems bsrungs nas yul la gnas @142a * //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas ni sems bsrungs nas yul la gnas @142a * //
translated: Serenity is the guarding of the mind and the abiding in the object.

original: shing rnam par g-yeng ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shing rnam par g-yeng ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is free from the distraction of trees, it is called calm abiding.

original: lhag mthong ni chos rnams kun du tshol zhing rab tu rnam bar 'byed pas lhag mthong zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni chos rnams kun du tshol zhing rab tu rnam bar 'byed pas lhag mthong zhes kyang bya /
translated: Insight is called insight and thorough differentiation because it thoroughly investigates and differentiates phenomena.

original: rab tu 'dzin ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called thorough apprehension

original: bying ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bying ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from laxity.

original: btang snyoms ni bying ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bying ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs na /
translated: Equanimity is called equanimity because it is free from laxity and excitement.

original: 'dir ni re zhig lhag mthong mi gleng ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni re zhig lhag mthong mi gleng ste /
translated: Here, for the time being, insight is not discussed.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag gi mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag gi mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What are the characteristics of those three?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu gal te sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na /
translated: If the mind is excited or fears excitement,

original: kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba mthun par chos rnams yid la byed ba dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba mthun par chos rnams yid la byed ba dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This and the rest show the second, the Tathagata's correct reply.

original: zhu ba snga ma rnam pa gsum gyi lan gsungs pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: zhu ba snga ma rnam pa gsum gyi lan gsungs pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The reply to the first question is divided into three parts,

original: 'di ni dang po zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhus pa'i lan du gsungs pa nyid do //🔽'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor sgom pa na gal te sems rgod par gyur tam /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhus pa'i lan du gsungs pa nyid do // 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor sgom pa na gal te sems rgod par gyur tam /
translated: and this is the reply to the question about the reason for calm abiding.

original: rgod par 'gyur du dogs pa'i tshe yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rgod par 'gyur du dogs pa'i tshe yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: When a bodhisattva is cultivating yoga, if the mind becomes excited or is in danger of becoming excited, there are two kinds of attention:

original: yongs su skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos la dmigs pa dang / bar chad med pa'i sems la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos la dmigs pa dang / bar chad med pa'i sems la dmigs pa'o //
translated: attention to the object of complete disenchantment and attention to the uninterrupted mind.

original: 'di ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i dbang gis sems zhi zhing dben par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i dbang gis sems zhi zhing dben par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: The pacification and isolation of the mind by the power of these two kinds of attention are called the reason for calm abiding.

original: bar chad med pa'i sems ni sngar bstan pa'i zhi gnas kyi dmigs par bya ba'i spyod yul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems ni sngar bstan pa'i zhi gnas kyi dmigs par bya ba'i spyod yul gang yin pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted mind is the object of observation for calm abiding as previously explained.🔽If the mind is lax or fears laxity, then the attention to the factors of exertion and the attention to the signs of the mind are called the reason for full knowing.

original: gal te sems bying ba'am bying du dogs pa ni mngon par spro bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yid la byed pa dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gal te sems bying ba'am bying du dogs pa ni mngon par spro bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yid la byed pa dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the second explanation of the characteristics of full knowing.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor sgom pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor sgom pa na /
translated: Thus, when bodhisattvas are cultivating yoga,

original: sems bying bar gyur tam bying bar gyur du dogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sems bying bar gyur tam bying bar gyur du dogs pa'i tshe /
translated: if the mind is lax or fears laxity,

original: yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two kinds of attention.

original: mngon par spro bar gyur ba'i chos la dmigs pa dang / sems kyi mtshan @142b ma de la dmigs pa'o //🔽'di ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i dbang gis sems spro zhing rtsol bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par spro bar gyur ba'i chos la dmigs pa dang / sems kyi mtshan @142b ma de la dmigs pa'o // 'di ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i dbang gis sems spro zhing rtsol bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of observation that is the cause of full delight is the object of observation that is the cause of full delight in the Dharma.🔽The object of observation of the mind is the object of observation of the mind that is full delight.🔽In this way, the cause of full delight is the cause of full delight in the Dharma.🔽The cause of full delight in the Dharma is the cause of full delight in the Dharma that is the object of observation.🔽The cause of full delight in the Dharma is the cause of full delight in the Dharma that is the object of observation.

original: de la sems kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i lhag mthong gis dmigs par bya ba'i spyod yul gang yin pa'o //🔽zhi gnas kyi lam la gcig tu nges pa'am /

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /

original: zung du 'jug pa'i lam la yang rung ste /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i lam la yang rung ste /

analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis kyis kun du nyon mongs par gyur pa na /

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gcig tu nges shing so so nas bying ba dang / rgod pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sgrib pa gnyis dang bral bar gyur ba'i phyir yang btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gcig tu nges shing so so nas bying ba dang / rgod pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sgrib pa gnyis dang bral bar gyur ba'i phyir yang btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called equanimity because it is certain as both śamatha and vipaśyanā, and because it is free from the two obscurations that are incompatible with and compatible with laxity and excitation, respectively.

original: 'bad pa med pa dang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'bad pa med pa dang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between being effortless and engaging naturally?

original: smras pa / rnam pa'i mtshan nyid 'dra yang rtsol ba med pa dang por mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de ni 'bad pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa'i mtshan nyid 'dra yang rtsol ba med pa dang por mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de ni 'bad pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said: Although the characteristics of the aspects are similar, that which is first established without effort is called effortless.

original: phyis yongs su goms par gyur ba na rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyis yongs su goms par gyur ba na rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Later, when it becomes thoroughly familiar, it is called engaging naturally because it engages naturally.

original: 'di yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin no //

original: chos gsum po 'di dag gi bdag nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chos gsum po 'di dag gi bdag nyid ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid do //

original: rab tu 'dzin pa ni lhag mthong gi bdag nyid do //

original: btang snyoms ni @143a * //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni @143a * //

analyzed: kha cig na re bcu gcig pa de dag las btang snyoms kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Some say: From those eleven, equanimity is the essence of the faculty of equanimity.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' @144a * //

analyzed: byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
