analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: ming shes pa dang / tshig shes pa dang / yi ge shes pa dang / so so ba shes pa dang / 'dres pa shes pas so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: ming shes pa dang / tshig shes pa dang / yi ge shes pa dang / so so ba shes pa dang / 'dres pa shes pas so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: by knowing the name, by knowing the word, by knowing the letter, by knowing the individual, and by knowing the combined.

original: rnam pa lnga las snga ma gsum ni bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga las snga ma gsum ni bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: The first three of the five aspects are the perfect knowledge of the nature of the teaching.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the words of the sutra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i ngo bo nyid yin par mngon no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i ngo bo nyid yin par mngon no //
translated: it is clear that the teaching of the Tathagata is by nature name, word, and letter.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni 'dres pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i don shes pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni 'dres pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i don shes pa yin no //
translated: The last two are the knowledge of the combined and uncombined meanings.

original: 'dres pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i don shes pa de la yang dag par bshad pa rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: 'dres pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i don shes pa de la yang dag par bshad pa rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are five kinds of perfect explanations of that knowledge of the combined and uncombined meanings.

original: kha cig na re ming shes pa'i phyir ni so so ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ming shes pa'i phyir ni so so ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: It is called knowledge of the individual because of knowing the name.

original: ma 'dres pa'i tshig 'di shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i tshig 'di shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: That which is the knowledge of the uncombined word is called knowledge of the combined.

original: kha cig na re ming la ming mang po yod pas so so ma 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ming la ming mang po yod pas so so ma 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: Since a name has many names, the knowledge of each name without confusion is called the knowledge of the unmixed.

original: so so ba dang 'dres pa gnyi ga gcig tu 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so so ba dang 'dres pa gnyi ga gcig tu 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge that both the individual and the mixed are mixed together is called the knowledge of the mixed.

original: tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi 'dres pa dang / ma 'dres pa yang de bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi 'dres pa dang / ma 'dres pa yang de bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: The mixing and non-mixing of the collection of words and the collection of letters is also like that.

original: kha cig na re ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dang / so so ma 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni so so ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dang / so so ma 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni so so ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: The knowledge of the collection of names, words, and letters individually and without confusion is called the knowledge of the individual.

original: ming dang tshig dang / yi ge gcig tu 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang / yi ge gcig tu 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The knowledge that one name, word, and letter are mixed together is called the knowledge of the mixed.

original: kha cig na re mdo sde la sogs pa mang po so so ma 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni so so ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo sde la sogs pa mang po so so ma 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni so so ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: The knowledge of many sūtras, etc. individually and without confusion is called the knowledge of the individual.

original: gcig tu @144b 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gcig tu @144b 'dres par shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa shes pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: That consciousness which is the knowledge of their unity is called the knowledge of unity.

original: rgya cher snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in detail as before.

original: kha cig na re 'dres pa dang so so ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dres pa dang so so ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say: The knowledge of unity and diversity is as follows.

original: 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i sems shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa dang / so so ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming la sogs pa shes pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i sems shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dres pa dang / so so ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming la sogs pa shes pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: The knowledge of the mind that observes unity and diversity is called the knowledge of unity and diversity, but it is not called the knowledge of names, etc.

original: gal te sems shes pa la bya na /
analyzed: gal te sems shes pa la bya na /
translated: If it is said that it is knowledge of the mind,

original: ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is it called knowledge of individual phenomena?

original: smras pa / bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ji skad du 'chad pa po dang / gang gi ched du bshad par bya ba de yang yi ge shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ji skad du 'chad pa po dang / gang gi ched du bshad par bya ba de yang yi ge shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the explanation in the commentary on the treatise that the one who explains and the one for whom it is explained are also called the knowledge of letters.

original: de'i phyir so so yang dag par rig pa la dmigs pa'i sems la yang chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir so so yang dag par rig pa la dmigs pa'i sems la yang chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind that has the correct discrimination of the teachings for its object is also called the correct discrimination of the teachings.

original: ming gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: ming gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa bstan to //
translated: The third is explained by dividing it into three parts, beginning with the question, “What is name?”

original: 'di yang rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into five parts.

original: re re la zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa yod par sbyar te 'di ming ni zhus pa nyid do //
analyzed: re re la zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa yod par sbyar te 'di ming ni zhus pa nyid do //
translated: Each part is connected with a question and an answer. The question is the same as the name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la yang rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la yang rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: Having established the own-being of all dharmas that are afflicted and purified,🔽it is the conventional designation of the sign of discrimination.

original: 'du shes kyi brdar btags pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi brdar btags pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the correct explanation of the second.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba las gud na med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rjod par byed pa 'du shes kyi brdar btags pa gang yin pa de ni ming zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba las gud na med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rjod par byed pa 'du shes kyi brdar btags pa gang yin pa de ni ming zhes bya ste /
translated: This is what is meant by name.

original: de ni don du na 'di skad du chos thams cad ni don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de ni don du na 'di skad du chos thams cad ni don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas /
translated: In reality, all phenomena have two kinds of objects.

original: dang po ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: dang po ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The first is their intrinsic reality.

original: lha dang mi dang / mig dang / rna ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid rjod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / mig dang / rna ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid rjod pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the intrinsic reality of a god, a human, an eye, an ear, and so on is expressed by a name.

original: de'i ming zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ming zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called a name.

original: ming de yang 'du shes las byung ba'i phyir 'du shes zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ming de yang 'du shes las byung ba'i phyir 'du shes zhes gsungs so //
translated: And because that name arises from discrimination, it is called discrimination.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na /
translated: In reality,

original: chos rnams ni tha snyad dang bral ba yin yang btags pa tsam du brjod pa yin pa'i phyir brdar btags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ni tha snyad dang bral ba yin yang btags pa tsam du brjod pa yin pa'i phyir brdar btags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Although phenomena are free from conventions, they are called “conventional” because they are said to be mere designations.

original: tshig gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa tshig rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: tshig gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa tshig rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The second, the explanation of words, is taught by “What is a word?” and so on.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is also stated in response to a request.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: 'di lta @145a * //
analyzed: 'di lta @145a * //
translated: It is as follows:🔽The collection of those very names is the basis for the conventional designation of the meaning of defilement and purification and is the establishment of the apprehender.

original: ste / ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i gnas dang / 'dzin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ste / ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i gnas dang / 'dzin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second correct response.

original: 'di ltar ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs pa las logs shig tu btags pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bye brag gi don brjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs pa las logs shig tu btags pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bye brag gi don brjod par byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, apart from the collection of those very names, the meaning of the distinctions of defilement and purification is expressed by the imputed phenomena.

original: tshig gi chos 'dis brjod par bya ba'i gnas byed pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi chos 'dis brjod par bya ba'i gnas byed pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called basis because it serves as the basis for the expression of the Dharma in words.

original: brjod par bya ba sdud cing mi stong pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba sdud cing mi stong pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called holder because it holds the object of expression and makes it not lost.

original: yang na gnas zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na gnas zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Or, basis means this.

original: tshig don la brten nas de rab tu ston pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig don la brten nas de rab tu ston pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called basis because it reveals the meaning of the words in dependence on them.

original: yi ge gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa yi ge'i rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: yi ge gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa yi ge'i rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The third, the explanation of letters, is taught by What is a letter? and so on.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is also stated in response to a request.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the request.🔽It is said, It is the letter that is the basis of both of them.

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yig 'bru gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yig 'bru gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second correct response.

original: 'di ltar yi ge de rjod par byed mi nus kyang de dag gi gnas byed do /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge de rjod par byed mi nus kyang de dag gi gnas byed do /
translated: Although that letter cannot express them, it serves as their basis.

original: gal te yi ge dang bral na gnyi ga mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yi ge dang bral na gnyi ga mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were devoid of letters, it would not manifest as either.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag la bye brag yod pa yang /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag la bye brag yod pa yang /
translated: The three types of names have specific differences.

original: rgya gar skad du n'a ma zhes ba sgyur na ming zhes zer bar rjes su phyogs pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du n'a ma zhes ba sgyur na ming zhes zer bar rjes su phyogs pa'i don yin te /
translated: In Sanskrit, the term nāma is translated as “name” and is used in the sense of something that follows.

original: brjod par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows the object of expression.

original: ming de yang bstan bcos rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: ming de yang bstan bcos rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: In the treatises, the explanations of the term name are not consistent.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The Great Exegesis explains it in terms of three objects:🔽Name is so called because it follows,

original: rjes su 'brang ba dang / 'bod pa dang / 'byor pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba dang / 'bod pa dang / 'byor pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: it calls, and it is endowed.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las ci'i phyir ming zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las ci'i phyir ming zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called name?

original: smras pa / ming zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang ba zhes kyang bya'o //🔽'bod pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ming zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang ba zhes kyang bya'o // 'bod pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is called name because it follows,

original: 'byor pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: it calls, and it is endowed.

original: de la rjes su 'brang ba ni ji ltar byas pa bzhin du 'gro zhing mthun par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'brang ba ni ji ltar byas pa bzhin du 'gro zhing mthun par gyur pa'o //
translated: Following is to go along with the way things are done and to be in agreement.

original: 'bod pa ni don de rnam par bzhag nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bod pa ni don de rnam par bzhag nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: Calling is to answer as one wishes after having established the meaning.

original: 'byor pa ni tshi ge le'ur byas pa dang / rnam par bshad pa byas pa'i rjes su don 'byor par 'gyur ba'o zhes bshad de //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni tshi ge le'ur byas pa dang / rnam par bshad pa byas pa'i rjes su don 'byor par 'gyur ba'o zhes bshad de //
translated: Possession is to possess the meaning after having made the composition and the explanation.

original: bstan bcos phung po lnga pa'i rab tu byed pa @145b las ni 'du byed rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos phung po lnga pa'i rab tu byed pa @145b las ni 'du byed rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Prakaraṇa of the Abhidharmakośa says, The nature of the formations heap is the designation of the entities of the mind and mental factors.

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya also teaches this.

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya states:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The designation of the entity is as follows:

original: lha dang mi dang / mig dang / rna ba zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / mig dang / rna ba zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: It is the entity that is expressed by such terms as god, human, eye, ear, and so on.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par bshad pa la bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par bshad pa la bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: ming zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na sna tshogs su thun mong du legs par shes par byed pa'i phyir mi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na sna tshogs su thun mong du legs par shes par byed pa'i phyir mi zhes bya'o //
translated: What is a name? It is called a name because it is a means of understanding a variety of things in a general way.

original: yang dag gis ming du 'bod pa'i phyir yang ming zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag gis ming du 'bod pa'i phyir yang ming zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is also called a name because it is what is called a name by those who are correct.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise Unraveling the Intent also explains this in accordance with that.

original: rgya gar skad du pa da zhes bsgyur na rjes la bya ste dper na glang po che'i rjes ma thod pa las glang po che yin par shes pa ltar /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du pa da zhes bsgyur na rjes la bya ste dper na glang po che'i rjes ma thod pa las glang po che yin par shes pa ltar /
translated: If you translate the Indian word pada, it means “that which comes after,” as in the case of an elephant’s footprint, from which you know that an elephant is present.

original: de bzhin du tshig bzhi yod pa las tshigs su bcad par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig bzhi yod pa las tshigs su bcad par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, it is taught that a verse is made up of four lines.

original: don gyi rjes su bsgyur na ni tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi rjes su bsgyur na ni tshig ces bya'o //
translated: If you translate it as “that which follows after meaning,” it is called a word.

original: tshig ces bya ba ni rnam par bshad pa yang bstan bcos rnams las mi mthun pas /
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni rnam par bshad pa yang bstan bcos rnams las mi mthun pas /
translated: The term “word” is also explained in the treatises, but the explanations are not consistent.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni /
translated: The Great Exegesis states:

original: don yongs su rdzogs par ston pas na tshig ces bya'o zhes bshad do //🔽bstan bcos phung po lnga po'i rab tu byed pa las ni tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don yongs su rdzogs par ston pas na tshig ces bya'o zhes bshad do // bstan bcos phung po lnga po'i rab tu byed pa las ni tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: Because it teaches the meaning completely, it is called a word.🔽The treatise Exposition of the Five Aggregates states:

original: chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: What is a collection of words? It is the essence of a term that specifies phenomena.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //🔽chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang de skad du bstan to // chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The treatise Compendium of Higher Knowledge also explains it in the same way.🔽The Compendium of Higher Knowledge states:

original: khyad par gyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: A term that specifies is as follows:

original: 'du byed rnams mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang sems can thams cad mthar 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pa'i don gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang sems can thams cad mthar 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pa'i don gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the teachings that all compounded phenomena are impermanent and that all sentient beings will eventually die.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti and the Bodhisattvabhumi explain this for the most part in agreement with this.🔽Moreover, the Bodhisattvabhumi explains:

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ming rnams kyi mtha' blangs nas mngon du mi gsal ba'i don gsal bar ston pa'i phyir ming zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /🔽bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las @146a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ming rnams kyi mtha' blangs nas mngon du mi gsal ba'i don gsal bar ston pa'i phyir ming zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste / bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las @146a * //
translated: Because names are taken up to the limit and their meaning is clearly revealed, they are called names.

original: kyang de skad du bstan to //
analyzed: kyang de skad du bstan to //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti also teaches this.

original: rgya gar skad du byanydza na zhes bya ba bsgyur na yig 'bru zhes zer te /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du byanydza na zhes bya ba bsgyur na yig 'bru zhes zer te /
translated: The Indian language word vyañjana is translated as “syllable.”

original: 'di ni gtsug lag gi tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni gtsug lag gi tshig go //
translated: This is a technical term.

original: rgya gar skad du aaksha ra zhes bya ba bsgyur na yi ge zhes zer te /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du aaksha ra zhes bya ba bsgyur na yi ge zhes zer te /
translated: The Indian language word akṣara is translated as “letter.”

original: 'di ni phal che ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni phal che ba'i tshig go //
translated: This is a common term.

original: yig 'bru dang yi ge zhes bya ba gcig pa nyid du mi shes su dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yig 'bru dang yi ge zhes bya ba gcig pa nyid du mi shes su dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: The term “syllable” is not to be confused with the term “letter.”

original: kha cig las yig 'bru ni yi ge nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig las yig 'bru ni yi ge nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Some texts explain that a syllable is a letter.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon ba sna tshogs kun las btus pa las yi ge'i tshogs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon ba sna tshogs kun las btus pa las yi ge'i tshogs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Abhidharma treatise entitled Compendium of Abhidharma states, “The collection of syllables is as follows:

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas yi ge rnams la yi ge'i tshogs zhes gdags te zhes 'byung ste /🔽'di nyid kyi bshad pa las de gnyi ga'i gnas yi ge rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas yi ge rnams la yi ge'i tshogs zhes gdags te zhes 'byung ste / 'di nyid kyi bshad pa las de gnyi ga'i gnas yi ge rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The collection of syllables is designated as the basis of both of those.”

original: ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par tshig bla dags kyi gnas su gyur pa'i yi ge rnams te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par tshig bla dags kyi gnas su gyur pa'i yi ge rnams te /
translated: The commentary to that treatise states, “The basis of both of those is the syllables that are the basis of the terms that are distinguished by their intrinsic natures.

original: dper na aa ai au zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na aa ai au zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the syllables a, ai, au, and so on.”

original: yig 'bru ni sgrib par byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: yig 'bru ni sgrib par byed pa'i don te /
translated: The term “syllable” means that which obscures.

original: de gnyi ga'i sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it obscures both of those.

original: yig 'bru ni gsal bar byed pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yig 'bru ni gsal bar byed pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: A syllable is also called a manifestor.

original: don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it manifests the meaning.

original: 'di ni yi ge zhes kyang bya ste tha dad par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni yi ge zhes kyang bya ste tha dad par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also called a letter because it is not applied to something else.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dper na mig la mig ces bya ba ni ming de las gud na gzhan gsal bar byed pa dang / khrid byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gi rnam grangs su 'gyur zhing 'jug pa yod pas de dag gi dbang gis mtshungs par de'i mtshan nyid rab tu ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na mig la mig ces bya ba ni ming de las gud na gzhan gsal bar byed pa dang / khrid byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gi rnam grangs su 'gyur zhing 'jug pa yod pas de dag gi dbang gis mtshungs par de'i mtshan nyid rab tu ston pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the word eye is a synonym for eye, and it is applied to that which illuminates and leads.

original: aa ai la sogs pa'i yi ge ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: aa ai la sogs pa'i yi ge ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The letters a, i, etc., are not like that.

original: aa ai la sogs pa'i khyad par las logs shig na khyad par gzhan gyis yi ge 'di dag rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: aa ai la sogs pa'i khyad par las logs shig na khyad par gzhan gyis yi ge 'di dag rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Apart from the distinctions of a, i, etc., there is no other distinction that teaches those letters.

original: tha dad pa med par 'jug pa la yi ge zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par 'jug pa la yi ge zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, they are explained as letters that are applied without distinction.

original: de la tha dad pa med par 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa med par 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In that regard, application without distinction means:

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: it is not applied to something else.

original: bstan bcos phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
translated: The treatise, the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, the Compendium of Knowledge, and the Levels of Yogic Deeds also explain them in this way.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Moreover, the treatise, the Levels of Yogic Deeds, states:

original: ming dang tshig gi rjes su gsal bar byed pa'i phyir yi ge zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ming dang tshig gi rjes su gsal bar byed pa'i phyir yi ge zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because they illuminate the names and phrases, they are called letters.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise, the Rational System of Exposition, also explains them in accordance with this.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang /
translated: The explanation of their nature

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis sgra las logs shig na @146b ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yod do //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis sgra las logs shig na @146b ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yod do //
translated: is that according to the scriptures of the Sarvāstivāda, they exist as a nature that is separate from sound.

original: de yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: They are also subsumed within the aggregate of nonassociated compositional factors.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the teachings in the treatise, the Rational System of Exposition.

original: mdo sde pa dag ni sgra la brten nas btags pa tsam du ming la sogs pa zhes zer bas de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /🔽kha cig na re sgra'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag ni sgra la brten nas btags pa tsam du ming la sogs pa zhes zer bas de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de / kha cig na re sgra'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas say that names and so on are imputed to depend on sound, so they also have three explanations.

original: sgra las logs shig na ming dang tshig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: sgra las logs shig na ming dang tshig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say they are subsumed by the base of sound because names, phrases and so on do not exist separately from sound.

original: kha cig na re chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin te yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam kho na yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin te yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam kho na yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say they are subsumed by the base of mental objects because they are merely mental consciousness alone.

original: kha cig na re sgra'i skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re sgra'i skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say they are subsumed by both the base of sound and the base of mental objects.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, when applied to the teaching of the Mahayana,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pas btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pas btags pa yin gyi /
translated: they are imputed because they are subsumed by the aggregate of nonconcurrent formation.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: They do not substantially exist.

original: zhib tu ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no /
analyzed: zhib tu ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no /
translated: In detail, it is as taught in the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Extensive differentiation should be understood as it occurs in the teaching on the characteristics.

original: de dag so so las yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzhi pa ma 'dres par rnam par bshad pa bston to //
analyzed: de dag so so las yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzhi pa ma 'dres par rnam par bshad pa bston to //
translated: The fourth, unmixed perfect knowledge, is taught by the question, “What is the individual perfect knowledge?” and so on.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa'o //
translated: This is also taught by the question and the answer. This is the question.

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The second correct answer is, “It is attention focused on the unmixed.”

original: 'di ltar ming la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brjod pa dang / nus pa so so tha dad par shes pa gang yin pa de ni so so ba las so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brjod pa dang / nus pa so so tha dad par shes pa gang yin pa de ni so so ba las so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: Thus, individual perfect knowledge is the knowledge of the individual, distinct expressions and potencies of the unmixed characteristics of name and so on.

original: de dag bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lnga pa 'dris pa rnam par bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lnga pa 'dris pa rnam par bshad pa bstan to //
translated: The fifth, the explanation of familiarity, is indicated by the question “What is the correct understanding of the familiar?” and so on.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also indicated by the question and answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The attention that focuses on the familiar.

original: gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /🔽'di ltar ming la sogs pa rnam pa gsum 'dres pa gcig tu bsdus nas brjod @147a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste / 'di ltar ming la sogs pa rnam pa gsum 'dres pa gcig tu bsdus nas brjod @147a * //
translated: This is the correct answer.

original: par bya ba'i don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'dres pa yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par bya ba'i don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'dres pa yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three types of names and so on are combined into one and called the correct understanding of the familiar because the meaning that is to be expressed is comprehended.

original: 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa de dag rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa lnga yod pa ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa de dag rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa lnga yod pa ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the familiar and the unfamiliar should be understood as having five aspects, as previously indicated.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa mjug bsdu ba yin pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa mjug bsdu ba yin pa rig par bya'o //
translated: The summary at the end of the fourth is to be understood as having combined all of those, it is called the correct understanding of the teachings.

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The explanation of the second, the correct understanding of the meaning, is taught from here: Son of noble family, those bodhisattvas become endowed with the correct understanding of the meaning through ten aspects.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi don rig par 'gyur bar bstan pa dang / shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi don rig par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi don rig par 'gyur bar bstan pa dang / shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi don rig par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the correct understanding of the meaning through knowing the meaning of śamatha and vipaśyanā, and the explanation of the correct understanding of the meaning through the three types of wisdom.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na shes rab rnam pa gsum ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'i nang du ma gtogs pas /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na shes rab rnam pa gsum ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'i nang du ma gtogs pas /
translated: In another enumeration, since the three types of wisdom are not included within the correct understanding of the meaning,

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa de nyid kyang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa de nyid kyang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: that correct understanding of the meaning itself is divided into four parts.

original: don rnam pa bcu las brtsams nas /
analyzed: don rnam pa bcu las brtsams nas /
translated: The correct understanding of meaning is explained in terms of ten topics.🔽The correct understanding of meaning is explained in terms of five topics.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa dang don rnam pa lnga las brtsams nas don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa dang don rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa dang don rnam pa lnga las brtsams nas don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa dang don rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas /
translated: The correct understanding of meaning is explained in terms of four topics.
